column1: YOGURT missing on the trays-For breakfast service yogurt was missing in all trays.-Menu states that we should have yogurt on the breakfast tray.
Yogurt missing from breakfast trays.- During breakfast service, crew informed me that approximately eight trays were missing the yogurt.
Yogurt consistency -Customer complaint that the yogurt(on breakfast tray) is watery and residues built up underneath.-Yogurt brand: Zottis yogurtCustomer info: yolly-airoldi@hispeed.ch

Yogini displayed very good team sprit on this journey.We had no customers in first class and she participated in all the services in economy class.Her colleagues were appreciative of her support to the team.

YOGHURT NOT LOADED ON BREAKFAST TRAYSPlease be informed that yoghurt was not loaded on EY meal trays for the breakfast service.Yoghurt is featured in the EY menu. 2 customers had inquired and crew explained that it is not loaded and apologised.
Yoghurt not available on the tray as per the menu.

customer informed Cabin Supervisor that the Amarula Cream had expired.Code on bottle reads: 11 1 17 EAll remaining bottles in Y/C and J/C checked. Same code on all bottles except one bottle, which read: 1 11 17 C

CATERING FEEDBACK- Before landing, I asked Mr. Denisse if he had any feedback for the company or anything he would like to see different.- Mr. Denisse stated that over the past couple years, the Y/C appetiser on the tray has gradually become "less luxurious" (e.g. no more salmon and potato salad), and more and more "bird seed" (e.g. quinoa and barley).- The appetisers have become "very poor" in his words.- He stated that some "salmon or chicken" would be nice.
SPML request.Please uplift AVML for customer for her on ward connection.
Ginger ale on high demand.High demand for ginger ale. Please uplift more or these sectors.
Cake provided from MXP-Customer Mr Augusto Lotorto seated on 17C was provided with a cake by MXP catering. -No special request on KIS/PIL for cake.
CLASS CREW MEAL 6 BEING PUMPKING RAVIOLI- Y class crew complained that 6/8 crew meals were pumpkin ravioli

Wrong SPML provided.- The customer was provided with a VLML tray and desert but the Hot meal was NLML.- The provided NLML was a chicken breast served with rice.- Due to the customers dietary requirements she could not eat it and crew member offered a crew hot meal (pumpkin ravioli).- No complaints was received from the customer.
WRONG MENU TERM-Meal is described as "BARBECUE BEEF SHORT RIBS" but the beef looks more of a steak than ribs.-Customer was unhappy stating that menu was misleading.

Wrong meal choice-During breakfast service, cabin crew Aldo noticed 5 meals that weren't from the menu.-Breakfast menu options were omelette and scrambled eggs, and one oven insert was full of chicken.
Wrong loading of canape. Menu says hummus with lamb Baharat but we were loaded with hummus only and rice balls instead
Wrong dessert catered Dessert on the menu for this sector was chocolate tart.Dessert actually catered was an Arabic cream pastry (same  as the DXB-KWI sector)

would like to highlight the performance of my team on this flight .Crew members in economy were all brilliant.Crew members were very happy, smiley always and working hard without me asking them.We had issues with the luggage on those sectors and the purser requested from economy crew to be very efficient to make sure all customers are seated to close the doors, and the crew worked so hard to make customers sit down with all the bags secured in the hatrack.Crew were helping each other without hearing that's my side or that's your side.Crew were always preparing things in the galley without me tempting them.The other CSV Ramya gave feedback as well that they are all amazing.

Would like to compliment all economy crew members for their hard work , showed good team spirit through out the trip.Challenges which they encounter were,Turbulence,Handle Medical case. EK Standards were met . On a full cabin.All above challenges were not only encounter with utmost professionalism despite the fact of one crew short in economy.
Would like to cancel spml order
Would like to cancel her vgml from her profile

WORKING OUT OF GRADE: ASSISTING IN OTHER CABINS-This is to document Mohamed's positive contribution to this flight and highlight how he has been of great support to his colleagues-Mohamed is a Business class crew member and has been rostered to work in the Economy cabin for this month of January-He came to the briefing prepared and ready for the flight where he had familiarised himself with the service and volunteered to operate the Economy class mid-galley-He was very comfortable and efficient with it: ran galley checks promptly, communicated with his senior with what was available in his galley and most importantly had all service items prepared well in time before boarding-During the flight, Mohamed made it his responsibility to have everything ready for his colleagues to go in the cabin: he was 2 steps ahead of services steps which allowed him to even take a cart into the cabin and help his colleagues with a full flight-He made sure he took the cart that kept him closer to the galley so he could assist with refilling bars, assisting his colleagues with special requests during the service-He was certainly one of the busiest crew members in the cabin-After finishing the service in Y. class, Mohamed went to help in J. class where he was seen clearing food items, trays and preparing drinks, etc-He was not asked to do so and later shared that "I know how busy the service can be in Business class so I wanted to help my colleagues"

WORKED OUT OF GRADE-Noraen worked efficiently in JC with the rest of the crew.-He took the initiative to learn the fine details which make our JC cabins so desirable to work in.-His buddy and his peers were happy to be working with him.
WL -CHML not on board

Without being asked he took out a foundation bag and placed in the CWS for the purser.He was observed spending a lot of time with children throughout the flight and used the camera several times to make someone's day even before top of descent.He was a great team worker and assisted his colleaguesHe visited every galley and had conversation with crew from business class and first classHe organized a meal for one crew who could not eat the only option left, she was really surprised.He asked a lot of questions about first class product and showed a genuine interest for first class productsHe introduced himself to the UM and looked after her throughout the flight.He made conversation with her and entertained her.He had a great and positive body language and all crew got really along with him.His smile and his positive attitude and his great communication skills make him a great asset for Emirates

Without being asked he took out a foundation bag and placed in the CWS for the purser.He was observed spending a lot of time with children throughout the flight and used the camera several times to make children day even before top of descent.He was a great teamworker and assisted his colleaguesHe visited every galley and had conversation with crew from business class and first class
With immediate effect please cancel the LCML on the customers profile as this is not required anymore.
Wine Menu-The port wine showing reflecting on the menu in F/Class is 1992, however we had 1963 loaded.-This was served to customer and he was very happy.
WILTED GARNISH.- The basil loaded for garnish was wilted and appeared black in colour.

WHITE WINE FEEDBACK.- Miss Cobbold had a sip of  the Henri de Villamont Chassagne-Montrachet 1er Cru Morgeot 2011, Burdundy from France (white wine) and she didn't like the taste at all.- She described the taste as corked.

While receiving feedback from Ms Habib she mentioned that that quality of the food in EK is gone down considerably.During the flight she had only cold cuts that to upon crew insisting on her eating as she hungry .She also added that her kids who were travelling with her from BEY-DXB were not happy about the child meal they received.

While preparing for landing Mr. Zachariah  Saad hand me over a note that was stated the following : "the service that Carly provided was 150% fantastic. Very friendly and caring, I believe that she is an asset to Emirates.I will travel on Emirates again because of her service. Thank you Zachariah Saad seat 61J"This note was about cabin crew Carly 435127
While Hazel was doing her rotation a she engaged one of the customers who was standing at the aft toilet. The customer was pleased with the work she was doing and came to tell me about.
while doing the meal appreciation round the customer told me that she didn't like the GFML fish .

While customers were disembarking I was stopped by a customer to inform me that she is so happy with Collette performance on the flight.She stated that Collette made her flight exceptional and that she was so professional.

When I asked Mr. Greville about his overall experience, he mentioned that he was very impressed with the economy class team and particularly mentioned cabin crew member GR2 Kelly Dugas 444304 who according to the customer, truly made a difference. He further mentioned that GR2 Kelly readily offered assistance to him, his wife and their children during boarding,  offered empty seats for more comfort and regular looked after their needs throughout the flight.

When CSV Paolo staff no. 376784 went to platinum customer Mr. Woolgar's seat 14K to bid farewell, customer mentioned that he had an excellent flight. And then he stated that cabin crew Hiwot staff no. 420920 gave him an excellent service. As a frequent flyer, he said that Hiwot is meticulous on how she presents that products and had a pleasant personality. He also mentioned that "she is a great crew and I want to write a compliment about her"

When CSV Paolo staff no. 376784 went to Mr. Woolgar's seat to bid farewell, customer mentioned that he had an excellent flight. And then he stated that cabin crew Hiwot staff no. 420920 gave him an excellent service. As a frequent flyer, he said that Hiwot is meticulous on how she presents that products and had a pleasant personality. He also mentioned that "she is a great crew and I want to write a compliment about her"
When asked for feedback at the end of the flight, all First Class customers stated that they had a very nice flight.

Weng worked as GR1 on DXB-MXP and as GR2 on the remaining sectors. I had the opportunity to be his supervisor on DXB-MXP and JFK-MXP. Weng is a very professional and hardworking crew member. While he worked in business class he ensured he used the MOD professionally and correctly and spoke to all his customers and welcomed them and introduced them to their seats. During the flight he was very attentive to his customers and ensured all of them were well looked after. He also took over the lounge several times and served many customers and also gave a break to the original lounge operator.While working in economy he was very proactive during boarding and engaged with his customers. During the flight he was very quick with setting up carts and indulges into conversation while serving customers. He also celebrated birthday for a customer with a special rose and J class dessert and card signed by all crew. His style of work is very clean, professional and premium.
We were short of about 30 chicken hot meal choices for dinnerThe ratio for this flight was 25% chicken 75% vegetarian which was way to low on chicken
We were short of about 20 lamb hot meal choices for the serviceThe ratio was supposed to be 40% lamb and 60% vegetarian however it was more like 30% lamb and 70% vegetarian
we were missing 15 passenger meals for the service and several customers didn't get their preferred meal choice

We were given one bag of leaves and one tray for toppings which is enough for 3-4 people6 customers requested saladWe were also given 5 beef and 3 fois gras 5 customers requested fois gras and 1 customer requested beef

We were catered for 1 customer in FC, 25 in JC and 255 in YC for this sector.On arrival to DMM, ground staff asked me if we can accept 1/31/258, as there was last minute transfer of some customers from KLM to our flight.

We were catered 8 desserts for a cabin of 10 customers.We had 2 desserts of each choice.This made the service really difficult for us.We also had 2 of each choice of the light bites service.Customers wanted choices that we had run out.

WE WERE catered 4 meals for 4 customers in F class - ( 1 of each choice)All customers ate on the flight and as such we were short of meal choices and 3 of them ordered prawnsWe had to take meals from J class for the customers

WE were booked 12 PAXFinal was 10 PAXWe were given 1 cheese board. 1 cheese board is for 8 pax.Tried to explain to the supervisor who apparently was informed by EKFC that SYD doesn't get 2 cheese boards. 1 Cheese board for 14 PAX is regular for SYD flights.
WE RUN OUT OF CHICKEN DURING SERVICE.- We could not offer chicken as their first choice of meal to around 20 people.

We ran out of salad and cheese on this sector.We had a load of 7 passengers (config-8)We were catered one small pack of cheese with 4 slices of each cheese inside. We had one set of salad which contained a small bag of lettuce and 2 x prawn proteins and 2 x beef proteins. Several passengers wanted only a green salad without the protein, however we did not have enough.We would have offered a crew salad instead however, as usual, the crew salad was brown and inedible.
We have excellent crew on this flight's EK161 and EK 162 all the customers they were happy and satisfy on both sector  I received feedback form customers during flights and during disembarking .

we have been catered for 32 customers and we have been given 12 croissants only .this is my second flight to NCL in less than two weeks and we have the same problem that we run out of croissants after we served the first 12 customers and it was so embarrassing to decline the J/C customers request for a croissant and that make them very upset because they paid a lot of money to fly J/C and we can not offer them a croissant as they advised me .
We had shortage for HNML-We catered 60% HNML and 40% AVML for Lunch.-About 5 customers didn't get their first choice.
We had shortage for HNML -We catered for 60% AVML and 40%HNML .-We had shortage for HNML as requested more from customers.-About 5 customers didn't get their first choice as HNML.
we had different canapés loaded from the menu choice ,the menu had smoked salmon and we had catered Foie gras .
We had a check captain on our flight, but there were no sandwiches, meal or meal tray loaded for him.
We had 4 customers and all of them chose the lamb as main course. There was only 3 Lambs loaded.- One customer accepted to change her meal and did not complain.
We had 3  customers, 2 hot meal and 2 cold plate was loaded.Flight was late for 2hours and 2 customers wanted cold plate.
We entered 2018 while boarding the flight back to Dubai.Crew members brought props (hats, tiaras, decorations)Lounge and galleys were decorated for the flight.
We did not receive any lemon portion (lemon wedge in the nets bag) for caviar plating purposes.Instead we had double portion of egg whites.
We did not have the cucumber rubans for the cocktail loaded in the galley.

Was the First Class overall experience achieved for this customer?    yes as there was no complaints from the customers and all their requests were achieved.How was the customer's experience portrayed at the end of the flight?   while conducting the final purser rotate , customers stated that they enjoyed the flight.During your conversation with the customer, did you find them to have any suggestions/concerns beyond the standard First Class experience?All customers stated that they enjoyed the flight

WAITLISTED AVML-customer did not receive his AVML as it was waitlisted -lunch menu was a avml option-light bites and breakfast there was no avml option-no further action necessary as pax going to DELHI next flight

Wael Douk great performance on EK 236 ORD-DXB, 19-01-2018- During customers were disembarking from business class, at least 7 of them personally thanked GR2 Wael Douk s409564 for his excellent service. I was standing next to Wael by the door.- Customers addressed Wael with the following appreciations: "Thank you for your great service!"; "Thank you for making a difference!"; "Thank you so much Wael, we will fly with Emirates again!"; "Thank you for taking care of us, it's greatly appreciated!"- Wael was working as a GR1 for both sectors.

VJML ORDERED BUT WASN'T AVAILABLE- During catering checks, the catering staff from GLA pointed out that it has been ordered 1 VJML instead of 2 VJML. - When presenting the meal checklist, the number of VJML was 2 but the catering staff in GLA modified to 1 as there was no second meal available.- After the flight details were complete on the KIS tablet and the PIL presented at the end of boarding, I printed the stickers and observed that there are 2 VJML.- Ms Morrison was traveling with 48E - Mr. Thompson that was having also a VJML ordered.- Ms. Morrison specified that she is having a connecting flight and if it's possible to have her meal available on the next sector.- the Customer in 48E - Mr. Thompson had the VJML, and Ms. Morrison had the chicken.

VJML not provided.Customer claimed she ordered the meal 48hours before the flight.The PIL was showing the meal was waitlisted, when explained the situation, customer stated she was very disappointed. Please ensure VJML is provided for the next sectors.

Viktoria High PerformanceI would like to highlight such out standing performance for the crew member Viktoria ZamecnikovaCustomer service:Interacting with customers at all time since boarding and through out the flight.Smiling at all the time to customers and also her colleagues.Team work:She is always volunteer for any tasks, first at all the time for we care after the service final clearance before landing.Supporting her colleague, Lounge and galley operators.Image:Always up to standard even after CRC rest.   ALL THE BEST VIKTORIA, AND I HOPE TO FLY WITH YOU AGAIN

View positive behaviours I observed from Lisa : * She actively prepare dismantle all equipment for the service on every sector  work together.* She maintained communication with through out the flight on both sectors for many concern related with customers.* She made sure all customers get as per their request interim service.* She took over galley and completed service with other team members when I am dealing with medical situation.* She communicated with all team members on all two sectors.

VERY LOW NUMBER OF LIGHT BITES- The number of hot pies for the Light Bites service was very low. - Towards the end of the service there were no pies left. - The cabin crew could not offer hot pies to customers in rows 37 - 40 F, G, H, J, K.

Very happy with the Y class crew all through out the flight- During the flight just before top of decent, Mr Okpon called for me (Supervisor) and informed me how happy and impressed he was with the crew and the service.- He claimed that every time he presses the call bell the crews responsiveness was impeccable - He also mentioned that everyone was accommodating and helpful

Vera displayed advanced organizational skills on this flight.She took initiative serving the cockpit after boarding without being asked. Crew took initiative during a delay on ground and prepared all drawers, bars and clearance carts for the service. Vera filled the juice order form and closed all bars and containers during cruise without being asked.All the above was communicated with me clearly. Vera brought her own stickers from home and entertained families with kids in a personal and memorable way.Vera has a fast work pace and a friendly warm personality. She was an asset to the team and a pleasure to work with.

Veljko worked in business class on this sector.He was briefed on service steps and picked up the information very quickly, maintaining standards and working in a calm and organised manner.He was warm and friendly yet professional throughout. He worked well with the other GR1's.
Vegetarian-Gluten Free -Mrs. Goettlicher would like to have a vegetarian gluten free meal

Vegetarian SPML not provided-During service customer informed me that he is a vegetarian and He has not received any VEG meal option since MAN flight.- No any SPML status information on Passenger information list or KIS  was provided - Customer seemed very upset and wished to complain. Customer stated that he wants to have hot and substantial meal and hasnt eaten since MAN flight.Customer left aircraft unhappy
Vegetarian Option FeedbackVegetarian option for dinner service was not popular with the customers.The number of vegetarian meals was higher than the other two main course options.

vegetable lasagne shortage . We had 2 customers on board and both of them requested Vegetable lasagne option. We were only catered one per each choice.

VEAL SHORTAGE- 1x of each main course loaded- 1x veal consumed at the beginning of the flight by 3K- this customer also requested the veal approximately 2hours into the flight

Vanya displayed good team spirit on this journey.We had no customers in first class and she helped her colleagues in business class during the service.her colleagues were appreciative of her support to the team.

Validating F/C customers experience:- F/C crew were briefed about the customers and any observed preferences.- I personally welcomed F/C customers at the door, and crew escorted them to their seats.- I personally introduced myself, and offered the menus.- Meal appreciation completed, and customers were happy with the food and service provided to them.- During my farewell rotation, feedback from customers was positive, and happy to fly emirates.

Upon disembarkation, customer Mr.Akhilesh 21C asked to speak to me at L2 door.He informed me that he wanted to express his gratitude to Mira. He stated that he was impressed with how she interacted with all customers around him, the "kindness and warmth shown with a smile on her face". He also said that she was the "best cabin crew he had seen in a long time."
UPLIFTED CATERING FROM SKT, PRESENTATION AND QUALITY.- Business class food presentation, loaded to us today was:- Presented in boxes.- Disposable cups.- Disposable dessert dish.- Disposable cutlery.
Upgraded Customers:-Ground staff informed me about 5 customers who were upgraded to JC-We were catered for only 23 customers and we had 28 as our final load

Unhappy Customer>During lunch service customer stated that the Hindu meal they pre ordered shouldn't be chicken and they don't want chicken.>Customer said that it should be lamb or fish.>Customer claimed that in their previous flight they had lamb as main course.>Customer and his family of three had chicken as main course but the gentleman claimed that he doesn't eat chicken.

UNDERCOOKED BREAD- Mrs. Shah had breakfast after take-off. - She informed Sam (Purser) when she was clearing her meal that the Puri (bread) was undercooked. - She was not upset or angry. - She relaxed in her suite and disembarked as per normal.

Unavailable meal choice -the chicken meal option was very popular on the flight ,therefore approximately 25 customers did not receive their preferred meal choice -loading percentage 60 /40 suggested 70/30

Unavailable meal choice -the chicken meal option was very popular on the flight ,therefore approximately 20 customers did not receive their preferred meal option -catering percentage 60% lamb 40 % chicken , suggested 50/50

Two pears of the FC social area were bruised/spoiled.

Two different types of presentations for the same dessert.Banoffee Pie (banana & cramel pie topped with Chocolate)one was in a square Biscuit Base whilst the other was in a round Base

TWO DIFFERENT CHICKEN MEAL CHOICES.As per the menu we were suppose to have  chicken in creamy mushroom sauce served with gnocchi .Meal  choice provided was chicken served with rice and broccoli.A few of the casseroles had chicken with gnocchi.

Tristan was observed for both sector of the flight.He was always showing initiative towards both crew and customers.He was observed helping wheelchair customers and families with babies.he was also helping crew in the galley and cabin alike.

TRAY IS TOO FULL, MAKES LOADING DIFFICULT- Trays are too full, the bread is big and is loaded where the hot meal has to be placed.- Before loading, it takes time to push the bread, or the liner gets displaced while doing this as fast as possible.- In a full flight takes up to 20 minutes to re arrange all trays, delaying service.- Customers get affected by having the tray unarranged.- No complaints were received from customers, but crew struggle always when trays are like this.- Eg. From Australia, catering places a small bread on the right side of the tray, making loading very easy and trays are delivered to customers well arranged.

Tracy displayed a good team work.As it was my first time to work as CSV in A380 Yclass, along with her colleagues, she prepared tea/coffee in advance. The way she set up the bar was excellent.She also looked after cockpit crew very well.She interacted with crew very well by using their languages.

Tough beef fillet.- While checking for meal appreciation, Mr Pollard stated to me that the beef maincourse that he had chosen was tough and that it would have been more enjoyable if it would have been more tender.- The customer however did not wish to change his meal.

Total catering loaded was 14Total customer load was 15-Ground staff informed us that Mrs Anam ( subload ) has been briefed that she will receive y/c meal.-All customers was eating in j/c. Mrs. Anam was approached and offered the j/c hot meal Chicken explaining the situation however she was not happy to have the chicken.
Total catering for F/C was 0Total catering for J/C 29With the last minute changes total load was 1 in F/c and 35 in J/C.

Toni was operating out of grade as she is FG1Her professionalism in the cabin was impeccable, she initiated conversation with customers and was attentive to their needs, using names and smiling at all timesOn this sector Toni volunteered to take the galley, which she has not done in JC in around 2 years as one colleague was new to JC and the other had just returned to workShe displayed great team work and interacted in a polite , courteous manner with her colleagues
Tomato soup very popular non today's flight There were about 5 extra soup ordered today and customers feed back was very positive

Today we had 2 customers in first class. The other customer had a AVML meal ordered so there was onlu one of each choice available. Customer wanted to have the Ravioli however when we went to serve it we noticed that this menu option was not loaded and we had 2 sea bass instead of 1.

To whom it may concern:- I have to admit I was very surprised with James performance thorough the flight in both sectors.- I can tell James likes his job very much and this is reflected in the way he behaves in the cabin and towards his colleagues and customers.- He is cordial and friendly, and was observed offering alternatives when customers requests could not be fully met. Eg: moved passengers around to empty rows during boarding so they could have more space to sleep, offered different meal options when customers didn't like what was on the menu.- His image and uniform standards were immaculate at all times, after his break came to the galley fully groomed and ready to work with no delay.- Lastly he was left in charge of the galley during my absence and when I came back everything was ready to start the service straight away- Please extend my appreciation to him.

To the attention of CCM Sara alhammadi,This kis report is written to highlight the excellent galley performance and skills for your above crew member Rebecca.-Rebecca organized most of the galley preparations after she finished with her duties on ground before leaving Dubai.-Rebecca was in the cabin during boarding taking care of the j class front area and was very attentive to the customers there and communicating everything for the other crew members about the customers in this area.-Rebecca was always ahead of time by one step from the service which made the service flow go very smoothly and customers were impressed from the fast service.-Rebecca kept the galley clean and tide at all times during the service time and outside these times which created a very clean and hygienic environment.
TO INCREASE THE CHOICE OF CHICKEN - loaded 30% of chicken only and 70% of beef- Observed that some customers prefers chicken as their choice for dinner.
Three out of five customers ordered for spinach soup.All of them returned it back saying that it is not tasting good and it  was very thick

This sector needs to be loaded more Lamb Choice.Passenger Load : Full 310 in Economy ClassChicken 60%Lamb 40%Alot of customers were really upset we didnt have the lamb choice left. We were short about 50 Lamb.- Please make it 70% Lamb and 30 % chicken.

This report to highlight the excellent performance of the below crew members.Vangelitsa 429574Ruth 440927Jessica 452894Islam 434738Crew were down early for pick up and hand over documents for check,During boarding crew was observed welcoming, interacting and assisting customers.During service crew was helping each others to achieve a high standard service and good flight experience to our customers.In preparation for landing crew assisted each others in sealing galley,After landing crew was observed assisting each other with the post landing duties to minimise any delay for the cleaners and catering who was by the door to prepare the aircraft for the next flight.

This report to highlight the excellent performance of the above crew.Emily arrived early to the briefing in dxb also out station ,Emily appeared immaculate, uniform, hairstyle and makeup and unique approachable smile,Emily contribute with confidence during the teamtalk,In preparation for pre departure ,without being asked Emily took the initiative to prepare welcome drinks and menus,During boarding was observed welcoming, interacting and helping any customer in need,During service Emily was using menu terminology and hand gesture,After service and without being asked Emily prepared the towels,As a gesture of consideration and in order to allow her colleagues to have there meal break first Emily volunteers to do the first we care,During flight and without being asked: Emily offered to help in different cabins, Emily was continuing checking on cabin and toilets  Emily took over the lounge to allow lounge operator to have meal break,  Emily was always the first crew member to take the initiative of attending to call bells, Emily took the initiative in more ten one occasion to call and check on flight deck, Emily prepared the blanket bags for all her colleagues and pass it to first class, In preparation for landing Emily assisted in dismantling the lounge  Emily assisted in sealing the galley,I was impressed by Emily team work ,proactivity and considerations towards customers and colleagues,The most hardworking crew member I flown with in 15 years in emirates.

This report to highlight the excellent performance of J/C crew.On arrival to the aircraft,crew did cabin cleaning checks and pass it to CSV.during boarding crew was observed welcoming and assisting customers specifically parents with kids.As we head extra time on ground crew got the Polaroid camera and take pictures of the child on 20E as he is the only child in J/C.During service crew was helping each others to speed up service time and maximize customers rest.After service crew start taking over the lounge one by one 15minutes each to allow lounge operator to have a meal break.Without being told we care schedule was followed and both cabin and toilet was meeting the standards.Throughout the flight crew show lots of interest in customers needs and request by doing the cabin presence.Crew offered to help in different cabins after finishing there duties.Crew was a role model for emirates image and uniform as they were observed at all times replenishing make up before stepping into the cabin.In preparation for landing crew help each others with blanket collection and sealing the galley.Service sequence was followed throughout the flight ,I was impressed by the team work that I observed, this team was proactive, friendly helpful and approachable and this has being highlighted to me by colleagues and customers also observed by me.

This report to highlight the excellent performance of Colette 450898.Colette arrived early to briefing introduced her self to seniors and hand over documents for check.During briefing was interactive and shared her previous experience for the flight.Colette answered safe talk with confidence.During boarding was observed smiling in the cabin, welcoming and assisting any customer in need.During service and after finishing her cart Colette double ended with other crew .Colette was observed in few occasions helping her colleagues voluntarily,In preparation for landing Colette sealed the galley and had blanket bags ready for all crew also went to the cockpit and offer them last drink before landing.Collette effort on the flight was highlighted to me by her colleagues and observed by me.

This KIS report was raised to compliment on Larry's exceptional customer service on all sectors.-He was observed carrying a Captain hat which he bought from the EK store and he used it whilst taking photos of the kids in all cabin, Y and J class. The customers were so impressed and happy to have a remembrance of their children wearing the Emirates captain hat.-The customer seated at 10D who was traveling with her little boy stated that Emirates never ceased in giving them surprising treats but our flight was the most remarkable one as his little boy is dreaming to be a pilot someday and the photo will always remind him of his one big dream.

This KIS report has been raised , as per requested by Platinum Customer Mr . Lahlou .( 20K ) .* Mr. Lahlou has stated that crew member Eleonora was extremely friendly and approachable .* The Customer was impressed with Eleonara's professionalism and efforts to ensure, Customer comfort was achieved at 100%.Feedback received from Cabin Supervisor Judy ( 283592 ) reflected similar comments , for cabin crew Eleonora.
This is to inform you that Mr Costa would like to cancel his special meal from his profilePlease do the needful

This is to highlight the amazing performance of Lin s449438.- Lin from the briefing out of Dubai until landing back to Dubai, she was positive, always smiling and professional.- Her positivity spread in the cabin to her colleagues and mostly her customers.- I have observed her during boarding introducing herself to her customers, trying to get to know them and mainly she was showing how friendly she was.- Customer were always keen to speak to her and joke with her.- She was observed playing with babies, offering a mother travelling with a baby, to wash her baby bottle and offered her to look after her baby while she goes to the lavatory.- During the service Lin was observed helping her colleagues with carts, bars and clearance carts.- She was also observed using full menu terminology and delivering her trays and drinks with a genuine smile.- After the service a customer vomited on herself, Lin with no hesitation put on gloves, brought her some hot towels, a plastic bag and assisted her to change her clothes and reassured her, while she was taking samples, and passed the information to her seniors.

This is to highlight CSA high performance on EK 449.Sushma Thapa  448144 was only CSA in flight from AKL to DXB as another CSA had to operate MEL sector due to sickness crew.Sushma was super hard working, she completed her duty without any delay, she managed to prepare the shower Spa for 8 customers, as well completed several rotation in economy class.Lavatories in business and economy class were replenished very frequently and sprayed.Sushma made sure that shower Spa and clean, tidy and well prepared at all times during 16 hours flight.Remained calm and positive under pressure, always smiling and open for any feed back.I received great comments about Sushma from our first class customers highlighting her professionalism, hospitality and customers service.

This is to highlight crew member AGNIEESZKA s452529 team work spirit on the return sector.Despite the fact, that economy cabin was very light, AGI took the initiative to work in Business class from the start of the flight. She was seen very comfortable, dealing with customers, communicating with fellow crew to clarify doubts and make sure she delivers a premium cabin customer service.
This is to comment on the ratio of meals ( AVML to None AVML ) :Catering advised CSV in Y/C that the ratio is 70% AVML to 30% None AVML, but the actual load on-board was (90% AVML to 10% None AVML)

This is to comment on the excellent performance of vasileios on this flight. I had the pleasure of working with him on both sectors and it was a pleasure.He is outstanding, organized, friendly and easy to relate right from Briefing.Once on board he takes every opportunity he has to plan ahead both for customers and the service.Once on board both sectors he assisted with checking catering ,arranging bars for service and even preparing drink drawers for the main service storing them neatly arranged and ensured he passed the information to other crew.By the time the customers arrived he was ready in the can greeting and assisting them to their seats with a smile. He helped them settle down ensuring he paid special attention to mothers with infants, checked pregnant lady letter and ensured she got extra seats so that she could rest. Every time he called for reset he did ensure he followed up and informed me.After the service he would walk to the cabin and check the welfare of customers .we care was done on time ,call bells answered on time and did offer colleagues help at all times. He helped maintain a sparkling clean galley. His colleagues also praised him for a job well done. He sure is a role model and sets a good example to colleagues who didn't hesitate to follow his professional working ticket. Thanks for an amazing new year flight. Please keep up.ANNASTASIA MUCHIRU.

This is to advise you of Mohamed Eltamalawy's (s389851) excellent performance on the above flight.It is my second time that I have a pleasure to report about the work he does. Mohamed is consistently doing a great job. He is always very positive, smiling and approachable giving his team and customers easy communication channel. His hard work and his interaction with colleagues earned him much praise from colleagues and seniors alike. He is very flexible when it comes to choosing positions, he follows required standards and had an out-of-the-box approach to problems that arose onboard. He was observed doing clearance carts in the cabin and was always in control of his cabin and tasks that needed to be completed. He was also delivering feedback promptly and accordingly and was meeting all the required standards.But, primarily, aside of all the above, Mohamed leaves his coworkers and customers with a warm felling that comes from interaction with such a genuine, positive and hardworking person which makes him one of the best that EK has.

This is to advise you of an excellent performance of FC team on the above flight.On one of the busiest flights I have done in quite some time, these 4 crewmembers have displayed amazing level of teamwork, customer service and interaction.On both sectors, Sheila was in the cabin in addition to great galley management, Sebastian was assisting on Tarek's side and vice versa and Charina was of immense help in the galley since she was putting away clearance items in order for crew to attend to customers in the cabin faster, as well as he helped with the social area.High work load and constant pressure did not affect this team and they worked in harmony throughout and dealt with any issues professionally and promptly. Very busy flight did not affect their customer interaction either. Many praises and compliments were received about the crew working in the cabin. Two gentleman were escorting ladies down the stairs, as well as customers requiring wheelchairs. Despite very busy FC, Tarek managed to help out in JC in addition, while Sebastian was performing his DF duties. Amazing individual and team performance. It was such a pleasure to work with this team of professionals that leave everlasting impression on their colleagues and customers.

This is Miss Lidia's first experience in first class. We introduced to her the details of first class suite functions and entertainment system. And we explained the food menu to her. Miss Lidia was impressed with our service standard and she enjoyed the flight very much .

This is a small note of appreciation and praising the great performance of Vivek.He has showed several positive behaviours.- Vivek arrived early to EGHQ and arranged the purser's folder with all the needed documents for both sectors.- When seniors were on break Vivek took the responsibility of the 03 cabins and resolved several complaints in Y/C making sure they were rectified and documented to the appropriate departments.- Vivek observed that one of the lavatories was not well serviced and several call bells were delayed to be answered in Y/C in the absence of the other CSV. Vivek did not hesitate to address the crew on the spot and gather Y/C team and made sure they were aware of the shortfalls.- Grade1 called sick on the return sector, Vivek supported and welcomed any assistance from other grades, he added an amazing effort to cover the gap of his colleague and did not change his positive approach towards his colleagues and customers regardless of the high pressure and demand of a buy flight.
They thought they had ordered a CHML, but not on PIL.

There were only HB meals (6 casseroles) loaded and 1 pack of cold cuts, 6 plain yogurts, fruits loaded for YC crew. There were also HB crew meals loaded in JC and FC.There were 8HL casseroles crew meals loaded in JC - no other cabin had HL crew meals.
There were only five crew meals loaded for 16 crew on a 15-hour-flight.-Catering loaded 5 crew meals in the bulk cart in economy aft galley for the entire flight.
There were only 2 Samundari Khazana loaded.Had to deny 2 customers.
There were no salad dressing or balsamic and olive oil catered in FC even though a small side salad was part of the FC tray setting.
There were insufficient lemon slices loaded.8 lemon slices were loaded for First Class cabin.

There was one bulk cart missing in the galley which usually contains shower spa fruits, social area sandwiches and fruits, yogurt, shower spa ginger and lemon selection of pastries and  cold plate for the breakfast menu, catering supervisor informed me  that he has requested for the uplift but due to lack of time I had to decide not to wait for it.

There was one Azazy family in F/C and Mr. Alaleeli in 2AAll of them said that they enjoyed the flight and complimented the crewMr. Edidi in 2K said that the team is very good today. They are very fast in everything, also in delivering duty free promptlyThey said that they were well looked after and thanked us while disembarking
There was no soy milk on VGML tray.Please try and arrange soy milk for customer.
There was no crew meals loaded for RGN/PNH/RGNit's turn around flight with 2hours 30 min transit on ground

There was no breakfast crew meals loaded for this sector at all.We leave our homes at 18:30 The night before and we get dinner items provided for DXB-BLR which are not even enough for all crew for the first sector. We finish duty in Dubai the next morning at 0730. It's a Long night duty.
There was a shortage of the 'Chicken in Black Bean Sauce' from the dinner service.Approximately 20 customers did not get there first choice of chicken.
There was a shortage of cheese boards in JC on the BEY-DXB sector.4 customers could not be served their preferred choice.
There was a GFML however it was not booked
There is a CHML request for Miss Ramshi, however it was not provided and loaded from catering coming from Dubai. Please make sure to provide the CHML on their future flights. Thanks.

The Y/C catering was less by 10 customers. the catering load was 187 while customers checked in were 197 customers.Emirates ground staff in MLE knew about the shortage and kept on accepting more customers however he briefed them that there will not be food served to them.The customers agree as per EK Staff in MLE but after boarding and take off , they all complained.
The warm dessert in provided was different from the menu.
THE TRAYS IN ECONOMY CLASS DID NOT HAVE FRUITS.Around 52 trays did not have the fruits on the tray.
The starter choices and the desserts were completely different from the menus The mods were showing the different selections

The SSQ for this flight is HB/LB/LUWe had to start the lunch service earlier as customers were hungry and 9 hours into the flight we only had cold options from the Light Bites menu to offer to customers
The soup loaded was beef consume, without any garnish, instead of courgette soup in the menu card.

The soup loaded for J/C was not matching the menu. The soup mentioned in the menu was the Mushroom soup, however the soup found in the flasks was tow different type:1-Celeria sweet potato soup.2-Spinach nutmeg soup.
The snack boxes were all used half way through the flight
The side salad provided in First class didn't look fresh at all, it had carrot and celery on top and they were very dry.Three customers highlighted the issue and none of them touched the salad.
The sandwiches loaded for lunch service were wrapped in cling film-One of the options available for lunch service was chicken schnitzel sandwich that came wrapped in cling film.
The salad most of the salad dressing was frozen.
The respective customer was happy with our approach, and service.
The ratio of omelette to rice and mutton curry for breakfast was 40:60 respectively, however, 80% of the customers on this flight are  not Asians- most of the customers were Germans and Australians.
The ratio loaded was 80 % vegetarian, and 20 %  non vegetarian.It has resulted in many customers ending up with no choice but to have the vegetarian option.

The ratio for Lunch was 60%  Lamb Sausages  and 40% for Chicken.Lamb is not popular on this sector.Approximately 25 customers didn't get their preferred meal choice.Suggestion to increase the percentage of Chicken to 50%.

The quality of croissants loaded for the breakfast service wasn't good .-The croissants were very small in size and were very chewy -They were heated appropriately ,however they were hard and tough to bite into .
The olive oil bottles were frozen. - The olive oil bottles were frozen in side the meal tray set up.

the new salad in F/C is not enough for full cabin  we had to serve  only few lettuce leaves for each customers to be sure we will have enough to serve all the them and that very embarrassing to serve them few leaves only  .- can you please load extra lettuce leaves to be able to do a proper F/C service for the customers
THE MUFFIN BREAD WAS VERY HARD- The muffin bread, (yellow in colour), which was served with each breakfast tray initially, was very hard.
The mother of Mr Luca requested for CHMl noodles.
The Moen Kari option was more popular than the Vegetable Chettinad.We were short of about 17 casseroles of the fish option.
The menu says the chicken choice is Bzar Chicken which comes with aromatic rice with fried onion. But 04 nos of casseroles were with chicken breast with makboush.

The meals loaded on the aircraft for cabin crew are not enough for everyone.There was 7 hot meals loaded in the whole aircraft (4 pasta and 3 chicken)5 salad boxes with spring beans and white beans inside (1/3 of the box filled) and this supposed to be an alternative healthy meal.5 lettuce plastic traysIn addition to the standard yogurt, and apples, banana and veg / tuna sandwiches (1 tray per galley)The above meals are supposed to be enough for 15 cabin crew for dinner (DXB-BLR) and breakfast (BLR-DXB)These meals were not even enough for the first sector (Dinner) and they lack variety.Note this turn around is a 9 hours out of base in addition to signing in 2 hours before the flight and 1 hour after the flight. We are away from our accommodation for around 13 hours, awake the whole night.
The meal split was 30% beef and 70% chicken. Ran short of about 40 beef

The mango pickle served in business class - Merry food DelicasiA was popular with customers.Some customers claimed that it is even better than the one served in f/ c, -quality and taste, aroma.Some customers claimed that they usually travel f/c and prefer this pickle over it.

The items in the menu and MOD did not match with the items received from the catering in Bangkok.

The ideal Crew member- I have just had the pleasure of flying with Elena to JED.- She was so proactive- she prepared all the drawers of drinks on ground for both sectors, she organised and tidied the galley- all without being asked.- Elena was always smiling and assisting her colleagues and displayed positive body language at all times.- She was alwaus available for customers and her colleagues.

The following meal choices were unavailable to all customers who requested for them.-Starter -smoked salmon tartar (catered 5/ requests 6)-Dessert -cheese plate (catered 3/ requests 4)-9/9 passengers ate lunch

The flight was diverted to ARN Stockholm due to the technical issue ( No water in all lavatories and all galleys)  the aircraft was on ground for 2h15minutes with all the customers.The Crew went beyond expectation , were extremely professional  on this flight,  they ensured the best service was delivered to all customers and their request  and needs were met at all times maintaining the smile throughout the long day and night flight.The hard work provided by the crew must no go unnoticed on this flight and they deserve an  appreciation letter  to be issued for the job well done by the cabin crew management.

The chicken with mustard sauce served in economy class todays was excellent. Many customer complimented the lunch.They also were impressed with the dessert. Coconut panna cotta.
The chicken was a bit spicy for some customer's and the fish was very less comparing to the customer's meal preference.
The chicken option were popular in this sector.More than 30 customers did not get their preferred meal which was the chicken.
The chicken option was more popular than the lamb.We were short of about 9 casseroles in the entire cabin.
The chicken option was more popular than the fish option.Crew were short of about 14 casseroles.
The Caviar Accompaniments  *The lemon wedges for the caviar did not have the light cloth cover.*The Cracker was loaded as Melba toast.

The butter out of Rio de Janeiro is wrapped in foil. It takes very long to dismantle the foil for all 42 trays and takes time from the service, especially on the short sector from EZE to GIG.Furthermore the French Toast option for Breakfast is too big for the ovenFor the Lunch/Dinner service the white rolls and brown rolls were loaded 50 percent, therefore we could not provide a consistent tray lay up
The Beef was popular.Bulgogy beef was the popular choice we ran sort of 50 beef, we had to offer alternative choices.
The Beef option was catered at 30% and the Chicken option at 70%.Beef option was more popular and several customers seated in the aft of the YC cabin missed out.
The beef option on this sector was quite pink and a few customers did not eat it and complained it was raw inside.
The beef on the menu was the popular choice today.We ran out of beef and was unable to offer it to few customers.
The beef noodle was very popular on this sector.Some customers did not receive their meal choice.
The aluminium foils covering both the passenger and crew mails get unfilled very easily and spoil the presentation of the casserole.
The "Crab Rice paper roll" was requested by 3 different customers and all of them returned it claiming they didn't like it. Three customers stated that they didn't like the taste of the starter.

The  percentage of chicken loaded was 10%.However.a couple of the customers did not get their meal choices.Please increase the percentage as the foreigners on the flight prefer the non vegetarian meal options

Teri looked after a customer who fainted, She was calm and controlled, She gave instructions for the crew to follow and informed me about the status of the customer.Teri is approachable and therefore crew informed her of everything happening in the cabin.--We had two failed attempts to land  into GLA -I shared a NITS briefing with the crew for landing into NCL -Teri was  calm and asked questions for clarification

Terence professionalism-Observed Terence  service skills-his interaction with customers and kids was outstanding -Wearing clown wig, bringing his own resources to make kids days-the kids loved it and their parents too-Terence was using his French skills to interact with customers, offering the meal in French -Greetings them in French-

TEMPERATURE PROBE STICKS NOT TURNING RED- It was noted that on both sectors, meals were taking too long to be heated up.- After 35 minutes of heating them, some temperature probe sticks were not completely red, while touching by hand, the meals were very hot.- It is presumed that either the meals were loaded frozen; or the temperature probe sticks are too old and/or not work properly.- All meals in all ovens were facing the same situation.- No oven defects were noted. Ovens were closed and locked while heating up the meals.- Service was delayed by 10 to 15 minutes in both sectors.- No customers were affected or complained about the delay.

TeamworkI am sending this V R  express a word of appreciation to the cabin crew who operated my flight EK 003 DXB -LHRCSV  Sarah Ionane    287431 G1.     Tarek    Alshaer     380515G1.      Nadim  Amin.       409068G1.      Clive  Hope           427100G1.       Avinash.   Thackker    427938 G1       Angela james           428355 G2       Bonamy    Mcardle       444010G2       Eleonora  Priolo         447246  Throughout  the flight they supported me and each other   and performed outstandingly despite facing challenges such as having a shortage of 2 G1    and  1 G 2 They worked as one team demonstrating full support and assistance. They kept positive spirit and, with smile, provided customers with the service of the highest standards. At the same time I would like to express special gratitude to my CSV Sarah Ioane  who demonstrated great leadership skills and motivated team by showing tremendous support and hard work.In addition G1 Tarek  he took  MR4  position and he was  responsibility for  safety and  security search of YC cabin for MR4 position  due to crew shortage.

TEAMWORK-This is to inform you that I am very impressed with Andrea's performance on this flight.-She was always positive, motivated, knowledgeable, and professional all the time.-She took the lead to assist colleagues in Economy class cabin to finish their service during Hot Breakfast Service, she assisted CSV loading the meal and preparing the carts, yet she went to the cabin as well delivering the meal tray for customers until completed.-She inspired colleagues in Business class cabin to do the same and assisting with service in Economy especially when time permitting and does not jeopardize the service in Premium cabin.-Her positivity, motivational, and leading by example make her an exceptional crew member.-I wish her all the best with her future career with Emirates.

TEAMWORK-This is to inform you that I am very impressed with the level of commitment shown by Jin to support and assist colleagues in different cabin ( Economy Cabin ).-When he completed the meal tray distribution, he went to assist with bar cart service, delivering coffee tea by hands for customers, and assisting CSV tidied up the galley.-Because of his full support, positivity, and professionalism shown on this flight, I am very grateful to have him on this flight and wishing him every success of his career with Emirates.

TEAMWORK-This is to inform you that I am very grateful to have such highly motivated, professional, and positive crew member like Ana.-She willingly assisted colleagues in Economy during Hot Breakfast service till it's completed.-As I was downstairs as well in Economy to have a look at the on going service, I observed that Ana was always smiling, patient, and professional while delivering the service for Economy customers.-I do believe that this kind of behaviour needed to be recognised.-I am truly grateful to have such motivated crew member like Ana on this flight.

TEAMWORK-This is to inform you that I am very impressed for the high level of teamwork shown by Xiujin on this trip.-She voluntarily went extra miles to assist colleagues in Economy class cabin during Lunch Service.-Her level of commitment towards customers service without a doubt was excellent, when some of GR2s were still on their hard block seat break while the service commenced, she did 2 lunch meal carts in the cabin so that customers will not be affected with the service.-She was always smiling, always positive as well while delivering the service.-I am very grateful to have her on this flight and hoping the best for her career with Emirates.

TEAMWORK-This is to inform you that I am very grateful with Haeun's performance on this flight.-She went extra miles to assist colleagues in Economy class cabin during Breakfast Service until its completion without being asked.-Due to her positivity, support, motivation, and commitment towards one flight one team, the service in Economy class cabin competed on time.-This is truly the spirit of teamwork shown by Haeun, and I hope she can keep up the good team spirit on every flight.

TEAMWORK-This is to inform you that I am very grateful with Gita's performance on this flight.-She went extra miles to assist colleagues in Economy class cabin during Lunch Service until its completion without being asked.-Due to her positivity, support, motivation, and commitment towards one flight one team, the service in Economy class cabin competed on time.-This is truly the spirit of teamwork shown by Gita, and I hope she can keep up the good team spirit on every flight.

Teamwork and compassion in handling an elderly sick and disruptive customer .The team was briefed on Mr. Lea's condition before the flight as per information received through the duty officer . Customer was hearing impaired and forgetful .During the flight the customer became disruptive Crew handled the situation very well as a team , each and every one of the crew was keen on how to help . Dejan tried so hard to get Mr. Lea to sleep , Katie made him a cup of tea and talked to him about English football ,Maria tried for so hard to get the customer to take the advised medication , economy team took turns in seating with the customer and monitoring him ,Nedim sat with the customer for landing , crew assisted the customer to dress up and put on his shoes , Julia came to me very concerned trying to locate Mr. Lea's items that were not in his seat pocket , crew picked the each and every customers 's belonging as he dropped them along and kept them safely . Their excitement when Mr. Lea finished his lunch just went to show how concerned they were of his well being *Summary the crew were so united in solving the customer issue with so much compassion .   All the four flight deck crew were involved in one time or the other in supporting the crew .

Team Player, Courtesy, Positive Attitude. Jheremia is 100% a team player. On the outbound sector she was everywhere at once. She completed her own duties as a CSA as per standard. She did several extra rotations as we did not have any customers in first class. Jheremia offered to use the camera to take photos of many customers in all cabins. I thought that this was an excellent idea and agreed. She also offered to assist with toys where necessary. Jheremia is very hands on and very willing to work wherever needed.Positive Attitude: She is very approachable without any negativity. Jheremia spent time in all cabins and she introduced herself to all her colleagues. She also acknowledged my pre-flight email thanking me for it. Most crew don't reply to my pre-flight email so I was very pleased to read her reply. Return sector she was equally motivated. She was available in the cabin for boarding. As the return aircraft was a 2 class she was available on the upper deck, between both cabins guiding and assisting our customers. Several of the crew, including the seniors mentioned to me how friendly, motivated and hard working she is. She kept all the toilets spotless during her frequent rotations and she also passed customer information and requests to the operating cabin crew for follow up.

Team Excellence - After landing into JFK we couldn’t get any parking stand for four hours due to adverse weather condition in JFK. - All crew displayed an extraordinary example of professionalism, customer service and team work during this extensive delay with customers on board. - Many customers became restless and complaisant about the delay. It was a challenging situation to manage all customers and at the same time to ensure safety of all as the aircraft door was armed. - The entire team went out of their way in terms of customer service, team work and professional behaviour. - Crew took turns to do round of drinks, offered snacks, tea-coffee and other available food items in FC, JC and YC.  - All other individual customer request was attended as well not only in premium cabin but also in economy cabin.

TEAM AND FOOD COMPLIMENTS- During meal appreciation rotation. Mr.Rizza and his family stated that the food was delicious and that him and his family of 4 had enjoyed it thoroughly.- He also stated that he was impressed with the team performance and the service.- He complimented their interaction, engagement, service flair, smiles.- He stated that he was travelling from L.A.with a quick connection and the pleasant cabin crew had made his day.- Customer stated that he was extremely grateful for this experience and was felt emotional about it.

Tandoori chicken meal choice was very popular today (total Catered 17).Chicken was also short from the first class cabin.Four customers didn't get their chicken meal choice.Roast lamb was not very popular (total catered 22).

Tamara was pulled out to operate as grade 2 on our flight. She worked harder than any other crew.He approach to customer was the same she would have if dealing with first class customers.Tamara inspired crew around her to work more elegantly.

Taking responsibility in the absence of galley operator - Oana took responsibility in the absence of the galley without asking her to volunteer, Oana volunteer her self asking the galley operator as the new service trail was going it was first time to all crew Oana decided to take the responsibility so the crew will not get confused where are the meals and trays are loaded, Oana loaded all the meals for second service as well as looks after cabin during her we care service, Oana prepared everything for second service before the galley operator comes from his break as it is designed in new service, it showed Oana is interest in her job without asking her for help.

SURPRISE FOR A HONEYMOON COUPLE- Working as a lounge operator in business class cabin, Hoa discovered, that a customers seated at 24G and 24J were returning from their 3 week honeymoon trip in Auckland. - The customers said, that they treated themselves to a trip in a Business class for the first time in their life, as it was a very special trip for them. - Hoa took the initiative, and during the quiet time in the lounge, when there were no customers, she decorated the lounge top with a rose petals, and served a sweet treat presented on a plate decorated with melted chocolate. She also prepared two champagne glasses and Emirates celebration card with a personal wish. - After she invited the couple to the lounge, they were truly surprised and touched with this unexpected gesture.- Hoa took pictures using on board camera for the couple.- The honeymooners thanked to Hoa many times, and continued enjoying a few more drink in the beautifully decorated lounge.

SUPPORT- Smain demonstrated during the all trip his support and dedication to a smooth operation. - He was observed helping in different cabin.- During EK 408 he managed on his own a medical case ( suspected hear attack ) contacted medical ground service kept flight deck informed and assisted during translation as the patient talked only English. - Smain was keen to received feedback and improve. - Smain was observed without being asked dispatching the blankets bags for each cabin. - Smain also did not hesitate to pay for my bill at the hotel as I lost my wallet ( card and cash ) - On the way back Swain made sure he created a friendly environment within his team and colleagues.

SUPPLEMENTAL VR FOR THE "MY FLIGHT PERFORMANCE" OF CREW MEMBER YUBI (449676).- Crew member Yubi found a cutomer about to faint in his seat.- She approached the situation in a very calm professional manner, applying the correct medical procedure and reassuring casualty constantly.- She remained with the casualty holding his hands and continuously giving positive phrases.- Took the serial number of the oxygen bottle used and handed it to the purser as well as ensuring oxygen mask is placed in bio hazard bag.One of the crew member is resigning and was operating on her last flight on our trip.- Yubi initiated a farewell greeting card signed by all the crew members, organized a dessert from JC decorated with a farewell message.- Her actions delighted crew member Camilla and was an inspiration to the rest of the team.

Sunaina professionalism-Sunaina took the initiative to enrol customers to the skywards program -She enrolled 6 customers-She received several positive feedbacks from customers flying with us for the first time

Soup- Menu contained tomato soup. - Catering supervisor informed us that we had 2 flasks of tomato soup.- Before the service we noticed that one flask contained tomato soup and one flask contained beef consommé.- Checked with first class to make sure that they had the consommé, which they did. There was no extra tomato soup in first class.

SOUP TOO WATERY- The consistency of the mushroom soup was very watery, resulting in the soup spilling over the edge of the soup bowls.- Crew had to return to the galley several times to wipe the bowl and plate clean.- This resulted in a less efficient service.
SOUP SALTY- Mr. Pingal informed me that the mushroom soup was very salty. - He disembarked as per normal.

Soup Quantity Insufficient- Only one flask of soup was loaded for this flight (Passenger Booked Load: 20; Final Flight Load 19).- One flask of soup equates to 7 servings.- 9 Passengers requested soup for their starter meal option.
Soup Option FeedbackThe soup option for dinner was too salty.
SOUP FLASKS DIFFICULT TO OPEN-Both soup flasks were very difficult to open, after trying for some time, we managed to open only one of them.-The cap seemed jammed and damaged on both flasks.
Soup catered differed from those mentioned on the menu :* Catered soup - 1)  Butternut squash and 2)  chicken soup .* Menu states - 1) Pumpkin and 2) Egg drop

Sophia worked as a Grade 1 on sector DXB-SIN. From the briefing, Sophia was very quick to put herself forward for this as we were minus 1 crew in the cabin. Sophia already had some knowledge of the JC service and was very quick to learn, ensuring she asked questions if she was in any doubt. The service ran very smoothly and Sophia portrayed herself to be very confident whilst in front of the customers.Sophia was quick to communicate any issues that customers had, such as IFE problems to ensure they got resolved quickly.
Some salads on the business class trays were frozen

Snack Boxes - Loading/Quantity- Only 3 large snack boxes were loaded for this flight.- The catered (and final load) for the sector was 300 pax.- All snack boxes had been completed by 3h30m into the flight.

SMALL PERCENTAGE OF BEEF-Choice of Braised Beef with Horseradish 30%-Choice of Chicken with Creamy mushroom sauce 70%-25 people did not receive their first choice of Beef-Suggest 50% Beef 50% Chicken

Since there was a short of one crew in YC and the flight was full, the whole team of EK 582/ 583 worked in a professional manner and provided excellent team work without any negative effect on the customer service.In JC two G2 crew members worked as G1 and G1 crew members Amanda Wilkins staff no 432289 and April Mendoza staff no 324214 worked as their mentor and guided them to ensure that service in the premium cabins are up to the high standard set by EK.YC cabin lead by CSV Patricia Gomez Martinez staff no 418962 and the whole team of YC ensured that the boarding is done with in the time frame to ensure on time departure as customers tend to carry many hand bags. Also the service was done in a smooth manner to ensure all the customers are happy and satisfied.

Shortage of water glasses-For breakfast before landing, there was not enough water glasses left to offer with orange juice/apple juice/water before the service.-The drinks basket (cage) also did not have water glasses, only champagne flutes.

Shortage Of Trays And Meal.-Ground staff in KRT informed me that they already informed customer who are travelling under subload tickets that they will not be able to get meals on board.-Customer informed me that he was not informed by the ground staff about this matter.

Shortage of the crew meals- the crew meals were loaded for one sector only though it is a long turnaround flight (departure 21-40, arrival back to Dubai 07-15)- 4 hot meals and 2 salads were not enough for 8 crew for the duty longer than 10 hours); as the flight was full there were no passenger meals left.

Shortage of meal trays in economy- Load is 156.- Catering supervisor refused to complete checks with the crew, since he claimed he had already checked everything; he had to be prompted and catering was checked by CSVs.- During catering checks it was established , as per providers information, that the amount catered is 155 trays.- As per catering checks guidelines, we checked one try in each cart for contents and quality, and established the amount of trays, checking all special meals.- During the service, we did not have enough trays. Short of Tray Due to Neglectful Management of Caterer- Pax load was 296 ( Full 7 carts and 1 half cart for lunch) - Service was Lunch and Light Bite.- Caterer went to check with MID galley in Y class.- Tereza checked with caterer that 2 carts for lunch and 1 cart for light bite are loaded.- Tereza (Mid galley operator) claimed that she is short of 1 lunch cart.- Caterer replied 1 cart will be in AFT galley.- Caterer went check loading in AFT galley.- Elena checked with caterer that there are 5 carts for lunch and 2 carts for light bite which makes it 7 carts for lunch and short of half cart.- Elena was told 3 carts in MID galley by caterer  which was not true. - Before leaving the aircraft, Caterer was asked for missing lunch cart by Tereza and caterer replied it is in the AFT galley.- It was only discovered that 25 Customers in AFT area were out of trays during the lunch service.

SEVERAL CUSTOMERS SAID THE CHOCOLATES CANONICA WERE DELICIOUS

SERVICE SUGGESTION-My suggestion is to load cup noodles container in economy class for all flights - As it is suitable for vegetarians is could be used as a resource for customers whose vegetarian meal was not ordered or provided.-These will only be loaded as a last option to help vegetarian customers and will not appear on the menu , or be offered to another customers.

Service sequence mentions to offer biscuits and snacks in the cabin.We were only catered 3boxes which was not even enough to offer the first four cabins.Could not continue the service only drinks were done.

Seohyun was full of energy throughout the trip; she worked tirelessly; planned each task carefully and used her resources(crew, language speaker, time) effectively to ensure customer enjoys a seamless service through out the trip.When it was time for her break I needed to convince her to go on her 30min break as she wont stop working for her service management.She had clear communication with her team and other Cabin Supervisor in Y/C to prepare for next service; there was a point when crew were bit confused; but she managed to clarify it simply.During Emirates Donation rotation in the cabin she volunteered to take a walk around the cabin with the donation collection plastic bag, collected donation and filled the form then kept it in CWS, I was very impressed with her proactive thinking. Seohyun also prepared the flight papers and kept them in CWS in order before even I asked for it; We had two toilets where tap water was not flowing; she decided to put bottle of water for customer to use and put a Toilet INOP sticker on the tap; and she communicated with me the same; however I suggested her to think further steps that can be done i.e. sending message to ground and get their opinion about it; if we still cant fix it with ground engineer's help; we will follow her solution on an extreme situation provided all service is finished and we have enough water to use it for that two toilets; Ground engineer helped us to fix the toilets and Seohyun learned something new.
Selection of canapes didn't include smoked salmon crepe parmentier with poached pear but something else, which couldn't be identified from the look of it.
Second Service Choice Popularity-Many customer who asked for chicken did not get their preference.-Ration: salmon 60%: chicken 40%-Please change ratio to 50%:50%

Scheduled flight of EK 208 was cancelled due to the air port closure for the weather-the crew had to return to the hotel-at the baggage area it was busy due to the air port closure and customers from many cancelled flights were waiting for their bags-all the crew bags arrived except CC Leze-ground staff was informed and both crew and ground staff were attempting to locate the bag-after a few minutes CC Leze stated she didn't want to delay the crew therefore return to the  hotel-she stated that the ground staff could send her bag when they located it

Saed was observed being proactive and having the initiative of organizing galley even before take off. He made sure that both sides of the cabin had at all times the same step of the service and communicated with the back galley all the time. He coordinated the crew while I was in the flight deck (Captain's toilet break) for a bit longer during the service.  He was seen interacting with a lot of customers during non service times and even expressed concern when he saw an elderly lady that came across as sick. He instructed her to use toilet button and showed its location in case she feels sick in toilet.He was also seen giving out at the top of descent fruits to a couple that could not have the meal on board. He is genuinely caring person and it reflects in the flight.

REMARKABLE CUSTOMER SERVICE:-Mohamad was observed shaking customers' hands as the flight ended.He shook the hands of all customers he had been serving and thanked them all individually for the flying Emirates.Mohammad  addressed the customers by name as he did this.-Mohammad also took the initiative of enrolling customers into the Emirates Skywards membership program.-Mohammad also used the Polaroid camera to take photos of the children in the upper deck .The customers were delighted.-One of the customers Mrs.Erasmus (travelling on 16k) also informed me that she was very impressed by the way Mohamad attended to her.

Regina made one little girls dream come true. She gave her red hat and walked with her in the cabin, allowing to help with some easy tasks. She also took a picture of her. Little girl was fascinated and impressed by Regina's friendliness.Regina's kindness will leave kids with long lasting memories.

Regarding FC customer experience validation- Purser and team members welcome the FC customers at the door and escorted them to their suites.- Pre-departure services were offered to customers according to standards, during ground time.- Purser offered menus to customers and explained the FC service and features to customers.- Mr.Sakouta at 02K suite enjoyed dinner after take off and observed sleeping afterwards. Customer enjoyed hot beverages before landing.- Mr.Omer at 01A suite enjoyed dinner after take off, and was seen enjoying movies.- Customer requested for espresso before landing.

Regarding FC customer experience validation- Mr.Elkordofani was welcome at the door and escorted to his suite.- Pre departure services were offered to the customer according to standards during ground time.- Purser offered menu to the customer and explained the FC service and features.- Customer enjoyed lunch after take off, and was seen enjoying IFE.- Customer was conversing with crew members regarding his deep water diving in Bali.- Customer enjoyed hot beverage before landing.

Regarding FC customer experience validation- All FC customers were welcome at the door by team members, and escorted to their suites respectively.- Pre departure services were offered to customers on ground according to standards.- Purser offered menus to all customers after take off, and explained the FC service and features.- Dr.Abdulfaraj at 02A suite enjoyed dinner after take off, and wished to sleep. Customer enjoyed a shower before landing, and enjoyed breakfast.- Mr.Al Torabi at 04A and Mr.Gutab at 03K suite were travelling together with Mr.Abdulfaraj and requested not to be disturbed as they wished to sleep after take off. Both customers woke up for breakfast before landing. Mr.Gutab requested for a shower, however came out from the Shower spa stating, "there was no water". Team members explained to the customer that he needs to lock the shower cubical, in order to get water from the shower. However customer explained that he is fine, and did not have a shower afterwards.- Mr.Whittington at 03A suite enjoyed dinner after take off with bourbon whiskey, and wished to sleep. Before landing customer enjoyed shower and breakfast. Customer stated that he is the Chief engineer for B787 programme, and stated that he will be working on the new Emirates B787 aircraft.- Ms.Alqattan at 04K suite wished to sleep after take off, and woke up to have breakfast with hot beverages later on.
