REF: Crew Commendation-This is to commend on crew member Ridawaan's excellent performance during the flight.-Ridawan appears inspired in his role, always positive, displaying a positive demure, despite the challenges & the extremes of the higher work load experienced during this trip.-He volunteered to take over the galley role while I was dealing with a medical case during the service.-Ridawaan ensured that the meal carts were readily & properly prepared & the service began on time.-He also took time to build rapport with our customers & utilised the KIS tablet to enrol 3 customers to the Emirates Skywards membership program.-Ridawan appears to be very inspired, he ensured to pass all the relevant information to the entire team on time.-He's neat & organized. I observed him noting down information that was required to be handed over to the rest of the crew, i.e.. Medical SAMPLE.-Ridwaan was observed assisting all the parents with infants and young children throughout the flight, ensuring they were comfortable and well taken care off.- Ridwaan is a strong team player and was observed on numerous occasions motivating his team and on some occasions picking up some extra work load to make it easy for the rest of team, demonstrating genuine care & considerations towards his colleagues.
RED WINE FEEDBACK:*Feedback from customers on today's flight indicate that they enjoyed the red wines very much.*Cloudy Bay Pinot Noir 2014 and Virginie de Valandraud, a Saint-Emilio Grand Cru.

Received positive feedback from customer in regards to the service they received from Denisa.She ensured that she returned to deliver a chicken meal to customer, as she had run out of choice during the service.Denisa showed attention to detail, remembered the choice of wine the customer had been drinking earlier and offered her the same type of wine.Was very helpful and approachable.

Ray showed exceptional attention to details, teamwork and customer service. These are some examples:- Ensured customers meal trays were properly prepared before delving the tray. E.g. salt and pepper shakers, jam, butter, spoon were in the correct location.- After he finished his duties on the RHS of the cabin, Ray immediately continued to offer both tea and coffee on the LHS of the cabin as his colleagues were still busy delivering trays. - Always ensured the meal trays for the sweethearts were delivered together and reminded his colleagues as well.- Was observed monitoring and replenishing the lavatories throughout the flight without being prompted.- Very pleasant body language and facial expressions when interacting with customers.

RAW VEG REQUEST-Ms Jang informed the crew that she has requested for RVML but she did not get it on her previous flight.-RVML is registered under customer profile on KIS but it does not depict on the PIL and catering did not provide it on this flight also.
Raw chicken.-Customer claimed that the Roast chicken he had for dinner was raw. (showed pink meat)
Raw chicken breast.- Mr. Mitchell claimed he got meal with undercooked chicken breast.
Ravioli meal choice insufficient catering- 2 raviolis were loaded in F- 4 customers requested ravioli
Raul showed care and compassion towards a nervous flyer and reassured him every time light turbulence was encountered. Customer was very happy and thankful.

Raspberry Yoghurt Delice looked frozen- Raspberry Yoghurt Device was not soft, smooth and creamy as it usually is- It looked like it was frozen and crumbly - There was no customers complaints and customers who ordered it finished it- However for crew who know how it usually tastes the quality didn't seem the same as usual

Rashwan has stood out on board for his pro-activity, professionalism and positive attitude, having an impact on the team and his customers.Customer service -  Rashwan took a leading role in helping customers to their seats in both cabins during boarding.  He immediately retrieved the onboard wheelchair and actively helped the customer to their seat in economy.- I saw Rashwan building rapport with customers throughout the flight.Professional behaviour- Rashwan is keen to stretch and develop his skills. He took the initiative to write a VR about the skysurfer customer who mentioned that he would no longer like to have child meals.- I saw Rashwan familiarising himself with the lighting system at the social area mentioning that he wished to practice and develop his skills in this area.Teamwork - Rashwan takes the lead as a team player. He served his side thoroughly and then gave assistance to the LHS towards the end, multitasking while clearing his side.- Immediately after the service Rashwan volunteered to help in economy and assisted with the clearance.Recommendation to CSV upgrade.
ran short of non veg option.few customers did not receive their choice.

RAN OUT OF LOUNGE SNACKS- Ran out of fruit skewers in the lounge aprox 7 hours into the flight with 8 hours to go- Ran out of the sweets in the lounge aprox 7 hours into the flight with 8 hours to go
Ran out of lime and mint for cocktails in first  hour of service.Crew advised this often happens on this sector and suggested extra be loaded
Ran Out Of Lamb- Lamb was very popular and we ran out of it rapidly.
Ran out of approximate 12 Chicken with mashed potato option while doing the main meal lunch/dinner service.

QULITY OF DINNER AND BREAKFAST MEALS - Whilst serving the dinner service feedback was obtained from the customers - Customers stated that the salmon was dry and had no taste - For the beef choice customers stated that the beef smelt old whilst also tasting stale - Customers who selected to have the yogurt and muesli stated that the muesli was stale both in taste and smell

Quantity and Quality of VGML feedback -During meal service, before I served Mrs Mandeka her main course, I observed the quantity and quality of her VGML was really little and does not look appealing.-I offered her the VGML and at the same time I offered her the vegetarian crew meal.-Customer did not like the VGML that was catered and commented that it look grossed.-Customer was happy to take the crew vegetarian pasta.
Quality of NLML's salad-Customer returned the salad of the NLML salad stating that it smells bad.

Quality of main course:-Customer informed me, while I cleared his tray, that his main course (the chicken picata) was disgusting.-I asked the customer if there something more specific regarding the meal that I could write about as feedback.-Customer said the chicken was 'raw' and the vegetables were cold.-He added that it was the same on his flight from Germany.-He also mentioned that emirates standards have dropped and that the entire meal is 'cheap' and that the service has gone down.-Customer was quite upset regarding this matter and said that this is the last time he will travel with Emirates.-He also mentioned his flight from 2yrs ago where his bag was damaged flying with Emirates, and he said all he got was an email to wrap his bag in the future.

Quality of GFML------------------Customer provided feedback about the quality of GFML during our interaction.-He and his companion, Ms.Sinclair seated at 16F, commented that they used to order GFML but have stopped as the GFML they had previously were tasteless and bland.-They specifically mentioned that they had poached slices of chicken for starter and poached chicken breast for main course on their previous experiences.-They have since stopped their GFML requests and prefer to pick things from the menu instead.

Quality of Food.*It was observed that most of the customer's didn't enjoy Cod with watercress coulis. *I changed meal for one customer during meal appreciation however other customer's just made a face and accepted the fish they didn't return. *None of the customer's finish their Cod.*It was also observed and stated by one customer and crew that the chicken biryani's chicken pieces were too big.

QUALITY OF FOOD ONBOARD MIGHT BE COMPROMISED DUE TO COLLECTIVE GALLEY CHILLER FAILURE ON THE INBOUND FLIGHT.This Flight has double catering due to catering disruption in the CPH station.The catering for return sector was loaded from DXB in all respective galleys.After take off on the DXB-CPH sector the inbound crew reported major defect with a collective failure of all the galley chillers on the A/C .Despite several resets they were unable to fix it .Further the Engineers on ground CPH could not fix it either.Dry ice was brought to combat the situation to some extent , but this reached the A/C after we started boarding in CPH .Effectively the meals and the other food items (perishables ) were not chilled for several hours which includes most of the flying time inbound and a major part of the ground time in CPH.

QUALITY OF FOOD ONBOARD MIGHT BE COMPROMISED DUE TO COLLECTIVE GALLEY CHILLER FAILURE ON THE INBOUND FLIGHT.This Flight has double catering due to catering disruption in the CPH station.The catering for return sector was loaded from DXB in all respective galleys.After take off on the DXB-CPH sector the inbound crew reported major defect with a collective failure of all the galley chillers on the A/C .Despite several resets they were unable to fix it .Further the Engineers on ground CPH could not fix it either.Dry ice was brought to combat the situation to some extent , but this reached the A/C after we started boarding in CPH .Effectively the meals and the other food items (perishables ) were not chilled for several hours which includes most of the flying time inbound and a major part of the ground time in CPH.

Professional*Hernan was observed being professional and proactive throughout the flight.*He helped the crew with SPML's by unloading it from the oven.*He followed up on customer seated on 24A who did not receive a vegetarian meal. He checked with me after the delivery of all SPML's and delivered a spare meal to the customer. Customer thanked for the efforts.*Before the second service I observed Hernan placing SPML stickers on all the 80+ SPML's. He arranged the SPML's neatly.*Since the dutyfree operator was selling duty free until top of descent, Herman volunteered to collect her blankets and headsets.*Herman enrolled four customer's to skywards.

Professional CSV -Joohyun (395328) displayed truly professional behaviour on our flight today: She smiles at all time and used open and supportive body language when interacting with team and customers although her young baby boy were sick and hospitalised, her father-in-law just had a stroke, and her lived-in sister is leaving to Canada. Is is easy said to leave your personal matters behind, but she truly displayed her love and passion to her job.-She set clear expectations at the beginning of the flight. Highlighted ICN route specific to crew. Ensure service went smoothly. Service standards are met-As language speaker, she was actively interacting with all customers in the cabin. She put smiles on customers faces. She enrolled -She assertively addressed deadheading crew who took a KIT bag.-She work closely with her team, lead by example.- She provided information for crew where to go for Korean BBQ on our layover, even arranged transportation for flight crew.-She filled out lost and found forms for YC after landing.

Professional behaviour- While Cherihene was in the aft galley requesting a glass of water, she noticed a gentleman who was still not seated and she heard the conversation between him and the crew that 3 local ladies who were travelling together took his original seat and as per respect for them he doesn't want to sit next to them however the seat that he got was 45 J and his preference is an aisle seat.

Professional Behaviour- Tomasz was observed following standards at all time.- In spite of a busy flight maintained his calm displaying a very pleasant personality and kept delivery exceptional service. - Helped his colleagues at all times.- Tomasz didn't have to be prompted even one for his duties.- Was observed conducting thorough we care in the cabin by checking on all the customers.

Professional Behaviour- Stayed positive through out the flight in spite of busy flight.Excellent communication - Communicated with the crew at different phases of flight about location of extra blankets, communicated after she secured the lavatories for her colleagues, communicated about a customer drinking excessively so precautions could be taken.- Observed doing a thorough we care cycle by checking with all the customers.- Very cheerful with customers and colleagues.

Professional behaviour and teamwork-Roberta was found being very proactive and switched on at all times on both sectors .-Many customers appreciated her service skills and professional behaviour in the cabin.-I was having some difficulty with my ear as it got blocked , she not only extended her help and medicines to me but also kept checking on me .-She also helped the galley operator whenever she find sometime .She was knowledgeable and confident with presentational and preparation of various new cocktails.
Prof Kearns claimed the quality of the chicken was very bad, stating the chicken was tasteless.

Product change feedback -Customer requested for baileys and was informed we didn't' have baileys anymore however we could offer amurula -Customer informed us he did not think it was an appropriate change and that it was not as nice as baileys

Proactive*Rebecca was observed being proactive. *During boarding Rebecca observed a lady crying, she approached her and asked few questions. She empathised with her and immediately informed me and the other cabin supervisor. She mentioned that she was crying because she was tired. We assumed that she had a medical condition. We made a decision to accept her on the flight. She managed to finish the flight without any trouble. Because Rebecca was proactive during boarding, we seniors could make a decision on time without causing any delay.*After the express breakfast service I observed Rebecca preparing the drinks for customers followed by tray of drinks for the we care service. Once she was finished with the we care clearance, she started to prepare for the next service. She arranged all the drinks drawer, oven covers, menu with trays.*Since I was serving the flight deck it took a while for me to come out where Rebecca took a lead and started to load the meals. *Rebecca was observed being very friendly with customers and offered a complete selection of drinks while doing a bar cart.

Proactive, caring and approachable towards customer and colleague Was observed to be active in cabin attending customers needs and also took a interest to enrol skywards member on both sectors She also observed to checking toilets and attending we care on non service time to make sure customers were attended customer also came to AFT galley and mentioned about her excellence service on board and offering skywards product with detailher colleague was also inspired with her positive energy and friendly behaviour
Preferred choice for meals was chicken. Was shortly 5-6 and many other customers asked for this preference, however took lamb choice instead.
PRAWN UNAVAILABLE- During the dinner service there was 40% prawn and 60% veg, prawn was the most popular and we had 30 customer not offered the prawn as we ran out of it
PRAWN MACHBOUS TOO DRY: CUSTOMER FEEDBACKMrs. Zakreya returned her Prawn machbous stating that it was too dry and that the rice was hard.

Prawn crackersPlease be informed that during Dinner service, we were serving Mee Goreng which is served with prawn crackers.Prawn crackers were not crunchy which appeared stale and tasted bad.Customers did not consume the prawn crackers served.

PRAWN CRACKERS- The Prawn crackers loaded for the Mee Goreng were soft whereas they should have been crispy.- No customers complained however it would be good if we can have them crispy so that customers can enjoy their accompaniments to the fullest.
PRAISE FOR CREW - Sheikh Al Thani was very complimenting of the service he received by crew Rhonda (413649).- He highlighted that his flight "spectacular" and that she was "fabulous"

POSITIVE FEEDBACK(Raised by Cabin Supervisor Cheron Martens sn387527)-Several customers gave very good feedback about the Roasted sea bass fillet-They said it was very tasty and very soft -They also enjoyed the accompanying roasted garlic and chickpeas with tomato and parsley

Positive feedback.-During his meal appreciation, Cabin rotation, Mr Per informed J class Supervisor that he was very happy with the lamb, he stated :"Very tender, very tasty"-J class Supervisor, Kindly thanked Mr Per for his Valued quality feedback.
POSITIVE FEEDBACK- WINE.- customer commented ,during the meal appreciation that the Medoc red-wine was wonderful and he was enjoying it with his meal.

Positive Feedback- Staff travelling with us has complimented CSV Emile Saab (394836) for doing a wonderful job in Business Class cabin. - Miss Meghan has sent email to CSV Emile were she highlighted that it was great seeing the JC crew doing introduction during customer boarding this is as per observation. - This however was consistently been observed all throughout the flight (DXB-RGN-PNH-RGN) from CSV Emile leading his team and managing his team accordingly that complies all service standard procedure.
Positive Feedback- Mr. Tanaka praised the crew:        - for keeping the lavatories clean and tidy        - excellent food        - good service

POSITIVE FEEDBACK FROM CUSTOMER- Mr Catalano told the Purser that he had a pleasant flight that the crew were much better than on his   last flight.- He mentioned that the crew looked like they wanted to be here and had a positive and friendly    approach.

POSITIVE FEEDBACK ABOUT HOT FOOD QUALITYNumerous customers said the quality of food was very good when asked how their dining experience was. Notably the Chicken piccatta and tire fried rice with beef.

POSITIVE CUSTOMER FEEDBACK / RECIEVED FROM FAMILY TRAVELING IN 67D- Mr Van Noorloos (seated at 67D) approached me during the flight as he wanted to speak to the manager of the flight. - He stated that he and his wife recognised Celine as she operated their flight over a year ago from AMS - DXB. Celine had approached them during boarding as she also recognised them, remembering that she provided a bassinet when their child was a baby.- They said that they have been so impressed by the genuine care shown towards them by her every time they have flown with Emirates. During this flight Celine noticed that their child no longer fit inside the bassinet, so she wanted to provide more room for the child to be able to lay down.- She notice that another gentleman had now moved to the same row, so she asked if he could return/change seats to provide the family with enough room for their child to lay down.- They were so over whelmed by Celine and her assistance.- I must also mention I noticed her kind nature, she is always seen smiling, laughing and joking with customers and her colleagues. She clearly loves people & her job!

Positive comments were received from different customers during the flight.Customers liked his approach and enjoyed his company in the lounge.Customers would request for Michael to make their drinks as they informed me it was made really well.Customer commented how Michael is very professional and has great service flare when presenting emirates products.

PORT WINE POPULARITY -Port wine was very popular in both the FC and JC cabins.-Halfway into the flight, all the port wine had been consumed.-Suggestion would be to load an additional bottle of port wine in both the FC and JC cabins for the return sector, as this flight is return catered.

Popularity of Grilled Chicken (Y/C):- Catering loaded 60% Grilled Chicken and 40% Lamb main course.- 5 Customers seated at 33F, 34H, 34G, 35G, and 35K did not get their meal preference grilled Chicken due to shortage/unavailability of the choice.
POPULAR MEAL CHOICE.- The Braised beef is more popular on this sector. (30%)- many customers disliked the Chicken meal. (70%)- Suggest to increase loading of the Braised beef on future flights.
Popular choice * Meal choices were 70% Vegetarian and 30% Chicken * Chicken was popular
POOR SELECTION OF BREAD - There was no variety in bread selection. It was only white and brown bread roll and there was no garlic bread.

POOR QUALITY STRAWBERRY FOUND IN FRUIT BOWL ON BREAKFAST TRAY (DURING FINAL SERVICE) / FOREIGN OBJECT FORM 091787- Customer complained/returned his fruit bowl.- Strawberry quality was NOT to standard.- Strawberry 'appears' almost mouldy. But crew discussed and we were still unsure. Strawberry is most definitely NOT fresh and it has begun to 'decompose' as it is no longer red in areas- NO complaint received from customer / contact details not provided
POOR QUALITY SEAFOOD CASSEROLE INGREDIENTS- there were a number of customers who complained that the mixed seafood meal hardly had any seafood or sauce in it. It was mostly just rigatoni/pasta.

Poor choices for cabin crew meals It was noticed by cabin crew on this flight that the crew meals available are very poor in quantity and quality. The cabin crew meals were Ravioli pasta with pumpkin sauce and Chicken Briyani. It was found in J/C galley one meal with Salmon.Cabin crew informed me they want to have a more consistent food, besides the sandwiches, pasta and chicken briyani, such as chicken breast, salmon, beef steaks.

Please be advised:We were only catered for 02. Load increased to 08 in FCCatering staff loaded 6 extra meals however they forgot to load social area sandwiches and fruit.We also faced some equipment shortages : only one drawer of mugs, cups and saucers, no long plate for the tea pots, no chopsticks. NB: The menu for the return stated caviar but this was also not loaded.

Please be advised that the flight deck meals loaded were hot breakfast whereas the cabin crew meals were lunch.The pilots were very unhappy that their only hot meal option was breakfast when the flight lands in NCL at 1520 DXB time.

Please be advised that the cockpit crew hot meals loaded for this flight were breakfast selection. (poached eggs and scrambled eggs).The meals loaded for cabin crew were pasta and salmon which are lunch meal options.The meals loaded for the cockpit crew were wrong since we never have breakfast meals loaded for them on a European morning departure (08:40).Cockpit crew wanted to have lunch half way through the flight so we had to ask them to wait until JC crew had taken the meal orders in order to offer them some lunch choices.

Please be advised that Fc menu features pomegranate and date drink however only the second option was available.Also Holsten malt drinks in original or strawberry flavour with only original one was available. Additional Poached egg casserole was loaded 30 minutes before departure and it had a foul smell-it was not heated up.

Please acknowledge cabin crew's exceptional work.-Thomas helped in other cabins on all three first sectors, without being asked to do so.-Thomas volunteered to help cabin crew, with issues they were faced with (Duty Free, accommodating customers, solving problems)-Thomas was complimented by many customers for his personal and considerate service both in First and Business Class.-As Thomas and I do this particular flight quite often, we came across regular customers, who expressed their happiness for having us on their flight. -Thomas spent time with me, talking about taking the next step in career and how he can prepare for it as best as possible.-Thomas was often heard talking to his colleagues, saying how much he loves Emirates and its brand.
Please accept my appreciation regarding Hassan. He was inspiring and role model during our challenging flight to Osaka when one of the crew was assaulted by the passenger.

PIL REFLECTS CHAMPAGNE USD95 LOADED-No champagne handover given to the crew during catering checks of champagne, however , PIL reflects a paid bottle of champagne value USD 95 for Mr Faulkner -Congratulations on upcoming wedding.
Piece of sharp plastic found in Japanese desert Wagashi.Object found on top of food item, not inside.

Piece of paper in appetizer-During meal service, Ms Sato mentioned to crew that she had found a piece of paper inside her appetizer.-At that point, she had already eaten the salad and discarded of the piece of paper.-She had all the meal and said she had enjoyed it.

PIDE PACKAGING TOO DIIFICULT TO IDENTITY- The light bites Pide (flat bread) is extremely hard to identify which is the Veg or lamb choice.- The packaging are all black box with  small dot of green for Vegetarian choice; red for lamb option-  Wen delivering the service with no cabin lights its so hard to see the options.

PHENOMENAL CREW PERFORMANCE: CUSTOMER ORIENTATION/ GALLEY/ ORGANISING FOR RESULTS.Where do I begin with Celeste. She is a dream team crew member. She firstly displays fine mastery of the galley and on a full 2 class flight she operated with finesse and precision managing an excellent premium cabin galley. Celeste has a tangible passion for people especially her customers. She was absolutely everywhere, engaged, present and conversing with numerous customers. She has a gift of conversation and took fantastic care of the numerous children on board. I have not observed a crew so dedicated, authentic and committed to creating a great impression for their customers like Celeste.Celeste is also pivotal in briefing as she is highly interactive and contributes a great deal. She shared her greatest impression from her uncle and his steadfastness and positivitu and how she can live this on board which she did.

Personalized service- Upon interactions with crew members in economy class towards descent, Mr Singh stated he enjoyed a personalized service on todays flight.- He highlighted specifically crew members Merel 434887 and cabin supervisor Mervyn, along with the rest of the team had a positive approach at all times and they remembered his preferences and his name.

PERFORMANCE- Rina is a very hardworking and happy crew member. - She was observed being very efficient in the galley with all items ready for the crew to use. - She was observed helping in the cabin while Sarah was doing duty free. - She helped Sarah with duty free in sales and finding items and selling it by telling her the promotions available. - She was great with the flight decks checks. - She was observed speaking with the customers and interacting with them about their previous flights and experiences. She recommended the Emirates Signature Tea to Mrs. Obih. - She kept all the pre-departures ready for the next crew and organized it for them.

PERFORMANCE OF THE CREW MEMBER 422541, MOATAZ ELSAYED.Crew member Moataz was observed:-helping a crew member with Arabic phrases,-always smiling to crew members, customer and being very polite overall,-customer in 25F made a comment about the crew in general being very good, but he pointed to Moataz in particular,-offered and provided a Birthday Card for the crew member who was celebrating the birthday on board, so crew could sign it.

Performance of Charlotte Mett:-Charlotte was very pro-active during this flight. She offered to assist with the special meals as the printer was inoperative.-She took the initiative to write down KIS reports about several customers who did not receive their special meals. She ensured that they receive a vegetarian or Hindu meal, as per their preference, for their return trip.-She assisted me in the galley, without being prompted, with galley preparation for the service by loading the extra trays left in one cart to a half full cart. She also assisted me with maintaining the galley tidy and clean without being prompted.

PERFORMANCE FEEDBACK FOR JAMIL GUL.Jamil is a hard working, meticulous crew member who takes genuine care of his customers as well as colleagues.He built a rapport with the customers in order to ensure that they enjoyed their flight.He looked after his colleagues and ensured to offer them food and beverages throughout the flight.He took the initiative to look after one of the operating Captains, who fell ill during the outbound sector.He showed a lot of respect to all his colleagues, in spite of being a senior crew member.He displayed thorough knowledge of the products and services.He maintained the galley in a neat, clean and tidy manner.He was prompt in reporting issues and defects.He contributed towards a very enjoyable work atmosphere throughout the trip.

Percentage of Meal Loadings- Loading of meals on this sector was as follows: Mixed Grill - 15Vegetable Makhanwala - 19Lamb Ragout - 14- The Mixed Grill was very popular, with 5 customers not receiving it as their preferred meal choice.
PEPPERED BEEF STIR FRY UNAVAILABLE- On today's flight we unfortunately run out of Beef Option- Loaded ratio was 70% Chicken with creamy Pepper Sauce, 30% Beef- Suggest to change ratio to 50/50

Penne pomodoro meal choice was not loaded-During the flight, crew member Christine 119652, noticed that the Penne pomodoro meal choice was not loaded. -She was focusing on follow up with caviar accompaniments which were not loaded.

Pedro's performance was excellent as: * During boarding he was smiling and greeting customers in the cabin and assisting elderly and mothers with infant. As we were parked in a remote stand, Pedro took the initiative to go to L2 door to assist the wheelchair customers.* During and after service, even tough it was a short flight, Pedro assisted customers showing them how to use the ICE functions and offered blankets to children ( as it was on request ).* Pedro is very confident in his role, knows the service steps very well and also Emirates products ( Skywards, duty free items, etc. ) as he encourage customers to enrol the program and also to purchase duty free items.* Pedro's overall performance was amazing. He is very polite and caring with customers as he is always trying to find ways to improve their experience. Eg.: Engaging conversation, offering drinks, assisting them with bags and with the IFE system.* Pedro is also very considerate with his colleagues and hard working. He prepared all items in advance for the  service and whenever his colleagues needed helped, he assisted them ( Post landing duties, double ending carts ).* Pedro enjoys his role as a cabin crew as it shows in the way he does his job. He was a role model for all his colleagues.
Pax asked to order a FPML for her next flights.

Pax and her husband were ordering the same meal choices (both had caviar/mushroom soup/chicken/bread basket). We had 2 of each, so it was delivered as ordered. However, when it reached to dessert, pax wished to have the same option again (raspberry yoghurt dessert), but each dessert on the menu had only one item per choice. Pax was not happy. She did not say anything, but they were talking amongst themselves and her facial expression when I informed them that we do not have two raspberries was of one being displeased.

OVERALL FC FEEDBACK-Customer was met and escorted to his seat.-Introduced myself and customer stated that he was familiar already with the suite's facilities.-Customer stated that he is a dermatologist and often does this long haul flights.-Did not eat much and only had starters.-Bid farewell at the top of descent and thanked for flying with Emirates.

OVERALL FC EXPERIENCE-Met and escorted the customers to their sutes.-Mrs Koehler first time in FC so explained the suites features and the dine on demand concept.-Took them to the JC lounge and both had a nice time drinking and chatting with others customers in the lounge.-Mr Koehler did not eat anything and just had red wine and olives.-Mrs Koehler had the chicken curry.-Bid farewell at the top of descent and thanked for flying Emirates.

OVERALL FC EXPERIENCE-Both Mr and Mrs Hankey were met and escorted to their seats when they boarded.-They were travelling with two other couple and coming back from their holidays from the Maldives.-Mrs Hankey did not want any bread or rice and only had caviar and salad.-Bid farewell at the top of descent and thanked for flying with Emirates.

OVERALL EXPERIENCE:-Mr. Ali Claimed that he had received the best service from Norma claiming she was informative, knowledgeable and did not rush through the service.-He claims that she took her time which was very nice.

Outstanding Performer- I would want to extend my appreciation to Ivan for constantly bringing in positive energy throughout the entire trip.- He is always lifting the spirit of the J/C team, giving assistance whenever needed. I saw him guiding crew who first attempted the galley management role.- He took over the role as a senior managing resources when his CSV Jaclyn is on her break. He led his team to start preparing for breakfast service, getting all ready prior. - He knows his J/C cabin thoroughly and constantly updating to CSV Jaclyn- missing toothbrushes, apple juices, customers well-being etc.

Outstanding performer - Professionalism - - Nicolae was directly involved in all three medical cases which happened back to back causing a diversion to Budapest . His intiative to deal with all three cases justified actions of a trure leader . - He was very thorough over the Satcom call when he called medical services. He used the Tempus effectively to gain vital information and passed on infomration to the Doctor accurately. Management of all three casualties were carried out very  professionally. Communication/well-being/leading my team - - Nicolae kept me infornmed at that time and ensured I was updated throughout . He ensured his team was infomred and updated throught out the trip. Nicolae checked on his team and asked them if they required Peer support assistance and that he would be happy to assist them , if required. - I observed Nicolae working with his colleaguesin the cabin  to manage performance.

OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE*Elia displayed a particularly aware, mature and professional approach to her work on the flight.*Elia demonstrated organisational skills by assisting in galley management in the aft galley throughout the flight.Elia was observed conversing for some time with two of our customers- one of which was a gold skywards member, in a genuine and positive way. Elias took the initiative to assist another crew member in pre landing duties as he was occupied with his duty free.

Outstanding Performance-Ziva was assigned the galley position on both sectors were she showed great performance. She was always two steps ahead of the service , and made sure her colleagues had what they needed before even asking .-Ziva showed great knowledge when it comes to wines and made very good recommendations and wine pairing for the customers  , and shared that with her colleagues -Ziva constantly showed great team work when she volunteered to assist her colleagues in the cabin as well as doing we care , and prepared refreshments for her colleagues once the service was finished

Outstanding performance-Su Win (456139)  observed being highly professional, proactive and organised cabin crew.-She prepared cart for light bite service by herself.-Su initiated closing bars and containers, preparing tray with drinks, volunteering to do the first round of "we care".-Also, effectively managed her time (we care and duty free) in order to impact positively on colleagues and bring great example of teamwork.-As we had Purser pulled out as GR2, Su Win swapped position with him; even more for the way back volunteered to take last position.-Her skills and competencies are highly appreciated by seniors and colleagues.

Outstanding performance-Sarah displayed an outstanding performance from the beginning of the flight : participated enthusiastically during briefing, assisted with boarding.-Was smiling during both sectors and contributed significantly to the success of the flight with her willingness to assist at every step of the way. Was observed placing the magazines for J\C after the boarding was completed and encouraging a GR2 at R2 to do the same stating that we are all one team. Well done.-During the service I was present in Y\C and was observing how polite and professional Sarah was with our customers and the rest of the team.-Customers reacted positively to her service style and CSV and the rest of the team were grateful for her assistance.-Immaculate image and uniform.

OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE-Crew member Natalie displayed an extremely positive approach towards her role. She was observed being available in the cabin at all times, anticipating customers' s needs. This was also brought to my attention by a couple of elderly customers and by colleagues who appreciated her hard work.-Whenever she was not busy with customers she was preparing service items in the galley for next service steps. -Her grooming was immaculate throughout the entire trip.

Outstanding Performance-Cabin crew Thunyawadee was very hard working and always assisted her senior and colleagues without being asked-During the boarding Thunyawadee assisted WHCR customer who travelling with her son and had difficulty to proceed to her seat with her baggage ,cabin crew Thunyawadee took her initiative to assist customer and looked after her for the toilet during the flight. Thuyawadee also monitored customer if she needed any assistance ,I received very good feedback from customer regarding her service mind-Also during boarding we offloaded 2 customers and we needed to do security search in some certain area ,Thunyawadee was very proactive to manage the situation so that we minimized further delay of the flight-Thunyawadee also maintained professional image and uniform ,she also reminded her colleagues to do the same

Outstanding performance-Ayako helped the Purser and the CSV with the on board upgrade paperwork and forms.-After completing her duties in F\C,  Ayako went to work in Y\C and assist her colleagues with the service.-Always willing to help and assist other team members during both sectors of the flight.-Customers reacted positively to her service style.-Immaculate service and attention to detail.

OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE- Azusa demonstrated a high level of professionalism in this trip. Her customer service skill and care are impressive. - In a previous flight, she boarded a Japanese family from Dubai to Dublin who were visiting their daughters. She noticed their appreciation for Dublin and gratitude with the crew for looking after them on a busy journey from Osaka to Dublin.- On todays flight, they were boarded by Azusa again.  She surprised them and placed a Post-card from Dublin on their seats before boarding that Azusa obtained during her layover. It was written and Japanese in order to wish them a safe flight home. Impressive. A genuine act of kindness.

Outstanding performance on both sectors of this trip for various reasons : - extremely hard working, takes constant initiative during and between the services - highly impressive service knowledge and attentiveness when dealing with customers - very approachable and positive at all times, hence contributing to a great team synergy - Adele was delegated the galley for the entire 14 hour trip to Dubai, she managed everything well and clearly has high potential of being a great knowledgeable senior one day - manages to delegate tasks to other crew members with confidence and possesses great interpersonal skills - Adele outperformed all crew members on this trip and was impressive in all aspects of her duties - a true pleasure flying with such a great force in our team, Adele will be a great assets to this companies future

Outstanding Performance Of crew MemberCrew member was observed:-Doing all preparations in the galley (all tea and coffee prepared in advance, all drawers for the amount of carts were prepared completely and stored very efficiently to be ready immediately after take off.-Did galley catering checks and communicated very efficiently all that was available in th galley for my information.-Was observed answering call bells constantly in his area while doing the service which demonstrate an exceptional situational awareness, specially on such a long flight.-Was using perfect menu terminology while offering cold snacks and drinks.-Before take off, Jae heard we were waiting for an engineer to come to fix a sink that was blocked at ML5 station, he took upon himself to try and unclog the sink and he succeeded which made us gain a good amount of time and energy.-Was taking care of taking in and out all headset bags before and after take off and was seen rearranging them all to make sure we have enough space for all the headsets used and unused.-On ground in KWT, Jae went around to check if the cleaning was done in the back of economy and communicated with the rest of the team and the purser after cleaners had disembarked, which was much appreciated allowed me to focus on other tasks.-Was constantly making sure all customers were seated when seat belt sign was ON.-Was helping all his colleagues to finish their post landing duties.

Outstanding performance of cabin crew Marcos Lagier, staff number 454718.- To define cabin crew Marcos Lagier as hardworking would be an understatement. Marcos has demonstrated not only an outstanding knowledge of service standards but also an impressive awareness of customer experience, galley operation and overall service management.- Before take off, as we had some ground time, Marcos already had all service items prepared for both services with excellent attention to details. - During service preparation, Marcos was observed assisting his colleagues on the details of carts setups like removing tea bags from the flasks and preparing lemon slices.- During hot breakfast service, Marco already had everything ready and handy, such as juices for the bars, milk jiggers, sugar, tea and coffee to make it easy for his colleagues to set up the service. - When assisting me with cart setup, Marcos was observed providing his colleagues with the full menu description. - Marcos also knew how many meal carts were to be taken from each galley and promptly assisted me guiding the crew where to take the carts from and what area of the cabin should they work at.- Marcos also took responsibility over customer experience, assisting a customer who was not happy with her seat and looking after 2 unaccompanied minors.

OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE Noemi was seen demonstrating several competencies throughout the flight and below highlights some of the examples of it: - Noemi was seen to be a proactive crewmember, she prepared the special meal by putting the stickers before the service, without being asked - Noemi prepared the tea and coffee as well as the milk jiggers - Noemi was seen helping her colleagues as well as directing them what need to be done ( two crew members were working out of grade)- Noemi attended to call bells promptly - Noemi was seen to be interacting with customers at all times, with a smile and was attentive to requests of customers, two customers did not order for a vegetarian meal, she made sure that they got some extra starters, biscuits and fruits and followed up with them for vegetarian sandwiches for the light bite service - Noemi kept her uniform and image standards immaculate throughout the whole trip - Noemi is a crew member who is organised at all times, doing her duty free, doing WE care schedule on the time which was assigned to her

Outstanding performance in flight-During the flight from Melbourne to Dubai Ilham Batta staff number 426070 .-Had outstanding performance not only was her galley immaculate and her customer interaction was amazing she would welcome customers with an amazing smile and everything was set up perfectly.-Even after take she would assist the crew either with cabin items to be delivery mattresses and drinks and she assisted customers throughout the flight even though she was galley operator.-During the flight there was a customer informed us that she was not going to eat and just sleep 14 hrs back.When speaking to her she informed us that she forgot to order a strict vegetarian for this sector and that's why she did not eat.-When speaking to her further she asked for a black coffee and told me her diet requirements and i informed Ilham and she got right onto it.-Ilham was a pleasure to fly with and she was observed speaking to customer and assisting where needed.Also the customer thanked us and Ilham for taking very good care of her.-Please forward to her manager.-Also at the end of the flight it was my birthday so she gave me a card with a special message written in Arabic wishing me a wonderful year.

Outstanding Performance - Medical Situation- During our flight we faced a challenging medical situation in which a doctor onboard suspected a heart attack. - I would like to recognize each and every crew member from business and economy class on our flight for the outstanding team effort put in place to deal with the medical situation we encountered and to carry out the service during a busy flight. - Despite the difficult situation crew remained calm, communicated in the best manner possible to the Captain, Ground Medical Support, medical professional onboard and all other customers to handle the situation professionally. - Some of our team assisted in the medical case whilst others took over responsibilities to carry out the service and control the crowd. - I would like to highlight in particular the support and performance of Cabin Supervisor Madeiline (358116) who was responsible of business class but assisted by taking over the service in economy to minimize any disruption in the service flow. - I would also like to recognize Cabin Supervisor Enrico (414702) who took ownership of the medical case and dealt with it professionally.

Outstanding Performance - Georgi performance on this sector was excellent, crew member Georgi is a very Harding working crew and takes a lot of initiative.- The CSV was on break and Georgi was in charge of the galley, he handled the galley effectively and the cockpit crew were checked accordingly.-Georgi dedication towards his work and customers is really amazing, Georgi is confident with his service and applies attention to detail e.g. customer came to galley and asked for cup noodles and Georgi offered all the three flavours which seldom happens on the flights.-It was a pleasure working with Georgi and I wish him all the best with his career with Emirates.

OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE - Attn: CCM Fawzia Al Hashimi - Sasa displayed outstanding performance on the flight.- Excellent team player, helped out colleagues and myself on several occasions when it was needed during the flight, volunteered to check toilets and do the first we care cycle in order to let his team members eat first after the meal service. - Sasa cleared up the galley and made it neat and tidy without being asked by the time I arrived back form the flight deck on one occasion.- In order to avoid food and open juices to become waste, Sasa was observed giving out drinks and chocolates on both sides of the cabin after he finished his own we care rotation. - Well groomed and professional in the cabin, Sasa looked for opportunities to make this flight special for as many customers as possible. - While waiting for bags to be offloaded in DXB, Sasa volunteered to take pictures of the kids and couples on board, to create an everlasting memory for our young customers and their parents.

Outstanding customer service provided by cabin crew Yu Wen Chen, staff number 439050.- Cabin crew Yu Wen Chen, staff number 439050, was observed providing an outstanding customer service throughout the flight.- As a German speaker, Yu Wen was observed interacting with customers in the entire cabin, always with a warm smile and caring attitude.- When Mrs Wessling, seated at 76E felt unwell, Yu Wen quickly took the initiative to collect all necessary information and communicate to me. Yu Wen took the responsibility to look after Mrs Wessling during the entire incident always very caring and thorough with the medical procedures.- Yu Wen is an inspiration and example of outstanding customer service, knowledge, self motivation, professionalism and teamwork.

Outstanding customer service provided by cabin crew Terence Kirkpatrick, staff number 444293.- Cabin crew Terence Kirkpatrick demonstrated excellent attitude since the briefing, participating actively, sharing positive comments and with great humour.- During boarding, Terence was observed building a really strong rapport with customer. With a warm smile, Terence was observed introducing himself to most customers in his area.- For pre departures, Terence was observed not only giving toys to the children but also interacting and making them laugh.- During cruise, Terence heard one customer was not happy and took the initiative to suggest few service recovery options. Terence as well promptly introduced himself to the customers and promised them he would be looking after them throughout the flight. And he actually did.- Prior to the first service Terence took the initiative to take the camera out and asked me if he could get in the cabin before children were asleep. Terence had with him a bag full of items to entertain the kids like a huge bow tie, a blow up globe and a blow up guitar.- When doing clearance Terence was observed checking on customer satisfaction and when getting compliments on meal quality, Terence would highlight to customers that they were flying worlds number 1 airline.- Terence energy and enthusiasm was contagious and after the service he asked me if he could assist in Business class where he also impressed with his excellent customer service.

OUTSTANDING CREW-Mr Robert had commented that he has flown on other airlines before but prefers emirates for the crew.-he wanted to specifically mention to me that todays crew were outstanding.-he initially had issues with his headset socket-he was using his own headset in the socket with an adaptor -he wanted to write a compliment for the crew-email: rob.chenwalk@gmail.com

OUTSTANDING CREW PERFORMANCE: ROLE MODEL/ TEAMWORKShady is a exceptional crew who embodies excellence at all times.I observed Shady to be a leader inspiring his fellow crew in economy to follow suit.Shady has a real passion for his customers and his job. Although pulled out he worked harder and more diligently than his counterparts.Shady continuously initiated service set up, took off with gloves and fragrance to refresh the lavatories and also took great ownership of customers that required ice resets.He is an exceptional crew as his colleagues all complimented him for being an inspiring team member.

OUTSTANDING CABIN MANAGEMENT BY:CSV MARIA VIGEVANI DE ARCE s.no. 407940CSV SANJA SKORIC s.no. 408650Above mentioned Cabin supervisors were in charge of Economy cabin for SYD-DXB sector. Multiple technical issues created tremendous challenge in managing the cabin during the flight. Four lavatories were inoperative due to sink blocked. To allow customers to use forward functional lavatories, meal service was prolonged by one additional hour. Crew rest was also affected due to this. Moreover, several areas of the cabin had moderate water leakage which caused significant discomfort for customers and unforeseen challenge for the team.Both cabin supervisors MARIA and SANJA were enthusiastic throughout the flight and encouraged the economy team to positively manage the situation by showing empathy towards customers. In a full load economy cabin, there were few customers upset with their overall experience. But due to the outstanding effort from both these CSVs, almost all customers disembarked the aircraft with a positive experience.
Out of the total catering, beef fillet with wild mushrooms provided were 04 in no's. However 06 customers requested for the above meal choice.
Ordered an AVML for his upcoming flights.
Ordered an AVML for all his upcoming flights

Orange Juice Not Sufficient*By the end of the flight, it was observed that Orange Juice was very popular and loading was not sufficient*The number of exact loading of Orange Juice, when leaving Dubai, it's unknown to the crew*There was no more orange juice  when serving the last cabin of YC during the second service, before landing*It is unknown to crew if this is the standard load for flight 318 or it was a catering shortage/error*Mango and Pineapple was used abundantly and still available at the end of the flight
Orange juice not fresh- customer informed the crew that the orange juice served is not fresh as it is poured from a bottle and not freshly squeezed onboard

Operated out of gradeDuring Briefing in Dubai, Stephanie volunteered to work in JC cabin when she knew we needed a crew who experienced working in JC.Steph was briefed on the service, customer care, duties and responsibilities of a GR 1.She managed to help achieve the goal for the flight and did not hesitate to ask questions when in doubt.Her hard work and positive attitude towards her job made us enjoy working with her.

OPERATED IN BUSINESS CLASS- Styliana has volunteered in the briefing room to operate as a GR1 and as this was encouraged by the purser, Styliana has for the first time experienced JC during a full flight- she has taken on this challenge with courage and was interested to learn- Styliana followed my advices and guidance to the point and ensured that customers had a great experience on both our sectors- service was delivered with confidence and what she has learned on first sector she implemented also on the second sector

Only one crew hot meal was loaded and there were 5 GR2's and one CSV. - Please review and cater more crew meals according to the number of crew operating.

On todays flight we had two options for lunch: Tuna and ChickenThere was a small percentage off tuna (8 casseroles per oven) The popular choice today seemed to be Tuna and we run out I suggest we could increase the number to 10% more of tuna.
On today's flight we were catered 80% chicken and 20% beef. It wasn't loaded enough beef and we ran short. Please consider amending the ratios to 60% chicken, 40% beef to meet customer demand.
On today's flight we were catered 70% chicken and 30% beef. Beef was extremely popular and we ran short. Please consider amending the ratios to 60% chicken, 40% beef to meet customer demand.

On today's flight we were catered 60% chicken and 40% lamb. Lamb wasn't popular on this sector, chicken was extremely popular and we ran short. Please consider amending the ratios to 70% chicken, 30% lamb to meet customer demand.
On today's flight we were catered 60% chicken and 40% fish. Chicken was extremely popular and we ran short. Please consider amending the ratios to 70% chicken, 30% fish to meet customer demand.
On today's flight we were catered 50% chicken and 50% lamb. Chicken was extremely popular and we ran short.Please consider amending the meal ratios to 60% chicken, 40% lamb to meet customer demand.
On today's flight we were catered 50% chicken and 50% fish. Chicken was extremely popular and we ran short.Please consider amending the ratios to 70% chicken, 30% fish to meet customer demand.
On today's flight we had three customers and one choice of each meal.Mrs. Fattouhi ordered the fish Nile perch but it was no longer available

on this flight we received feedback on the following items:- Bread for J class was dry, blend and poor quality overall for the 3 sectors out of GIG.- Seared Tuna Lunch appetizer was too salty and dried.- Lack of South American wines on this route

On this flight from Melbourne to Dubai I had a pleasure to fly with Dimitrios. He was one of the most organized and proactive crew I flown recently, Every single detail in the aft galley was prepared and ready. This really helped service flow run smoother. If I thought of something he would done it already.On every call bell he would always be the first to jump and answer it. I observed him engaging in conversation with the customers on multiple occasions and. He also came to help in business class so he would be more familiar with the service.I can see him progressing thru emirates ranks very quickly and becoming one of the leaders on board.

On the flight I had a serious food poisoning. The symptomes started the second half of the flight what I assume is because what I ate on board.An other crew member got food poisoning only after the flight. Both of us we ate the fish crew meal.I would like to highlight that we received a lot of dirty dishes and cutlery from passengers. The product audit container were full. Also a cockroach were found on board. Our supervisor documented it.I think someone should look into the food handling in CPT outstation because it does not reach the standard hygiene requirements.

On checking meal appreciation , 2E and 2F commented that they truly enjoyed the food on board .In particular , they mentioned that Emirates spoils their passengers with too much food and choices .They said it was difficult for them to choose from suck a wide section .

Observed crew member excellent in the galley management.Everything is well prepared before time and her colleagues need not had to wait for anything during the service.Saved a lot of time by being pre organised and prioritizing the work.Crew member is aware of the service and has a good service knowledge.Crew member is passionate about her role and could see in her performance.Crew member is positive, smiling and professional conduct excellent.Observed crew member checking on HVC , mother with infants during the flight and offering drinks and making sure they are comfortable.Good team player doing both galley and in the cabin, calls bells checked frequently.Even colleagues were impressed by her work.Image and uniform is immaculate.

Nedjm was pulled out as CSV for this flight.Nedjm came across as very positive, friendly and helpful right from the briefing. He had the purser folder ready.While boarding from remote stand, Nedjm promptly walked down the steps to assist elderly customers. J/C crew watching him followed boys example and customers boarded with a big smile.During the flight, when Nedjm was informed by the Y/C CSV that one lavatory at R4 needed to be locked as it was dirty, he took the initiative and cleaned it.17J seat cushion was wet, brought to our notice by the passenger after boarding. Nedjm took over, arranged a blanket inside the cover and took care of the customer who was satisfied.Nedjm printed the SPML stickers for Y/C CSV voluntarily for both sectors.Nedjm volunteered to assist 6B WCHC customer to the lavatory using the on board wheelchair after service.All crew including me were inspired by Nedjm's hard work and initiative.I am inspired to follow Nedjm's example and I am positive that more crewmembers like Nedjm will take us to the top airline spot every single time.

Name :-Mustapha AboulhoudaStaff No :- 399889Mustapha was a great asset to our team on this flight. He was well prepared for the flight and shared all the information relevant to the station. During the briefing he delegated his team members to special category customers, promoted settling in duties, skywards enrolment etc.Mustapha effectively handled an incident where two customers were arguing on each other during the flight. He also showed empathy towards a pregnant customer who found a demise of one of her relative during the flight.Mustapha completed all the MFPs and VRs during the trip.Mustapha initiated the briefing in CKY due to Purser was held up with ground staff. This quick decision assisted the team to take over the flight in timely manner from the transit crew.He actively worked with his team and often visited the cabin to interact with his customers.Mustapha has displayed true leadership by leading his team by role modelling and complementing to his Purser.

Moustafa  was setting an amazing example for his team consistently throughout the trip.He is very proactive and hard working, whilst portraying a positive image. Menu ChoicesMr Ahmed made some observations about the first class menu.His initial reaction was that it was like 'prison food'He then went on to state that our menu is like a 3 piece dinner suit and old fashioned and stuffy.He says in this day and age we should be having great choices like massive ranges of salads. i.e. Kale, Quinoa, Choices of beans not the bitter salad that he always gets.We should have options like Ben & Jerrys Ice Cream, he mentioned proper comfort food  would be a good option not the same old boring stuffy menu.He mentioned that we need to get on top of things like our competitors.

Meals were heated on ground, however there was a change of aircraft-With the delay meals heated on ground were unusable - Crew member Yen Kok 425185 was the galley operator-Meals heated when ground staff stated that all customers were on board and L2 door was closed-Captain stated that it was a short taxi-Flying time was 1 hour 20 minutes and block time was  1 hour 50 minutes therefore 30 minutes less them block time-Captain initially stated that the delay would only be 10 minutes

Meals loaded in oven without dry ice.Meals for the BF service were loaded in the oven without dry ice. HB comes as the second service before landing, meaning the hot meals will be inside the ovens from the time catering will load it on-ground until the service commence.An approximate of 6 hours will pass in between.A possible food spoiling may happen in-between this duration.
Meals in forward cabin of economy loaded as beef Mossman and not menu description of lamb with rosemary sauce. (9 oven cages of Mossman 1 of lamb)All other galleys loaded correctly.

Meal percentage - Was informed by the crew that they were struggling selling the Beef kofta as majority requested the Chicken ackbous.- None of the customers who were only offered the beef kofta complained or seemed unhappy.

MEAL OPTION SHORTAGE- Flight catered with 70% Chicken and 30% Beef.- Please note this ration of meal choices is not feasible.- As everyone knows Beef is highly consumed in Brazil, and if there's an option between Beef or anything else everyone is gonna option for Beef.- Many customers complained for not getting their Beef.
MEAL OPTION SHORTAGE- Catering loaded 70% Beef and 30% Chicken.- Chicken was highly requested by customers.- Crew informed the same issue keeps happening on this sector.

Maggots found in the soup flask.- Crew member found maggots in the lid of soup flask.- Almost all customers and crew members in JC consumed the soup.- Crew member only noticed the maggots after the service and before having their meals.- None of the customer was made aware of the issues.

Lucas comes across as positive professional and fun person to work with.Lucas is very committed to his job and is good example for everyone as he leads by example.Lucas was assisting us and offering guidance to everyone coaching and willing teach us.Even his feedback is always constructive.He was always in the cabin dealing with customers and making sure everyone is having a pleasant journey (IFE issues, Wheelchair lady, mothers with kids, seat problems, sick customers..)Lucas volunteered to look after the flight deck on the 4 sectors as Y class was fully booked which made a huge difference.He was bubbly and energetic in his briefings, he shared his knowledge and experience, not to forget the fact that his positive approach and friendly manner helped to set a nice working environment for all his team members.
LSML not loaded.Customer informed crew member that he was expecting a LSML.The meal was not found in the dedicated cart for SPML.
Low Cholesterol meal required:-Customer wants to have a low cholesterol for her future flight.-Customer did not have a prior request for Low Cholestrol meal.
Lounge snacks.-The following lounge snacks were out of stock at 15:30 DXB time: cheese sticks, fruit skewers and pastries. -The flight landed at + 00:40 DXB time.
Lounge snacks, sandwiches & sweets was insufficient during this flight.Service sequence stated that business class starts service mid-flight.Some customers took 4 sandwiches.
LOUNGE SHORTAGE: - There was a shortage of cheese sticks in the lounge.
Lounge SandwichesSandwiches presentation for the lounge should be done in individual plastic with description.Sandwiches were uncovered and had no description for choice.

Lounge sandwiches.-The lounge sandwiches from Dubai they come wrapped and this keeps them fresh , does not become dry and its more hygienic.-On this flight they were not wrapped and on most of the outstation's .-It would be much better if it is done on all sectors.
Lounge mini sandwiches  , pastries and fruits were not  enough for the flight.We ran out of everything three hours before landing

LOUNGE FOOD/DRINKS,ETC SHORTAGE UPDATE FOR BKK-SYD-we ran out of these few items during the first half of the flight:-Lemon juiceLimesCranberry juiceWR. Bourbon WhiskeyArabic SweetsMartini Glasses-I do recommend if possible more of these items be loaded for our customers in the future.
LOUNGE CONTINENTAL PASTRIES NOT LOADED:-No continental pastries were loaded for this flight.
Long hair found on the tray.Customer observed the hair and informed cabin crew.Customer stated that he did not touched the tray.Customer disembarked happy.

LOADING PERCENTAGE *There was only 2 boards for cheese loaded for 16 customers ,which was not enough.* Cheese was requested by Customers at 7JK and 11B but we had to deny the request and offer alternatives .*Customer seated at 9A requested for cheese as well and was slightly upset as we didn't have it .
Loading of the cheese selection,We were catered for cheese as per 4 customers. All customers wanted cheese, and last customer was accommodated with Jc cheese board.

Loading of Crisps- Only 10 packets of crisps were loaded for use on the flight and for the return sector.- Many customers refused the masala nuts offered and accepted crisps as an alternative.- Only 5 packets were available for the crew to offer customers on the following sector.

Lite Bites Service- During Lite Bites service, we ran short of the Barbeque Chicken Roll and Chocolate chip cookies.- According to Purser, the flight was only catered with 80% items.- Customers whom didn't received Lite BItes items were 62B, 63AB, 64ABC, 64DE and 65ABC.* Recommendation to increase Lite BItes item for the flight *

LIMITED SUPPLY OF BEVERAGES- a selection of drinks became unavailable during the service. - list of beverages include:  - white & red wine - beer  - Orange & apple juice Would advise to cater more of this selection on future flights, especially the orange and apple juice and less of the other selected juices.

LIMITED MEAL CHOICES-We had exactly the same number of meal choices as the number of customers. -There were 6 regular meals and 1 SFML for which the customer claims that he had never ordered it and was trying unsuccessfully to cancel. beef was very popular, we had to deny one customer. -3 customers did not want to have a main course and that's why we could offer them to others.

Limited catering- We were catered one of each hot meal choice.- We had 3 customers in F/C.- Two of the customers were travelling together and wanted to have the same hot meal choice - "Prawn machbous".- Due to the limited catering we were unable to meet the first meal choice for one of the customers.

Limited catering which caused disappointment :* Only 1 flask of mushroom soup for 14 customers.* 5 meals of each main course choice and 4 of each of the dessert, cheese and fruits.* Some customers did dot get their choice and were disappointed.
LIMES were not loaded in JC.
Light bites-Items loaded:23 wagyu beef pie15 pan fried chicken gyoza23 tandoori tofu kebabs14 smoked chicken paninis

Light bites- insufficient amount loaded-Total of 12 rows were yet to serve, however light bites sandwich and cookies were already finished. -Majority of the customers were all awake and wanted to eat. -Light bites were not 100% catered.

Light Bites Special Meals-customers who ordered special meals were complaining why they only had a fruit for the light bites-customers who ordered special meals were only given either one apple, a pear, or an orange-they claimed that the fruit was not sufficient enough
Light bites shortage.-Beef burger was very popular and we were catered only 2 for a full cabin.
Light bites Satay Ayam option is very small quantity and looks like a child portion It doesn't look presentable
Light bites roll not loaded 100%During our flight the barbecue chicken roll was not loaded 100%, customers that didn't receive a roll were offered a cup of noodles which was accepted and consumed.
LIGHT BITES INSUFFICIENT- Catered only 70% of light bites for a full flight. - Approximately 50 customers did not receive the light bites sandwiches and cookies.
LIGHT BITES (SHORTAGE )-CEB-CRK sector was catered for 14 sandwiches for   18 customers and one augmenting flight crew.  7 steak sandwich and 7 vegetarian option   1 vegetarian special meal

LIGHT BITES (80%)-As per catering agent in Manila stated that light bites service (first service) was catered only for 80% with 386 customers on-board (386 configuration)-Approximately 12 customers did not get the sandwich for their light bites.

LIGHT BITES - SELECTION OF PASTRIESThe menu selection mentions four pastries as part of the pastry selection: Lemon fondant cake, blueberry gum macaroon, Battenberg cake and mango & passion fruit galette. -Only 2 of the above choices were loaded; lemon fondant cake and Battenberg cake.-Blueberry bubble gum macaroon were not loaded.

LIGHT BITES - INCORRECT AMOUNT OF PASTRIES- Light Bites Service - the menu stated Selection of pastries: New York cheesecake, fruit tart, chocolate brownie and lemon meringue tart. - The selection of pastries option was presented on the dessert plate. Lemon meringue tart was missing on all plates.
LIGHT BITE shortageCustomers are asking a second or third light bite through the flightAll Customers ate light bite48 hot light bites and 16 salads given by the catering.
LFML REQUEST- Customer Booked this flight less than 24 hours in advance, therefore he wasn't able to request a SPML- Please request LFML for all remaining sectors
LFML request -Customer forgot to order
LFML order- please change customers request from VGML to LFML.- customer is intolerant to condiments.
LFML CANCELLATION- Kindly cancel the LFML from the system as customer claimed that he has request for this to removed a few times.
LEMON SLICES SHORTAGE- We ran out of lemon slices during first hour after take off.- Only 1 small plastic pack of lemon slices loaded in each cabin.

Lee's performance was excellent as :- She worked really hard throughout the flight. She prepared everything in advanced for the service, kept the galley clean and tidy and helped her colleagues whenever they needed. Eg.: Preparing we care, post landing duties. - Lee took time during the flight  assisting an elderly customer who did not know how to use the IFE system. She was very considerate as she noticed that the lady was not watching anything and showed her the functions and also the Italian programs.- Lee is very pro active and confident in her role. She did everything accordingly to standards and also promoted duty free ( while talking to customers ) and took the initiative to enrol customers on skywards program.- Lee also contributed for a positive work environment, highlight good aspects of our job to her colleagues.

Lee displayed great team spirit on this journey.We had no customers on this journey and she decided to help her colleagues in business class during the service.She also helped the galley operator in business class with the preparation for the service.her colleagues were appreciative of her support to the team.

Leandro is organised and pro active and is always a step ahead when it comes to the service and prioritising tasks. He took full responsibility for my galley and organised my special meals and loaded carts while I was dealing with a customer complaint in the cabin without having to be asked or prompted.He was happy and always smiling and created a positive working environment among his colleagues. He was extremely helpful to me during the busy demanding flight and I want to acknowledge his hard work and passion for the job.
Leaking sauce- the yoghurt sauce from the "lamb masaf" was leaking on the trays while loading.- meal casserole overfilled by sauce.

Leadership skill/ support - - Iriela displayed true leadership skill when dealing with team economy. I observed Iriela continuously monitoring her team and ensuring the job was done.- Team economy displayed poor team spirit collectively and had to be continuously reminded of duties- customer orientation , cleanliness and answering un attended call bells . - Iriela supported her team a 100% and in a calm and focused manner in spite of a challenging environment created throughout the trip. Separate VR raised on Y team De-brief.- Iriela supported me effectively during our de-brief to team economy and shared relevant examples for the team to understand and come up with a learning outcome/goal.Communication - - Iriela ensured I was informed at every stage regarding customer complaints ( IFE/meals) and crew performance. She dealt with multiple issues at the same time maintaining professionalism at every stage . I am so proud of her.Customer Orientation - - Iriela used her language skill at the door, greeting and welcoming all age groups with a smashing smile and the customers responded back in the same way . Both CSVs Iriela & CSV Elissavet Pitsouli s421808 were creating a warm, friendly and a jovial atmosphere during boarding. I stood there watching them give low fives to kids and chat with parents and all age groups while they boarded . I felt part of an amazing senior team and wish to have seniors like them on all my flights . Thank you to both & well done..

Laura was observed throughout the whole flight being professional, her image and uniform always up to standards. She genuinely cared about people and was always the first one to attend to call bells. Her kind smile was set on her face throughout the whole flight and that made people feel comfortable around her, both customers and colleagues. Her service delivery was also up to standards with service details always touched. She offered meal options with full menu description and drink options to accompany each meal. Thank you Laura, I am sure you will keep up the amazing work you do.
LAMB WAS THE POPULAR CHOICE- Around 20 customers did not get their meal choice. - They asked for lamb, but we had more chicken loaded. 70% chicken and 30% lamb.

LAMB PIE FEEDBACK-Mr Farber stated that the lamb pie  was horrible-He said that he did not like how it tasted.

KSML.can you please cancel the KSML on Ms Mangwende's profile as she no longer requires it.

Krisztian is an excellent crew member.- I have had the pleasure of flying with a great team to Budapest, but Krisztian was outstanding.- From boarding onwards Krisztian was very pro active and assisting customers with their bags and right away involving them into a friendly conversation- Krisztian is smiling non-stop and creates a very warm and welcoming atmosphere for our customers- Throughout the entire flight I have observed Krisztian to be permanently in the cabin using his language skills to chat to countless customers - Krisztian also came and asked for my KIS tablet to enrol customers for our skywards program- It was great to fly with such enthusiastic crew member who obviously enjoys what he is doing, and whose priority it seems to make our customers have an enjoyable flight
kosher meal was not provided out of Dubai for then next sector from Nerobi to Dubai.
KOSHER MEAL NOT LOADED.-Mr Teller informed me that he had received a kosher meal for his first leg to dxb however on this trip it was missing.

Konstantinos was very positive from the beginning of the flight.He was very organised in the galley and always willing to assist his colleagues.He took the initiative to do the catering checks and organise the pre departures.During boarding he was assisting mothers with infants and elderly people to their seats. We had many elderly people on the flight and most of them did not speak English. Konstantinos made sure they had their meal of choice and drink and also in between the services he ensured they had water and spend time helping them fill up customs forms as well as talk to them and make them feel comfortable. He also reset screens that were not working and checked on customers to make sure that their screen was back on and always passed the information to me.I could see people enjoyed being served their meals and drinks by Konstantinos as he was serving with a smile and always a positive comment.Very positive and hard working, excellent teamwork skills and professional behaviour.

kindly note that the entire compliment of first class crew on this flight did an exceptional job in creating memories for our customers -they were observed to be friendly ,smiling and always making conversations with the customers-they used there initiative and were proactive and whenever assistance was required they helped without being asked -ensured that the food and drinks were delivered timely -communicated with each other and myself regarding the customers well being and when they were running short of meal options i.e. Salad ,they immediately went and took from business class

kindly note that I received feedback from the cabin supervisor that the team in economy did a great job in creating and ensuring our customers experience was great-they worked as a team and followed guidelines given to them by the supervisors-they used there initiative in looking after customers who were sick.i.e.collected sample then communicated with each other and seniors-did they we care schedules promptly without being asked -whenever extra help was required especially during the medical case during the service they step in and did extra without being asked and didn't complain
