Flight Diversion*There was a flight diversion to Cairo due to bad weather conditions in Amman.*Our flight duty time was extended by the captain discretion.*All my team members did their best provide the customers best in flight service and worked very hard.

Flight Deck Meals-Only Breakfast tray with a hot meal provided for each of the FD crew on this sector.-The FD crew inquired whether there was Lunch meal option catered for them, however only the Breakfast option was available.-STD: 08:40  / ATD: 08:55-STA:  15: 45 / ATA: 16:12  (DXB local time)-Estimated Flight Block time: 07:05 hrs

FLIGHT DECK MEALS-flight deck meal plan matrix indicates for cat 4 flight hot break fast and hot lunch-there is note indicating that the crew meals are loaded according to customer meal pattern-the services for this flight is CB and Lunch-the matrix does not indicate the numbers loaded for a continental breakfast
Flight Deck meals- It was observed that the flight Deck meals were not loaded in any of the galleys for breakfast service.
Flight Deck meals not loaded-:- There was 2 Breakfast tray loaded with hot meals for the flight Deck crew.- There were no Lunch trays or hot meals loaded for the flight deck.
Flight Deck meals loaded were breakfast meals, instead of lunch meals.Flight time 7:30

Flight Deck Meal- As per one of the flight deck crew, the meals and sandwiches weren't enough for the 12-hour flight-As two of his colleagues already took the Seabass and the Chicken, the Yakisoba was the only one that was left.-He took the breakfast meal which was the cheese omelette.

Flight Deck Crew Meals The flight deck meals on board were only breakfast choices.The flight time is 07:40 minutes.The flight lands at 15:30 Dubai timeFlight deck weren't happy with the breakfast option and not getting anything substantial to eat way past the lunch hours.they had to settle for the breakfast options at midday.
FLIGHT DECK CREW MEALS IDENTICAL* Please note that the Flight Deck cew meals provided on this sector were identical: 2X Beef Steak with mushrooms and green beans.

Flight deck crew meals Flight crew meals loaded for this sector were dinner meal choices -Beef and pasta Flight deck requested crew for breakfast meals.Departure of the flight is 03:55.Suggestion: to load breakfast meals on this sector as the departure of the flight is 03:55 and flight deck mentioned they would prefer breakfast meals on this sector.

FLIGHT DECK CREW MEALS - ONLY 1 PROTEIN OPTION- I would like to highlight that today was loaded as 2nd choice pasta with white and mushroom sauce, without protein- Please look into it, as one of the meals has protein the other needs to have a choice also. - Is very important to have our flight deck with a suitable option for the length of the flight to ensure both pilots have the same level of meals offered
Flexible Dining FeedbackBeef sliders meet was too dry.

FISH YUXIANG A POPULAR CHOICE.----------------------------------------- Fish Yuxiang was a popular choice on the flight today.- Approximately 12 customers did not get their meal choice of fish for the flight.- Please consider placing a slight higher ratio.

FISH MEAL UNAVAILABILITY We had Bengali style fish with basmati rice 60% and spiced cauliflower served with green pea pulao 40%. Please make it 50% each as we had about 10 or slightly more customers who did not get the fish choice.

FISH MEAL CHOICE WAS WATERY-For the first service (dinner), the fish meal choice was very watery and leaking a lot.-It did not look nice when served to customers as juice was dripping on the tray. It was also unsafe as customers could burn themselves.
Fish choice wasn't available-Fish option was catered 70%-Fish option wasn't enough for everyone

FIRST TRAY OF EACH MEAL CART IT WAS FROZEN- On top of each first meal tray, it was a tray with dry ice.- The food on the first tray it every cart got frozen (breakfast and lunch trays)- When Hesham (430117) did his catering checks, he didn't observed this detail.

FIRST OFFICER MEAL UNAVAILABLE- Catering did not have one flight deck meal upon catering inspection, they brought one later however the choice they brought back was the same one as the captain ordered- captain 1 : vegetarian biryani (ordered and received)- captain 2: cod fish meal (ordered and received)- first officer: chicken tikka (ordered not received) -instead we got an additional cod fish meal
FIRST CLASS SOCIAL AREA SANDWICHES AND FRUITS.- Social area sandwiches and fruits seemed to be the popular choice on this flight as they basket were almost empty halfway through the flight.

FIRST CLASS EXPERIENCE-Our customers enjoyed their flight today-Ms Manuel commented that people shouldn't be using the shower before she had a chance to get changed into her pyjamas, although the First Class lavatory was free she said she would "try" to get changed in their.

First class experience-Customers were all welcomed at the door and escorted to their seats by cabin crew or myself.-All customers were welcomed on board.-After take off about half of the customers went straight to sleep while the others enjoyed their dinner and slept afterwards.-On top of descent customers woke up and were offered hot beverages and drinks.-During farewell before landing spoke with all customers and they did not have any specific feedback, they all appeared satisfied with the flight and crew members apart from 1 customer a separate KIS report was raised.

First class experience-Customers were all greeted at the door and assisted to their seats during boarding.-Welcomed all the customers on ground.-After take off all the customers, apart from one, went to sleep as they informed me while welcoming them.-About Half way through the flight all customers were awake and had their breakfast.-During farewell asked customers for feedback, they were positive however generic. No specific feedback was provided.

First class experience-Customers were all assisted to their seats.-Welcomed all customers during boarding.-After take off was a relatively busy flight, all customers had their full lunch service, up until 5 hours into the flights all customers were awake enjoying their meals, drinks and snacks. After 5 hours customers wind down and they all were assisted with their suites, all 8 customers rested until top of descent with their suites closed.-During farewell spoke with all customers before landing, they all had positive feedback and mentioned they enjoy the flight but not specific feedbacks provided.

First class Experience-All customers were greeted at the door and assisted to their seats. I manage to introduce myself to all customers during boarding also.-Pre departure services were on completed on ground.-After take off most customers (12) had their lunch right away, then the customers did not request anything until close to landing time. There some drink requests and some afternoon tea service requests.

First class customers: - Customers were escorted to their suites& made comfortable BY my crew as they waited beside L2 door to meet customers, I was boarding customers from L2 .- Before take-off, introduced myself, welcomed them back & initiated conversation. - Before take off take-off as we had some time on ground,, I offered menus to customers and highlighted our dine on demand service and explained to them the services that we are serving on today flight.- During flight assisted my crew in serving them. - Conducted meal appreciation & they were happy. - Bid farewell to them & they stated that their journey was very comfortable.All customers ate after take off except 1Aand 2A where they wanted to sleep first, at a later stage they ate. All customers were very happy with our services.

First class customers: - Customers were escorted to their suites& made comfortable by my crew as I was attending to cockpit requests as they wanted to speak to an engineer.- After take off, introduced myself, welcomed them back & initiated conversation. offered menu to customers and highlighted our dine on demand service and what services are we serving today.-Customer slept after they both had the meals.- During flight assisted my crew in serving them. - Conducted meal appreciation  & they were happy. - Bid farewell to them & they stated that their journey was very comfortable.

First class customers: - Customers were escorted to their suites& made comfortable by me and my crew as I needed to stand by L1 door to board other customers.- Before take-off, introduced myself, welcomed customers back & initiated conversation. - After take-off, offered menu to customers and  explained  the services that we are serving on today flight.- During flight assisted my crew in serving them. - Conducted meal appreciation & they were happy. - Bid farewell to them & they stated that their journey was very comfortable.1K and 2K platinum customers did not want to eat anything and they did prefer to sleep.Other than 1K and 2K all other customers were upgraded from J/C and all were extremely happy.I served personally 1A-1E ,2A-2E AS I was working on the LHS.

First class customers: - Customers were escorted to their suites& made comfortable by me and my crew as I had to board other  customers at L2 door.- Before take-off, introduced myself, welcomed them back & initiated conversation. - After take-off, offered menu to customers and highlighted our dine on demand service and advised them about what we are offering on today flight.- During flight assisted my crew in serving them I did work on the LHS of the cabin.- Conducted meal appreciation & they were happy. - Bid farewell to them & they stated that their journey was very comfortable.

First class customers: - Customer 2A  were escorted to his suite & made comfortable by my crew.-Customer 1K  was asked to wait for 1 minute at the door  as I collected the  safety and security checks from all crew , as ground staff did release him early,(knowing that I asked ground staff to release the wheelchair customers only not our premium cabin customers ?).Customer was polite and waited at the door and then boarded ,I apologised to him for the inconvenience  and he was happy. - Before take-off, introduced myself, welcomed them back & initiated conversation. - After take-off, offered menu to customers and highlighted our dine on demand service and explained to them the services that we are serving on today flight.- During flight assisted my crew in serving them. - Conducted meal appreciation & they were happy. - Bid farewell to them & they stated that their journey was very comfortable.

First class customer:- Customer was escorted to the suite & made comfortable by me ,and I escorted her husband and daughter to J/C cabin.- Before take-off, introduced myself, welcomed customer & initiated conversation. (customer and her husband did fly with me on sector ADL-DXB in Christmas day and were so happy with our services).As a nice gesture, we offered husband and wife a champagne from F/c during boarding.- After take off, My crew offered menu to the customer and highlighted our dine on demand service. as I was assisting my crew in resolving seating issues in Y/C.- During flight assisted my crew in serving customer.- Conducted meal appreciation & she was happy. - Bid farewell to customer and her family  & customer stated that the journey was very comfortable.

First class customer: - Customer  were escorted to his suites& made comfortable by my crew as I needed to board other customers at L1 door.- Before take-off, introduced myself, welcomed him back & initiated conversation. - After take-off, offered menu to customer and  explained to him the services that we are serving on today flight.-Knowing that we had NIL catering from DXB in F/C and customer did upgrade himself at the gate using his skywards miles, I did offer him a J/C menu.-Customer after take off closed his suite door and slept all the way till top of descent ,were we offered him a hot towel and a coffee.- Bid farewell to customer & he  stated that his  journey was very comfortable.-Customer on ground did ask me about the reason why customers cannot upgrade themselves using their credit card or cash in the airport.-I asked ground staff about reason they answered by it is the airline/airport  policy. FIRST CALSS CUSTOMER EXPEREINCE*Whilst interacting with customers, Mrs. Goldberg 1A informed me she never travels first class as she does not really see the point or difference in service however, first class crew managed to change her mind with their outstanding service.*Mrs. Goldberg stated she felt pampered and would consider traveling first class in the future.*Mrs. Goldberg was quite elderly and needed assistance to move around, crew were very proactive in ensuring her absolute comfort inflight.*All customers assured me they had an enjoyable experience.

First  Class Customer Experience- Greeted and escorted customer to their suites. - Menu and Wine list offered after take off. - Customer enjoyed their shower spa experience. - Customers enjoyed the inflight meal as well as having the red wines served in a Carafe. - Feedback from customers were that the crew were very friendly and attentive to their needs. - Farewell and thank customers.- Customer disembarked satisfied with the service and flight.

Fiona was pulled out from standby and had to work as GR1. She took the position of MR4a in the cabin. It was her first time working with the MOD. She was very approachable and showed that she was willing to learn. She worked together as a team. She kept the PUR and myself informed of all things happened in the cabin, and reported to us in her role as GR1. She followed the standards at all times, and kept the best interest of the team as well as Emirates as her priority. She was comfortable working as a GR1, and kept a positive attitude throughout the flight.

Fine luxury  Chocolate shortage -Only 20 pieces of chocolates were found loaded in the preserves and chocolate container of J class galley.-No extra were found either in their galley or lounge stowage.
Fiji water was loaded in the mini bar in the first class suites.Due to the size of the bottle, the mini bar was unable to close properly.

FG1 pulled out as a CSV, I worked with Dragica Senicanin (454593) two sectors in economy.Dragica was doing his job beyond expectation, always anticipating and reacting in advance with great leadership and teamwork skills (galley preparation, medical case).Dragica was doing it genuinely and kept smiling at all times although the flight was quite challenging.

FG1 Crew Casie Martin (413434) who was rostered to work as a GR1 for the month of January 2018, immediately volunteered to help her colleagues in the First Class Cabin, when she learnt that her fellow FG1 was unwell.
Few customers preferred to have lamb however its was not available any more ( around 15 customers)

FEW CUSTOMERS FOUND CHICKEN OPTION NOT GOOD ENOUGH- No less than 5 customers informed me that Thai Chicken Curry option was not good for their taste.- Comments about the meal included: too salty, not good quality of the meat, and funny taste when in mouth.

Few customers did not have choice for their light bite option.-Some of the customers did not have choice for light bite, ended up getting only cookie.-Customers said they are so hungry, and at least they have to get sandwich.
Few customers  complained regarding the bread in the AVML breakfast mealCustomers said the bread was very tough and chewy
Feta cheese - quality tasted off- customers commented that the feta cheese was unpleasant and too rough on the texture. They described the taste as overly milky

Fernando is an amazing team workerIt was my first time to operate as a CSV in A380 Yclass, she took her initiative to prepare tea/coffee in advance. She also helped me to prepare meal cart without being asked.  she has a very good knowledge about all products in Yclass.Everything was done in a very professional manner.
Fermented Pomegranate SeedsPomegranate seeds for breakfast granola option were fermented and could not be used to serve customers.

Customer also stated that the beef was not tender.

Feedback regarding the Last minute catering uplist requested by ground staff:Return sector meals loaded from DXB: 37Business class additional meals provided by catering in CMB: 5No of additional trays provided: Nil (As ground staff forgot to request for the trays)Purser had informed the ground staff prior to boarding regarding the onboard catering loaded for the return sector from Dubai.

Feedback regarding loading of Light Bites "Hot snack" on Japanese flightsCustomer upset for not having his preferred meal choice- Mr.Shum was traveling with his family in first class.- When Ms.Sun and Mr.Shum  woke up, they asked for two options of Hot snack each where we only had one for each option loaded.- Customer was upset as we did not have the option he asked for and commented that we should have three of each option in the menu as they are three traveling in first class.

Feedback On Wine Selection- On this flight, all four wines offered to the customers were from France.- Multiple customers mentioned to cabin crew that it would "be nice to have some variety", and "where are the Spanish wines?".
FEEDBACK ON SOUP-The celeriac soup became extremely oily once the mushrooms were added. -Both J class and First found the same issue.

Feedback on meals.*While doing meal appreciation I overserved that customer's did not enjoy their meals. They did not finish their meals.*Upon asking almost all the customers if they were not enjoying their meals they stated that they are full. *About 20% customers must have finished their casseroles rest others had half eaten casseroles.*No complaints received for appetisers.

Feedback on KHI sectors-Block time of 01:39 and 01:59hs, for each sector today.-Each sector was fully booked in JC, which means a total of 8 meal carts per sector, total of 16 return.-As per EK standards, each cart should have 1 orange juice and 1 apple juice. That means a total of 16 orange and 16 apple juices - 32 total.-In total, we were catered in YC 8 orange, 8 apple, 8 pineapple, 8 mango, 8 tomato juices - 40 juices - out of 4 containers in YC. No juices in the fridges.-For a sector with less than 2hr duration, there were over 40 SPML on DXB KHI, which takes away precious time from the main service.-On the KHI DXB sector, the main course was Spanish Paella. That means, Emirates Airlines served paella on a pakistani flight. Customer did not know what is paella and the crew tried to explain it as "spanish biryani".

FEEDBACK ON J/C FOODMr. Bhargava gave feedback about the menu choice. He mentioned that the menu always the same. Arabic Mezze and tagine. He mentioned that he would like to see more variety of menu choices on this sector

Feedback on food quality;- Mr. Worth placed an order for "braised beef brisket" for the main meal. - Mr. Worth stated that the beef was inedible, hard, and tasteless and returned the meal.  - Mr. Worth stated that lately, he has found the food quality to be poor in general on Emirates flight.

FEEDBACK ON FOOD PERCENTAGEStarters were not popular on this flightWe had Char Siu Duck and Seafood Trio for starterWe had 28 starters left untouchedMany customers  requested for Cauliflower and leek soup We only had 2 flask of soupWe had a family of 5 requested for AVML, no AVML loaded for them  so we had to offer soup 22 customers in total requested for soupFor light bites service, Penne Bolognese were popular choiceWe had only 8 loaded for this flight

Feedback on catering supervisor.- We were short of two trays for the sector as we had 13 trays and 15 trays.- When the galley operator was doing her checks she found the trays inside the cart had collapsed on top of each other and hence started changing the trays to another empty cart.- The catering supervisor found her doing so and when she showed her the trays the supervisor immediately went into defensive mode.- She claimed that we were blaming her for something that was not her fault and that we should not be asking her. She continued to tell us that she had 14 years of experience and that she knew her job among other statements.

FEEDBACK Mr Kabbani offered his feedback on the Emirates food.He said that as a frequent Traveller with Emirates he has observed a decline in the quality of the food over recent times and was rather dissatisfied with the meals on offer.But overall he was Happy with the service and the crew and the Emirates products.

FEEDBACK FROM J CASS CUSTOMERS -35 customers out of 42  operating 2 class. -only 6 took Arabic mezze.-hot meal lunch service feedback from our customers in j class indicated on UK fights no customers request Arabic mezze.-halibut was the third option for starter only 6 took this and also not popular.-ran out of mushroom soup.
Feedback for the FC food-Mr.Jomaa informed the crew that Arabic Mezze tasted disgusting. He did not elaborated further. -He enjoyed the Qantas steak sandwich.

Feedback for extra catering - fresh lime and mint for cocktails ran out 6 hours 30 minutes into the flight. - Arabic sweets from the lounge ran out 7 hours into the flight.- Ginger ale ran out 7 hours into the flight.- Martini glasses ran out 8 hours into the flight.- Fruit skewers from the lounge ran out 9 hours  into the flight.
Feedback -Several customers commented the items on the tray had water in them -They looked watery

Feedback -Customers were very upset to see that we were serving lamb sausages and lamb kofta for each of the main meals. They voiced their disappointment at not having more selection. -Customers traveling onwards to Auckland were again going to be served lamb sausage. -This is the third time Ive been given this feedback on this sector within a month.
FC Special English tea was not in stock on the flight.FC Strawberry jam was not available.

FC SERVICE EXPERIENCE VALIDATIONCustomer load: 14Each customers were escorted to their seats. Full seat familiarization was offered. DOD concept was explained. 04 customers enjoyed shower experience. Turbulence interrupted some shower pre-booked timing. However, all requests were met.Issues faced: 1. Seat mode controller was inoperative at 2E. Every technical effort was made to rectify but failed. Apologized to customer repeatedly and ensured all other requests are met. Raised service recovery KIS report.2. Footrest was defective at 1F, which was not fully aligned when in flat bed mode. It was a mechanical issue, which couldn't be resolved during the flight. Used additional pillows to make it nearly flat and comfortable to customer. Raised service recovery KIS report. 3. Customer dropped mobile phone (3E) which was trapped in the tray table stowage. Cabin crew attempted to retrieve but failed. Called engineer to help retrieving after landing. ACARS message was sent for prompt engineering action. Safety report raised.Customers in general looked happy with overall service experience.

FC SERVICE EXPERIENCE VALIDATIONCustomer load: 04+ All customers were escorted to their seats. PUR only had chance to opportunity to interact with all customers after take-off as was occupied with various boarding issues. + Customer who required assistance to climb stairs with hand baggage was assisted by PUR. Full seat familiarization was offered. + All customers enjoyed on-board cuisine and appeared happy while disembarking.

FC SERVICE EXPERIENCE VALIDATIONCustomer load: 02Both customers were escorted to their seats and a full seat familiarization was offered. Customers enjoyed the movie selection and on-board cuisine. Customers did not use shower spa.PUR interacted and introduced during boarding and also asked for their well being before top of descend.Both customers appeared happy while disembarking.

FC CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE-------------------------------UPON INTERACTING WITH F/C CUSTOMERS THE FOLLOWING COMMENTS WERE RECEIVEDIts so nice to be upgraded, It was a great experience to be in F/C , Excellent crew ,standard of service, Promptness, Cleanliness and comfort ( Miss JI young should be mentioned in all aspects , And always in a smile and pleasant. ). All other customers too had a good word , 06 of them used the shower facility,All of them had both main meals, and three of them had snacks as well.'Only the customer at 01 E was not happy with his PVS screen giving trouble, but refused to be reset , Also  the request for Scrambled egg on top of decent was not available though he has had two man meals during the flight, and refused any other choice . ( Crew conveyed apology , offered all assistance possible )

FC customer experience validation- Mr.Tzou was welcome at the door by team members and escorted to his suite.- Pre-departure services were offered to customer, on ground according to standards.- Purser offered menu to the customer and explained FC services and features.- Customer enjoyed dinner after take off, with Caviar, salad and champagne.- Customer requested for Salmon hot meal, however stated that he did not like the taste of it. Therefore crew apologised, and offered alternative from the menu. - Customer enjoyed cognac with hot beverage and dessert, and enjoyed a shower and then requested for his bed to be made.- Mr.Tzou enjoyed breakfast before landing.

FC customer experience -Most of the customers wanted to rest after take off. -Crew was assisting them in preparing the bed for their comfort. -During boarding, Mr.Kelly 1A asked if this A/C registration was EDA and when he knew it was EDO he was relieved as he did not want to travel on the oldest A380 as he experienced the defective suites before.

F and JC lounge items shortage4hrs before take off in FC social area the chips and wasabi peas finished(only one pack of wasabi peas was left).in JC: all chips, sandwiches and sweets finished, as well

EXTREMELY HARDWORKING CREW- From the beginning of the flight until landing, Vera worked so hard in the cabin and galley. She is very well organized and proactive. She prepared all pre-departure trays and most of the service drawers and carts on ground to make them ready for the service. She has also good attention to detail skills that everything was up to service standards at all times. She wrote all names of HVCs in briefing room and made sure they were addressed by name and monitored for the whole flight. She always kept galley clean and tidy and she closed unused bars and alcohol containers with ABC paperwork for layovers without being prompted to do so. She even counted juices and filled Juice Uplift Form with confidence. I can say that she never stopped for a moment and she always find something to do in the cabin or galley. She also took camera and took photos of children and customers and wrote nice notes on their picture frames. She even visited JC to do that after she finished in YC. She made sure everything was collected from the cabin and all bars and containers were sealed before disembarking aircraft. She was the hardest working crew by far that I have ever observed in my all cabin crew career. She is also very polite and professional and communicated well with all crew and customers during whole trip.

EXPERIENCE- Spoke with customer many times during flight.- Customer was very happy with their flight experience until end of flight.- Customer ate twice.- At end of flight he became upset over IFE issues we were experiencing.

EXPERIENCE- Asked customer for feedback regarding customer experience.- Customer said they were very happy with their flight experience.- Customer ate.

EXPERIENCE - Asked for feedback regarding flight, customer claimed they were very happy with the flight.- Customer slept most of the and had only juice and ice cream at the end.

EXELLENT CREW PERFORMANCE: CUSTOMER ORIENTATIONI observed that Sebastian has a genuine care for his customers. It was outstanding how much he communicated to his team and I about customers concerns, comments and feedback. I was able to correspond with them and ensure they had a fantastic inflight experience. This was only possible by Sebastian's willingness to share this with me constantly. Sebastian goes out of his way to ensure that his customer requests are fulfilled like when he looked for a spare child's meal for a customer who had not ordered and also delivering meals to customers who decided to eat later on. It was never a problem for Sebastian.
Excessive AVML crew meals.-During catering checks 7 out of 9 crew meals were AVML.-None of the crew was vegetarian.

EXCEPTIONNAL PERFORMANCE: CUSTOMER & CREW INTERCATION, SERVICE EXCELLENCE-This is to document Hajar's excellent performance on both legs of this flight-What stood out of her performance was how dynamic, enthusiastic and supportive she is-Haja volunteered to take the lounge position out of Dubai and I understand why after observing her: she takes great pleasure and satisfaction to engage with customers. She does so in a natural way and every customer she interacted with, was seen with a smile on his/her face at some point of their conversation with her-She has a natural ability to quickly put people at ease and always finds an opportunity to engage in deeper conversations-One example of how proactive she is about it is how, every time a customer was around the lounge area, she would walk out from behind the lounge and invite them  for a drink or a snack - this is the first time I see a crew member doing so so consistently-On the return sector, she was working in the cabin and called all customers by name, was very attentive and swift to deliver mattresses after the service: I was walking by and heard her kindly "insist" on setting up the mattress for a customer who was hesitating about it. She convinced him by saying it would be more comfortable for him and that she was doing it with pleasure (Gold HV)

EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCEThis KIS report is to highlight the exceptional and consistent behavioural patterns displayed by Lauren on this trip.- Displayed confidence, exceptional knowledge and a positive attitude in her approach to work. - Lauren required no prompting and was often observed to have her self organized in advance, anticipating the service needs and our customer needs.- As a galley operator Lauren practiced managing a safe and secure work environment. Her galley was kept clean promoting good hygiene. - She ensured that paper work was done well in advance and ensured she communicated the information to both me and the Purser in a timely manner.-Following landing she observed that some of the seals in the bars had been broken, she ensured they were exchanged, updated the paper work taking her own initiative and communicated the same to me, ensuring the legalities of the station was met.- On the return sector, Lauren was assigned to work in the cabin. She was exceptional in her customer service orientation. She came across as issue where customers, had booked onto the wrong flights during the transit. She gathered all required information on her own initiative, communicated the same with me and ensured the customers were directed to the correct channels. This behaviour displayed that her personal approach when caring for her customers.

EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE.-CSV Kadir Gures 400798 showed exceptional performance on both sectors of the flight.-He showed support to purser, used his initiative to complete some of the purser's duties like doing the all call for arming /disarming, playing the safety video and using his skills as a leader to guide crew.-Kadir was very approachable , crew felt comfortable working with him, he always provided feedback when needed and made sure that crew followed attention to details and standards in J/c at all times.-His positive attitude was infectious as he had a smile on his face when interacting with customers, and his professional and polite body language were welcoming and warm.-Kadir managed to get involved in customers issues, like Defects in the cabin, or shortfalls from crew and he managed to do service recovery accordingly.-He communicated openly with purser and his team, and encouraged 2 way communication throughout the flight.-Kadir followed procedures and SOP at all times and when he noticed a drunk customer in Y/c, he controlled the situation as per our security procedures, following 4 D's, sharing the info with the team and monitoring the customer then completed a KIS report and Purser's note for follow up .

EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE- Judy displayed an exemplary level of consistent behaviour in the area of organizing, initiation, efficiency and customer service orientation.- Judy took the initiative to prepare the galley prior to customer boarding on this sector.- She kept the hot beverages ready for quick preparation, organized all required equipment for the service ( carts , drink Drawers etc)- She requested for the PIL and used her time to speak to all HVC in the cabin and check on the inflight experience during this short sector.- During the turnaround, she organized the meals for the return sector, segregated and numbered the SPMLs, communicated with the team on the tasks that will require attention for an efficient service.- She worked well within the team. She put in the extra effort and came across as a friendly, approachable and good team player.- During the service, she managed an on-board minor medical situation. She confidently managed the entire incident and informed me all relevant information in order for documentation.- She was delegated the responsibility of over looking the UM on board as I observed her to be to most responsible crew member on the team.- She ensured the UM had her meals. She followed up and offered drinks and informed me all information to me and the purser.- During boarding I observed her to take the extra effort in assisting with seat swaps in the cabin- She used the KIS tablet and ensured seat swaps were done to the best.

Exceptional Performance- I would like to praise crew member Maasa Kajitani staff no. 445589 for her exceptional performance on the flight DXB-HND-DXB.- Maasa checked in for the flight as soon as the e-gate opened for all crew, arrived in briefing room and introduced herself to her colleagues. - During briefing Maasa shared specific information related to Haneda flight such as distribution of landing/customs cards, procedure with green tea and shared with her colleagues information about the different products available on Japanese flights such as the sake and Asahi beer. Also encouraged her colleagues to make sure that toilet amenities are replenished. - As soon as we got on board Maasa placed the sake and Asahi beer in the chiller so that we served them nicely chilled. - During boarding Maasa took responsibility to assist a customer who has fainted, administered oxygen and reassured his wife. Maasa kept checking on the customer throughout the flight and customers were happy with her attention.- After take off we had couple of IFE screens which were not working, Maasa asked for reset and followed up without being prompted. - While we prepared for service Maasa prepared the chopsticks for each meal cart and communicated with her colleagues that we need to offer chopsticks with the Japanese meal choice and highlighted the proper etiquette when placing the chopsticks.

Exceptional performance of a crew member:- I have flown with Manuel several times and every single time I get impressed by his on board performance- main strengths Manuel consistently displayed were professionalism in all areas with attention to details, kindness and politeness, real care for customers and their needs, creating memorable experiences, assisting colleagues in need and demonstrating great image and uniform standards - Manuel was lounge operator on both sectors and needless to say that the lounge was set up perfectly to the last detail, always replenished, clean and tidy with flowers below the main lounge screen- he was always standing behind the bar counter with elegant posture and smile and as soon as any customer arrived offered refreshments- he was familiar with all lounge products and promoted cocktails and the latest novelties available to our customers- while chatting them up he offered to every customer polaroid photo of them in the lounge and wrote memorable note on the photo frame- used all his resources wisely not to run out of any ingredient or coordinated with FC team to use substitutes - and when I had to be present in dealing with Medical incident in YC he immediately offered to assist CSV with juice basket during the breakfast service
Exceptional performance of a crew member:-

Exceptional performance for Lucy Jenner (442861)-Lucy was very enthusiastic throughout all 4 sectors, and she spreads her positivity on her colleagues and customers at all times-She was always talking with everyone (colleagues and customers) with such a caring tone, and always made herself available to help, assist, support-Lucy had great knowledge of service, security and safety standards, so she happily shared some of the new updates with colleagues during the briefing and during the flight-Lucy was always assisting in the galley, generously offering her help to all her colleagues during all 4 sectors-Lucy took her time as well to talk to customers, and to try to make their day (e.g. provided extra care for pregnant lady:  took time to talk, take pictures and laugh with little girl that wants to be flight attendant one day, assisted and looked after elderly customers in the cabin, tried to communicate on foreign language with customers- because she is learning Greek and Russian  languages whenever she has time, moved family with baby to empty row so they are more comfortable during the flight, moved elderly lady to more quieter cabin so she can get some rest before next flight..) -Many customers complimented her work and dedication, and were amazed with her anticipation/  and observation of their needs/requests -Volunteered to be in charge for the service preparation, "We Care" and flight crew during CSV's break ( she has few very strong leadership skills)

Exceptional performance by crew Maher Al Nabulsi staff number 413644.-On being given a choice to do the aft galley on the Boeing777-300, he volunteered to do the galley.-He was observed being very organised in the galley.-He had everything thing prepared before the crew needed it.-He was proactive with the service steps and even helping his colleagues.-He was also observed motivating the crew.

Exceptional performance .Would like to write to you as it was a pleasure to have flown with crew member Hassan and to see the positive  and approach towards his work and customers ,as a very self motivated individual .Soon After the service on both sectors DXB-CMB-DXB I observed him in the cabin enrolling skywards members and thus on this Colombo flight he enrolled  30 new customers and thus being the first I've seen in my flying career and not only that he enrolled them he was seen talking to them and giving them tips on how to use the miles , having a general conversation or even sharing some destination information which he had already read about .As an example he told me about the customer that had gravelled many times to USA but he was so unfortunate as he was not a skywards member and thus had not ever earned points and that was quite disappointing and this he told me with utmost genuineness.

EXCEPTIONAL PERFORMANCE - I had the great pleasure of operating a flight from AKL - DXB with Ridwaan and I must say I was really impressed with his performance.- Ridwaan displayed great professionalism when dealing with colleagues and assisted me with flight deck service.- Ridwaan was very proactive, and prepared for few steps of the service in advanced without being prompted.- Ridwaan prepared flight deck packages and delivered them on ground with my guidance and took drink orders for them before take off which was a great help for me.- Ridwaan prepared drink drawers for the breakfast service way in advanced and whilst his other colleagues were on break and communicated the location of the drawers with his colleagues.-Ridwaan assisted me with loading of carts and ovens by himself,  which displays great enthusiasm and hard work.-Ridwaan was observed introducing himself to elderly wheelchair passenger at 61C and assisted him throughout the flight.-Ridwaan ensured all parents with infants were well taken care off throughout the sector ensuring they had everything they required for thru long journey and offered extra blankets and pillows for there comfort.- Ridwaan displays great leadership skills when I left him in charge during my legal rest in the CRC, he ensured the service was prepared for and galley was clean and organised. - Ridwaan displays great communication skills and ensured I was kept informed of any happenings in the cabin that needed my attention.

Exceptional display when needed the most - - Saif knew that team economy were running short of time just before top of decent and he took initiative to assist his colleagues in the  economy cabin . - Saif prioritised his tasks in the galley and communicated with his CSV Elissavet Pitsouli s421808 regarding the galley & tasks completed effectively. - I observed Saif assisting CSV Iriela Kasemi s415447 in the galley while Iriela delegated other pending tasks to her GR2 colleagues . Such help from Saif allowed CSV Iriela to prioritise her tasks in the galley due to performance issues of the entire team in economy . Performance as crew/Galley operator ( J Class ) - Very organised - . Saif ensured his colleagues had items ready for the service. - Calm & composed - Saif came across as a very calm operator in the galley which allowed his colleagues to freely ask for items and assistance without hesitation, thus building a dynamic team spirit - Saif assisted customers with their seats , though he was busy at times in the galley. Effective multi tasking at its best . Well done Saif.
Exceptional Crew Performance -During the first sector , cabin supervisor Noreen observed that Casey

Excellent team work spirit-Zakaria took initiative to delved the pilots sandwiches  as soon as we boarded the aircraft.-He checked toilets and carried a tidy bag clearance in the cabin without being prompted.-He volunteered for the first We Care Cycle.-Zakaria took initiative to start loading the meal carts and when he was done he assisted his colleagues.-He had a genuine smile at all times which enhanced his customers experience.

EXCELLENT TEAM WORK AND CUSTOMER SERVICE - Karim had displayed an excellent image of team work on this flight. Inspite of the short sector, Karim was everywhere assisting his colleagues.- Operating the galley and also in the cabin, Karim was double ending the cart, replenishing the drinks for his colleagues, tea and coffee round, plus his smile, some of the customers complimented on his performance and informed me that Karim was doing an amazing job.- Inspite of the delay and customer inquiries, Karim kept his calm and displayed amazing patience towards the customers.

Excellent role model- It was an absolute pleasure to work with Maya.- She always portrays a positive image of herself and the company and she is always available to help and assist her colleagues.- At the start of the service a Y class customer became ill. As I dealt with the customer Maja immediately stepped in and took over running the galley without being asked to ensure the service was not delayed and that there was no impact on the customer experience.- When I went on break Maja took charge of the galley and ensured the carts were ready for the next service on our return.- She interacts with her colleagues and customers in a polite and friendly manner at all times.- Maya contributed to a happy working environment.- She assisted a customer who had lost his wallet and communicated the information with her seniors.

EXCELLENT PERSONAL SERVICE- Mr. Ahmed, seated at 46G, was one of the high valued customers of Shiau in her area.- As per customer, she made his flight memorable and one of the best flights he experienced with Emirates.- Crew was consistent at being attentive and personal.  She gave him his preferences during the service and would offer the same drinks or recommend other drinks to customer throughout the flight.- She exceeded all the expectations of Mr Ahmed which was valuable to the company as customer was so happy when he disembarked the aircraft.

Excellent PerformanceYC Crew --------------------------I had the privilege of working as a CSV with this exceptional team in YC and CSV Ling Jia (403026) .-The level of passion enthusiasm and customer focus/care that we observed today made me proud to be a Purser online .-We had a full flight with nearly 40 kids travelling ( College group with teachers )-During the settling in I observed the crew in the cabin using their experience and care to show the kids how to use the IFE / functions ( Although most of them did not speak English )-During the dinner service due to late departure time most customers were sleeping however the crew very politely woke all the kids and ensured they all had a dinner .-They works like well oiled machine and were in the cabin mother travelling with infants/toddlers and what was amazing to witness was how they backed each other sharing each other workload to ensure customer came 1st .

Excellent PerformanceYasmin was given UC1 position to assist two FG1 to perform Upper Deck Y/C service; Yasmin is an experience Y/C crew; she used her experience thoroughly and I am glad that I have trusted her with the responsibilities in Upper Deck;Yasmin communicated with Catering to get correct number of catering in upper deck as initially she only had 7 trays and meals; She guided 2 FG1 Crew on how set up bar carts and meal carts; Worked as a galley operator and also double ended the cart in cabin;Prepared for second service by swapping carts;After finishing her tasks in upper deck she came to main deck to help the front economy to do hot beverage service. Her I&U standard was immaculate at all times; maintained a pleasant smile while offering service and conversing with colleague and customers.

EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE-I would like to praise performance of CSV Flip Dusanovic who displayed exceptionally professional attitude, leadership and problem solving skills.-Out of DXB Flip handled a medical case where he followed SOP's contacting Medical Ground Support, followed up with MIRF and KIS report and regularly checked on the customer. -There was another medical case which resulted in offload so Filip immediately took charge of security searches and baggage identification, guided crew accordingly while I was communicating with the medical services; he also took charge of following up with the cleaning team who were called to the aircraft - Filip assigned a crew member to shadow the cleaners and followed up with security searches. This contributed to swift departure after the aircraft returned to the stand due to medical offload. -There was a delay of around 3 hours due to medical and technical issues - Filip ensured that a round of drinks were offered to the customers on ground and inflight Filip suggested to change the meal service to accommodate customers who were very hungry by then - followed up with report to the product development about service deviation. -Filip ensured that crew followed the standards from the beginning highlighting how to place headsets neatly over the blankets; conducted timely team talks and corrected shortfalls. -Confident and efficient with documentation - raised 10 KIS reports on the trip, 2 MFP's and MIRF completed and logbook noted.

She was also observed checking and replenishing toilets throughout the busy meal service. Ana regularly asked my advice on leading a team, and made notes of my answers. Her customer service skills are excellent and I observed her making various lengthy conversations with customers, making their experience more personal. It was clear that Ana had awareness wider than just her duties.

during the whole flight crew member HESHAM KHALIL have been observed going beyond expectation in his service and he have been observed doing the following - customer by 23c was sick and vomit on the floor , hesham volunteered to use the HRK cleaning the whole mess in the cabin . assuring that the customer feeling alright now , and customers around are satisfied , - Hesham did follow on the customer making sure she is totally fine and she don't need any assistance - hesham did enrol more than a customer using the kis tablet in the emirates skyward programme ( 41 A - 41C ) - during the service hesham was fully efficient doing his part and finishing what he is doing in the service and double ending with his colleagues . - hesham as well was always offering the help to his colleagues and offering to the customers drinks and snacks whenever they are passing by the galley - crew member been noticed as well explaining for customers by 38 F-G the bassinet and explaining the procedure how to secure their baby and when they have to remove the baby from the bassinet even thou it's not his area

During the srvice, customer commented that the Blinis (Caviar) is not tasty and very Thin, as well the arabic mezze was not tasty AT ALL.Customer commented that the Catering from dubai was much better
During the service the customer claimed that he  found a stand of hair in his food.Upon inspection there was indeed a strand of hair in the casserole.
During the service Maira approached me saying that she suffered from a strong headache and after taking 2 tablets of panadole she vomited.
During the service approximately 15 customers did not receive their meal choice(Lamb).

During the service and on TOD Mrs Torstensson said she was very happy with the customer service offered by the team today. Crew member Mohamed s438402 , Kristyna s441677, Katie s443881 and Valentina s445494

During the service a customer approached me and commended Domenico Ragueseo 450241 on his excellent service. They highlighted that he took the time to talk with the customers and displayed great interpersonal skills.

During the return briefing GLA-DXB Marco volunteered to come and help in JC after the economy service was completed as they were fully booked and economy only had 189 customers booked.-This action inspired another GR2 volunteering to assist in JC after economy class service was completed.-After Marco had finished all his duties in YC he came to assist in JC with permission from his CSV.-Marco was observed assisting the L2 crew member by clearing customer trays who had finished. He then took the MOD device and cutlery pack and took dessert orders from these customers. After he was seen delivering the dessert, tea, coffee and chocolates according to standards and in a professional manner.-Marco was observed using professional and polite service phrases such as 'would you like', 'may I', 'with pleasure', 'certainly'.-After Marco finished assisting in JC he came to FC and assisted the FG1 in delivering items to the customer in 2K.-Marco shows great initiative and interest in all cabins and in delivering an outstanding service to his customers.-He is interested in learning new things and mentioned that he is very excited to upgrade to JC when it does open again.

During the meal service the customer informed the crew that she found a Tiny piece of Glass inside her Main Meal ( Chicken Korma Rice )Upon Investigation the crew found the piece of Glass inside the meal casserole.The customer was not upset and did not complain about it.

During the light bite service prior to landing, Ms. Tennismith saw me as she came out of the lavatory and stated : " the cabin crew were really good on this flight." Ms. Tennismith stated that the crew members were friendly and attentive.
During the initial light bites service we ran out of the chicken BBQ roll sandwiches.Most of the customers were awake and eating.

During the flight the following exceptional behaviour were observed:-As a galley operator Andreea showed an impressive galley management. Galley was clean and rid at all the stage of the flight. Crew showed an effective time management preparing bars, carts and all the necessary on time, and a strong attention to details regarding the set up.-Andreea was observed taking voluntarily pictures of children during pre departures. Crew showed an impressive ability to engage with kids, writing a personalized side notes on each pictures and addressing by name to the kids even in a later stage of the flight.-Crew was helpful and supporting toward her colleagues at all the time, managing to spread a contagious passion and energy toward the work.

During the  meal service a lots of customers wanted the beef choice and we run out of it as it was loaded only 30 % of this option.- Customers were unhappy as they didn't receive their preferred choice
During SPML distribution customer told crew members her original seat was 27D.Crew were looking for the meal ordered but nothing was shown for that seat.
During service time, the customer requested for a non-lactose meal to be provided on his next flight.
During preparation for the light bite service a hair spotted inside the sealed sandwich .
During my farewell in FC all customers mentioned the attentiveness and friendliness of the staff

During meal clearance customer seat no.37A complained to crew about why didn't we ask for his preference during service. He advised he doesn't like Arabic food (the main course we served was Beef Kofta), customer continued advising there should always have two choices for the in-flight meals and including one Asian food option. He then advised he did not pay two thousands for this kind of food, he was disappointed, not happy, and advised he would raise a complaint via Emirates facebook page.
During lunch service we ran out of fresh orange juicePlease load more as its popular on this sector

During Lunch service we had to refuse about 25 customers their preferred choice of "Chicken in black bean sauce"Instead of the catering hand over which said 60% "Chicken in black bean sauce" and 40% "Grilled lamb sausage" it was the other way around.

During lunch service Mrs. Shnurova who was traveling with her husband ordered Pan-fried Pacific cod for lunch.-Mrs. Shnurova was advised by crew Ana Santos s420225 that we did run out of his preferred choice of meal.--Mrs. Shnurova requested for another option which was beef, unfortunately we couldn't accommodate her preference.However, the couple received one of their preferred meal choice.-Customer was very upset claiming that its a J/c cabin and they have paid enough money for their preferred meal to be on board.-Total meals loaded were 7 beef, 7 pan fried pacific cod, and spicy prawns noodles for 21 customers.-Due to customers profile which was Europeans, the local main course (Mee Goreng) was not popular ordered.

During flight Miss Dina requested for the Email of Crew Estefania 434966 manager in order to write and express her overall experience and the outstanding performance displayed by Estefania on this flight.Miss Dina stated that Estefania was very helpful towards her and her mother since boarding, she was approachable ensuring all their needs are met throughout the flight with no delay.Miss Dina stated that Estefania displayed positive attitude during flight and was smiling when dealing with her and other customers at all time.Miss Dina stated that Estefania managed to enhance their experience during flight with her hard-work, professionalism and friendliness which made them extremely happy about today's flight.

During farewell, Mr Barannikov seated at 8B told me that cabin crew Afsaneh was "exceptional in keeping company to me and my wife and very friendly ,professional...she prepared several different cocktails to me and my wife as we were not sure what we like to drink"

During disembarkation in SYD , as I was at the door we had a group of customers who disembarked mentioning to me specifically that this was a " very good flight , great service , excellent crew " and one of them said that this was the BEST FLIGHT EVER !

During both sectors of this flight i noticed Gabriel's consistent positive approach towards work. This flight is usually busy and challenging at times with lots of family issues. I noticed Gabriel's calm personality through out and what was good that he mentally prepared himself and also shared various info with myself and crew to avoid any delays or disruption in boarding. This was my first ever 380 JED flight and Gabriel informed me about the kind of customers, how many doors will be allocated and boarding by buses in JED. Completed bar seals on papers by himself. During boarding while some crew were little under stress, Gabriel continued with his calm service personality and helped many individuals and families with seats arrangements and luggage. He displayed lot of patience and understanding towards the customers who were tired and needed help with various issues.. He genuinely cares for them.During service he kept the communication flow with aft y/c CSV Ying and made sure the service was completed with out any failure and customers satisfaction was achieved. Later after service on this sector I even noticed him assisting the duty free operator who had some missing items and also others issues with the cart. Gabriel is a very good role model and provided assistances to colleagues and took initiative in various departments. Gabriel also completed various VRs and sent it to product development for further enhancement of service and provided suggestions.
During boarding, Petra was observant and saw a customer

During boarding, CSV/Petra was very observant when boarding Ms Zakharey (seatno.74C) and Petra was very confident and pronounced Ms Zalharey is pregnant. Petra questioned her and would like know about pregnancy and any doctor certification fit for travel on 14 hours flight time..-Petra is also very supportive to colleagues and she took every initiatives serving each colleagues with hot towels to freshen up-compliment crew for her excellence behaviour and good performance, she also document and inform her CCM.-Familiar with the winter uniform images standard and briefed crew to ensure every crew wore the winter coat and walk through JFK airport and Manhattan Sheraton hotel area and impressed the public.-Pilots provide positive feedback for her vigilant and professionalism and Captains Special Report raised for excellence performance for pregnant lady suspect for human trafficking

During boarding MS Neelaisam was looking sad and didn't talk to any of the crew , Ahmed ( 453376 )broke the ice and talked with her and found out that her brother just passed away and so she wants to leave the aircraft once it lands in DAC .Ahmed Managed to swap her seat with 11F passenger to make sure that she leaves as soon as possible.Ahmed kept checking on MS Neelaislam during the flight and showed his emotional support as he noticed she didn't eat so he offered her some snacks and drinks to keep her hydrated.At the end of the flight Ms Neelaislam asked for Ahmed to be recognised for supporting her during the flight.

During boarding a little boy entered the airplane and gave me an envelope with drawings he had made for the crew. His mother explained that he did not want to board the airplane unless he gave us a gift.When I told Geneive about this she decided that after the service she would make this flight one to remember for the young traveller. She prepared a tray on which she placed desert, chocolates, flowers, thank you cards and a plate with chocolate drawings she made with melted chocolate saying : " we love you Vilhelm, EK158".She then went to economy to present this to the little boy and with the help of her colleagues they took pictures to make the trip a memory that will last forever.The little boy was thrilled!! He smiled and laughed with excitement and of course all the passengers around joined the positive atmosphere. We received many comments on the excellent service and personal touch we added to their flight.

Dunya is very helpful with her colleagues and takes initiative in offering help. She was good with the galley, assisting the cabin supervisor helping the set up of everything in advance.She is also friendly and an easy going crew.I enjoyed working with someone so active and organised.Many thanks for the great job.
due to the overbooked in Y/C ground staff upgraded , ground staff provided J/C with extra meal and plastic trays for the extra customer that been upgraded.
Due to the high popularity of garlic bread in the first cabin we ran out of Garlic bread and were unable to serve it to the customers in the aft part of the cabin.
Due to light load and there were two staff traveling on sub load tickets, meal choices were limited to two casseroles per choice as well as fruits and desserts.

Due to late flight departure , the breakfast service was cancelled and the catering brought to us Dinner meal trays instead .We conducted the lunch service after take off in all cabin and changed the sequence in Y/C to light bites as the second service and then dinner service before landing for all cabins . This change was due to serving a main lunch service after take off and the fact that all have eaten a heavy meal so we could wait till the last three hours of the sector as it will be dinner time as per JFK. timing .

Due to high demand on chicken option rather than the fish curry option, we had to apologize for many customers who wanted the chicken. Fish option was offered instead.- The meals percentage was 50% chicken and 50% fish

Due to demand on the dxb akl sector There were no crisps available to display in the fc social area or to give to customers on this sector. No crisps were displayed. No crisps were available in JCLs either.
Due to a shortage of trays (3 CHML loaded, but no children in JC), crew members had to arrange a tray for Mr Dochki.During descent Mr Dochki asked for a cup of Moroccan Mint tea 'to go'
Due to 41 upgrades from Y class we ran out of orange juice after welcome service, and champagne at the beginning of lunch service
Dry Chicken Piccata - Mr Confalonieri addressed that his main course, chicken piccata, appears to be dry.- He requested for alternatives.
Dr. Woodshed has complained that the Roasted beef we have served today was her worse meal ever on board.- Customer claimed the beef was very hard and had no taste at all.

Dr Haidar did not like the appetizer and the main course on the flight Her ordered the Arabic mezze and Arabic Dolmas She also requested to warm the Kunafe Kashta dessert as she stated it is not good cold She stated Emirates food in FC and in the lounges is not good anymore She left most of the food in the plate

Dr Fadul was happy with the service today and made a positive comment on the crew's attentiveness for customer's comfort.He seemed tired and crew had offered to make the bed straightaway, as soon as the seat belt was switched off after take off. He rested well on the flight.He also used the shower facility before breakfast.

DOUBLE SPML ASSIGNED TO ONE SEAT NUMBER - customer is traveling with infant. - customer has two SPML assigned for her seat.- no actual AVML loaded for this seat number.  - only BBML sticker was printed.* purser note : please make sure customer receives AVML for next sectors.

Donata  was seen to be always smiling and approachable throughout the flight.She was positive and pro active.She was seen to close bars on the short sectors and also set up all the drawers for the service without being prompted.She was seen to help a colleague from a different flight at the Melbourne hotel who had injured her leg and couldn't walk.She helped her walk up and down.She got some groceries for her and paid for it as well. Was good to see her helping out crew members from different flights. She was much appreciated by her colleague.Prepared a hot bag for an elderly customer on the first sector as he had a back ache. She monitored him  for the entire flight and made sure he was comfortable.

Dominika Krupkova (S452115)-Before boarding, Dominika prepared all pre departures, bars, and organised galley by herself without being asked to do so.-After take off she ensured that pre departures are completed.-Constantly through the flight, Dominika observed smiley, situatuional aware, proactive, professional, with positive approach toward customers and collegues. -Dominika did her best to learn service phrases on Croatian in order to create suprising treat for the customers.-Her efforts were appreciated by both, collegues and customers.-On top of descent, Dominika closed aft galley by herself, again, without being asked to do so.

Dissatisfied With Food In Lounge and On board - Mrs complaint about food in the lounge she had was not nice.- She said sweet chicken was dry and sauce was lumpy.- Pasta in pink sauce and sautéed vegetable were not appetising.- The lemongrass chicken that were served on board was also dry and sauce was lumpy.

DISCREPENCY IN WINE LIST IN FC:- Wine List in FC featured "Hyde de Villaine Chardonnay 2014" California USA but was not loaded on board. Instead we had the "Mount Mary Vineyard Yarra Valley" Chardonnay 2012 Australian.

Discrepancy in the food loading.Total PAX in F/class is 5 (five).The top up catering arrived just in time before closing the door despite this flight being a scheduled delayed departure.* Extra caviar was brought but no extra condiments for it. Hence for two main meal services we had only one tray of caviar condiments.* salad was still for 03 pax.* chocolate dessert was of three different kinds.* hot canapes' for the top up catering was missing. * second set of flight deck meals and trays were missing. couldn't find them in business or economy.Whatever top up catering arrived was not as per the guidelines for a 05 Pax in a 08pax first class cabin configuration with two main meal services.Mr. Shibin, the aircraft catering officer had no control over the top up stuff sent from Flight catering.

Discrepancy between cheese description in menu and availability.Menu describes First Class availability for Cricketers Old Cheddar, Olay Amsterdam, Garcia Manchego, Cropwell Bishop Stilton, Saint Germaine.Business Class cheese board provided with Belton Farm Red Fox, Gorgonzola Piccante and Saint-Pauline.
DIRTY SPOON- During the lunch service, customer informed me that the spoon was dirty and she needed another spoon.
Dirty cutlery packKnife inside pack was found to be dirty .

Dinner Service - Incorrect Loading- Using the temperature probe to check whether the meals were read for the service, it was noticed that roughly 30 Scrambled eggs with herbs were loaded together with the dinner meals.- All 4 loaded oven inserts had a tray of scrambled egg. It was communicated from the AFT galley that they had scrambled eggs loaded with the dinner main courses too.
Dinner Food FeedbackCustomers stated fish option and soup are too salty.

DIFFERING CHEESES- Five cheese were listed on the First Class menu. However, only 3 cheeses were loaded in the plastic container.- Cheeses listed: Cricketers oak smoked Cheddar, Old Amsterdam, Garcia Manchego, Cropwell Bishop Stilton and Saint Germain.- Cheeses available: Old Amsterdam, Cropwell Bishop Stilton, Saint Germain.

DIFFERENT SELECTION OF DESSERT FROM THE LIGHT BITES. - On the menu, dessert for the light bites were chocolate brownie, strawberry cupcakes and one of the Arabic option. - dessert loaded for light bites service was different from the menu described.

DIFFERENT SELECTION OF CHEESE OFFERED AS PER MENU . As per the FIRST CLASS  menu there were  5 types of cheese offered to customers however as per catering there were only 3 different types of cheese available
Different deserts,-For your info, catering has advised us that they did not have enough Caramel Choux desert and was substituted with Tiramisu.
Did not get her mixed grill and best bele bath choiceOnly 2 and one choice available respectively
Diabetic Meal Request -Purser note was written informing to provide DBML for crew however it was not loaded on the flight.
DESSERT UNDERCATERED.-With a load of 19:7 special meals and 3 of each choice was catered making the total 19.-Crew struggled as there was no extra to work with.-4 customers went without their choice.
Dessert Feedback-The nammoura from the Selection of Arabic pastries was dry from the middle , should be accompanied with a syrup to make it more soft before serving to the customers.
DESERT MISSING ON CHML TRAYS.Five CHML  trays were missing chocolate deserts.
Description: + Choice unavailable - beef- Many customers were not able to have first choice of beef. - Ratio chicken 70% beef 0% - Many customers were very disappointed.
Description of the food choice available does not match with a menu
Demand for chicken was more greater than the rest of the choices on the Menu.

Delegated Alvaro for breakfast service preparation - Alvaro is a very hard working crew he has ability of taking responsible, Alvaro was delegated for the last service which was breakfast as I when for my break Alvaro was explained when to load the meals and heat the meals, as I came back from the break I could see everything was prepared towels was ready meals was heating in oven its showed me that what ever was delegated to Alvaro he followed it properly and also all the customer was happy no complains.- Alvaro is very organized crew kept galley clean which positive sign to all customer where the food for all customer comes from.- Alvaro showed his hard work and his interest towards his job.
Dear team please make sure CHML is provided for this customer TY

Dear Tania,I just flew with one of your shining stars: Edyta, 434960.Edyta displayed exceptional team spirit. She conducted the service in Economy Class and upon completion, she came to Business Class and assisted grade 1's one, which made it possible for us have our legal break. Edyta had a very positive attitude, displayed a genuine smile at all times. Edyta worked really hard. She was always the first one to volunteer to take call bells. I just thought I would share this with you.

Dear Soraya,Serge was brilliant on today's flight. Although he was assigned J/C position for this leg of the flight; we had a call out for another crew member and Serge gave the option to her to work in whichever cabin she wanted, considering she worked out of grade, I consider this very generous of him.Serge visited J/C and some customers were not happy with a few things such as seat configuration and delay. Serge did not hesitate to step in and assist, not that his translation was required being a language speaker, but he stepped in out of his own will to assist, and being customer oriented, he of course wanted our customers to be happy.

Dear Soraya,I just flew with one of your inspiring leaders: Zita, 400986.Zita set her team up for success through delivering a destination-specific team talk, setting goals and following up on those goals on board, always focusing on customers' experience.Zita walked the talk and led by example. The customer-centric behaviour she talked about during our pre-flight briefing was role modelled by her on board and the rest of the team followed suit.Zita organized for results. She managed to pass cabin secure checks well in advance and handed paperwork over to me before TOD.Zita really stood out as a fully-fledged CSV who managed to bring the best out of her team.

Dear Sir/Madam I would like to share my work experience with my colleague Mladen on EK 205.*Mladen was observed interacting with customers from Adults to children, he also built rapport with his colleagues in all cabins.*Mladen had thorough knowledge whilst assisting me with a customer medical incident onboard and reassured family member.*Upon arrival to the hotel in JFK Mladen offered to take dinner orders for his colleagues who were tired to step out to grab their dinner and then delivered it individually to their rooms.*Out of departure from JFK Malden was observed assisting the engineer to change seat covers.*After completion of economy service Mladen volunteered to assist his colleagues in business class on all sectors.Overall Mladen was highly motivated and an inspiring role model to his colleagues.I would like to wish Mladen all the best with his tenure with Emirates and keep up the great work.

Dear Sina,I just had the pleasure of flying with one of your shining stars: Sunhwa,  394717.Sun is very customer-centric. She observes customers' behaviour in order to anticipate their needs, tailoring the service to meet their personal requirements, always paying attention to details, ensuring procedures are followed and standards met at all times. I was kept informed about customers' satisfaction and observed preferences on both sectors. Sun is a very hard working crew member. She does her job well and offers help to colleagues constantly.Sun is a job to fly with. She takes pride in her job and it does in the way she works. As a result of Sun's outstanding performance, customers got off the airplane with smiles on, making positive remarks about their Emirates experience.I just thought I would share this with you.

Dear Sarah, I hope this E-mail finds you well.I'm writing to you with regards to the exceptional performance of crew member Rade Vukmirovic, whom I've had the pleasure of flying on this trip to Chicago and back. Rade had his CSV training done and shortly after he had to leave the company for a year for family reasons. Now he is back and working as a GR1.  I could easily appreciate the CSV training and the leadership skills in his working style. He takes genuine care of customers and colleagues and ensures everything is looked after and up to standards. It is rare to see a GR1 crew member owning customer experience  and taking initiative and responsibility at this level.  For this reason a would like to acknowledge his performance and praise him.It was pleasurable working alongside another crew member that could be in my same position.Keep in mind you have some good CSV material here for the next time the upgrade opens!

Dear Sandra,I am sending you this email to highlight the outstanding performance of Ciara on our flight to Moscow.In addition to a superior and outstanding performance with the customers and colleagues, what brought our attention is the extra care that she has showed to us during this flight.She brought up with her a selection of specialty tea, some cinnamon, ginger and waited for a calm moment after the completion of the service to prepare for each one of us, in all three cabins, a cup of her signature tea, which had really showed how much she really care for us.Sometimes its really little things that shows how much people care about each other and Ciara had really demonstrated this on this flight and the least thing that I can do is to praise her performance with those few lines.Cordially yours,Rami

Dear Samantha,I'm so pleased to share with you the observations I had on the performance of Marko on the flight. Took photos of customers and took care of a customer who was with an infant, ensured the customer was looked after since he wanted his infant on the floor.

Dear Patricia, I just flew with one of your shining stars: Jacqueline, 452055.Jacqueline never missed an opportunity to interact with our customers, always anticipating their needs and making the flight more enjoyable to them.Even before the flight stared properly, she was already shining with our customers in the terminal building. There were two UM's waiting to board in BNE and she realized that they had watery eyes. So she took the time to go there and talk to them. Through her interactions with them, she came to know that they spoke Portuguese and that was a great piece of information as she passed it on to me and I was able to reassure them in their native language. Apart from displaying customer-centric behaviour, Jacqueline worked really hard. She never stood still in the galley. She was always the first one to volunteer to take call bells and was her CSV's right hand in the galley.I just thought I would share this with you.I am sure Jacqueline will have a fruitful career with Emirates.

Dear Patricia Walsh,I would like to bring to your attention the exemplary performance of cabin crew Ainsley Forrest.During todays flight she had a very disappointed customer who on opening his tray table some wine droplets were still on it. He showed his disappointment and displeasure stating that Emirates been a muslim airline that its not acceptable. She immediately took ownership of the problem and cleaned tray, apologised and offered him some hand sanitizer of which he was deeply appreciative.She then went ahead and organised the whole team to sign card for her colleague Andrea who was celebrating her birthday and also got her a small gift from the duty free. Dear Judy,On yesterday's flight, several customer approached Vinicius to thank him for the service, and several shook his hand while doing so.

Dear Hassan, I am raising this report to highlight excellent performance of your crew member Samuel Sri Tuong Won.
