Dear Fawzia,I just had the pleasure of flying with one of your inspiring leaders: Sofia, 406560.Sofia is a fully-fledged CSV. I did not have to look at name badges to see who was in charge, as Sofia stood out as an inspiring leader at all times. She takes pride in her job and it shows. Sofia had a printout on which she added relevant flight information to set her team up for success. The Y/C cabin was kept tidy, toilets replenished and customers cared for at all times.Sofia sent her team off in the cabin to take pictures, entertain children, help mothers' with infant, anticipate customers needs.Needless to say, we had a successfully flight from which customers got off with smiles on, making positive remarks about their Emirates experience.As a matter of fact, Sofia never behaved as CSV. She was the purser in her cabin; ensuring procedures were followed, standards met (and surpassed), workload fairly distributed, crew were praised, developed and safety was her number one priority. Sofia took ownership of customers' experience and I was kept informed about customers' satisfaction and crew performance at all times.   Sofia is a great leader. Calm, organized, inspiring, friendly and knowledgeable. She played a vital role in us being able to deliver our customers the world's best in-flight experience.I just thought I would share this with you, as Sofia's outstanding performance could not go unnoticed.

Dear Fawzia,I just flew with one of your inspiring leaders, Luis Reyes: 407348.Luis did a great job in owning customers' experience and crew performance.During boarding (ex-DXB) he came to know that one customer would like to have her own wheelchair once we landed in CPT. So he liaised with flight dispatcher and made sure it was available upon arrival. Customer was delighted. I was kept informed at all times.Due to Luis' effective recourse management skills, we were able to have our legal break on DXB-CPT sector. He re-allocated working positons successfully so that one of his grade 2 (Edyta) could assist J/C crew. Luis conducted the outstation briefing from a purser's prospective, covering all keys points, praising high performers and motivating the crew to go beyond. Luis was considerate towards a pulled-out crew member. He was happy to stay both sectors in Y/C so that pulled-out crew could stay in J/C.On CPT-DXB sector, once Luis finished the first main meal service, he came to J/C and assisted Business Class crew. I was kept informed about customers' satisfaction and crew performance at all times. Due to Luis' exceptional leadership skills, we had a successful flight, from which customers disembarked with smiles on, making positive remarks about their Emirates Experience.

Dear Anita,I am writing you this email about Scott, and I truly hope that it will be taken into consideration, because people like him are extremely rare. He is one of the only crew I have ever flown with who excels in every sense, in everything he does on board, and I believe he is a natural leader, and should be in the position of a purser, because he is more competent than many. With all the changes in the company, I think this would not be impossible for someone like him who has the experience and deserves this as he is a big asset for the company .He is extremely organized, very attentive to all his colleagues, helping in every cabin and teaching the crew something new every time. The way he interacts with people he impose respect, everyone follows him and trusts him. From a service point of view, the way he interacts with the customers I found it so special, passengers during the flight were asking me about him, he is very attentive to details and he is the living version of the OME. He would always be there to help with any problem and I do not see that there would be anything he could not resolve. He is a crew who brings people back, makes customers fly with Emirates because of the experience they have when he is operating, he follows standards in detail, all crew look up to him and follow and respect him, and this is not only my opinion but the entire team feels the same, and I am positive it is the same on every flight he does.

Dear Amelita, I just flew with one of your shining stars: Christina, 412118.Christina did a great job in building Personal relationships with our F/C customers, anticipating their needs and looking for opportunity to go beyond.She helped Y/C CSV by looking after the flight deck throughout the flight.  Christina also displayed great teamwork. On all sectors, she volunteered to help her colleagues in both J/C and Y/C. Her help was much appreciated for without it, we would not have been able to take our legal rest. Christina is a joy to work with. She is very professional and friendly.

CUSTOMERS' EXPERIENCECustomers were well looked after.Only one complaint from Mrs Ramsey that the cake ordered for her mum was not loaded.Crew made a dessert for her birthday with "happy birthday" written

Customers were welcomed during boarding and escorted to their seatsThey were offered a suite introductionMenu was delivered with full menu and service description by the PurserAll food and drink requests were delivered in a timely mannerCustomers appeared happy with the serviceNo complaints receivedCustomers were bid farewell.

Customers were welcomed by PUR and Cabin Supervisor at UL1 doorF/C crew escorted customers to their seats and F/C suite features/seat function were introduced-PUR introduced herself and after TO menu and wine list was offered-Customers placed their orders and enjoyed their dinner-Customer in 1A had a shower approx. one hour before TOD and stated that she really enjoyed the F/C service.

Customers were welcomed and escorted to their seats during boarding and assisted with their baggage.Customers were offered the menu with full service description available on the flight and those that took the wine list were informed of the caraf available for them.Customers drink and meal requests were delivered in a timely manner and all customers received their meal preference.Customers were bid farewell and assisted down the forward stairs for those that required assistance.
Customers were met and greeted from the L1 door.

CUSTOMERS EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH CREW ATTENTIVENESS- During one of my rotations towards the end of the flight, and while conversing with them about the experience with us, Mrs. Alcorta stated that she actually wanted to compliment the crew, and in particular cc Julen Garcia Garcia, s429320.- Mrs Alcorta stated that cc Julen had been exceptional during the flight, as he had looked after them very attentively and that "you could tell he is very professional and kind". - The customer and her husband were beyond happy with the attention provided by the crew and claimed this had been "their best flight with Emirates".

CUSTOMERS EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTotal on board 8All customers were briefed about DOD and FC facilitiesMost of customers were familiar with our products5 out of 8 customers had lunch and watched ICE ( remaining had lunch in DXB airport lounge )Most common products were the Asian Vegetarian option and our Indian specific route savouries All customers disembarked generally satisfied for the flight

CUSTOMERS EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTotal on board 8 Mr Al Tayer VP Dewa travelling with his entourage made few commendations to Emirates which I referred to individual voyage reports to Customer AffairsAll customers were familiar with DOD and FC facilitiesMost of customers preferred to rest at beginning of the flight and had lunch 3/4 hours into the flightNo shower spa reservation madeFew commendations made by customers in regards to absence of breakfast and cabin defects ( reported individually and logged in log book )

CUSTOMERS EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTotal on board 8 - 2 deadheading cockpit crew -Ethnicities Brazilian and ChineseMost of customers speak only Portuguese hence Fabio was asked to introduce menu, dine on demand and FC facilitiesMost of customers had breakfast after take off and lunch 9 hours into the flightMost popular meal options were scrambled eggs for breakfast and caviar and light meal option Red wines were the most requested during the flight4/8 customers requested to book shower spa - most popular timings immediately after take off and before landing -None of FC customers visited the JC lounge and only 1 customer was observed serving himself from the FC social areaSelection of Portuguese and Mandarin movies was popular amongst all customersAll customers disembarked generally satisfied for the flight experience

Customer Service Feedback- During my introduction I get to learn that Ms. Felzer (travelling with Mr. Marmon- 10G) was first time travellers with Emirates business class. - Highlighted all the products available on today's flight for example world class wine selection, wifi and live TV, selection of movies from the ICE system, introduced the products on the kit bag  and of course the lounge. - Informed the crew about this and that to ensure that they have seamless excellent experience on today's flight.- Asked feedback prior to landing on how was their experience with us today, they both said it was like a dream and that they really love the service.

Customer service comments - entire crew- Mr Lassig came to speak to me after the first service to pass his compliments over for the entire YC team. - He said the crew was very professional, easy to talk too, knew the service well, really cared about everyone, were very fast and attentive to his needs and took care of his family.

Customer service - Mrs Walker was very satisfied with the crew service during the flight for crew members Lucia Patkova 454130 and Mathieu Gaumet 455102 .- She commented that the two crew were very approachable and nice all the flight .- As well they were always smiling and helpful with customers needs .

Customer Service - Mr Qazalbash complimented the crew on their outstanding performance- It is the customers first experience flying Emirates and he said the crew are attentive, friendly and beautiful - He thoroughly enjoyed his flight and hoped his next one was as good
Customer send back his Sandwich selection for the light-bites service - the Sandwich was hard in texture and crunchy in taste.

Customer seated at 09K has complained that the Roasted beef we have served today was her worse meal ever on board.- Customer claimed the beef was very hard and had no taste at all.- The beef appearance was ok, but we had no leftovers to try.- No one else complained about the beef's tenderness or taste.

Customer satisfactions.- It was my pleasure to pull out to operate as purser on Purser Moses's ULR flights.- He was allocated as FG1 from roster.- Throughout the trip we had shared experiences and assisted each other as team leaders.- Specially on the last sector, a High valued family of four.- Mr.Charters had some disappointment from unavailable size of his First class amenity.- They four had book for the last four showers before landing.- After the first five showers, both showers drain could not perform and the water start rising up to about 2 inches.- Mr.Charters said he did not mind the water as long as shower itself working.- Purser Moses did not want the family to disappoint further more. He start manually drain the first shower.  And he managed to dried the other shower for the customers by hands pumping the dirty water into plastic bottles.- His unhesitating and lead by examples made the team involving on this mission.- The High valued family could have the last four shower before landing. - It was benefits for me to have him working along on this trip.

Customer Ms Du was very happy about her first experience with Emirates, specifically from cabin crew team member Tomasz Jasion 416753 performance.During meal appreciation customer told me how cabin crew Tomasz was helpful, friendly and considerate.-Tomasz helped customer with cabin bag and explain the seat functions.-He enrolled customer for skywards.-He recommended cocktails but customer preferred orange juice which was replenished several time.-When customer went to the lavatory Tomasz prepared customer's bed and she was surprisingly happy.-Customer had Emirates souvenir cards that Tomasz made colleagues sign for 'happy first experience.'-Pictures was done for customer also.
Customer Mrs. Ghaddar requested seabas for lunch.Customer was not happy ith the course quality, stated that it is dry and tasteless.

Customer Mrs Mahnaz sitting in 87C stated, that she loved the flight with us, the team, and highlighted especially Iva.- Customer wanted to talk to me and tell me how happy she was, that Iva was always doing anything possible to make Mrs Mahnaz happy (bringing extra fruits, coffee, water, juices etc.) and that Iva would have "always a very genuine smile"- Mrs Mahnaz mentioned, it was her first flight with Emirates, but it shall be many more after her great experience today- Mrs Mahnaz told me she was a manager of a bank and it was great to see how a team and especially some crew members like Iva are performing very well and primary thinking about customer service despite of challenging circumstances like this long flight- Thanks to Iva's background as ground staff, Mrs Mahnaz was highly appreciating that Iva could tell her where to go to collect the voucher for the hotel stay during her 12 hours transit in Dubai, since she has not received this voucher when booking her ticket
Customer Mrs Kutzner ordered special meal vegan a week ago before her flight.Special meal was not provided on this sector.

Customer Mr. Joao who is seated in 15D and a HVC wants to commend cabin crew Ana.Customer requested to speak to CSV Paolo to commend and acknowledged Ana's performance. He mentioned that he was given a warm welcome, he could see the passion and genuine care to him and rest of the customer, something that he has never seen before. Customer really likes Emirates and he would want to see all the crew to be like Ana, an excellent role model.CSV Paolo staff no. 376784 wanted to validate all the customer's observation as he also seen this with Ana's performance. Senior also noticed her warm and care to the customers specially some customers who speaks the same language as her. Ana was seen speaking to all the customers that she encounters. She was always in the cabin and the lounge. It shows her passion with people. Ana is very respectful to senior, communicated well and remained professional the entire duty.

Customer Mr, munusamy stated to me that he loved all the team he stated very friendly ,smiley and very nice personalities.He stated that the crew are very generous with the service and that they really had fun.

Customer Mr Wang was offered his special meal request diabetic meals.Customer was not happy about the rice quality.Customer refuse different meal and finished his requested diabetic meal.Customer claim rice was too hard and no tea from china was available.
Customer Mr Maruri stated that he did not request for a LFML so would like to cancel the request for the special meal. He would like to have a regular meal from the menu.

Customer Miss Hyatt a 5 year old girl seated on 32B lost her favourite stuffed toy and was very sad and distraught.Ahmed took a personal issue with the matter and followed up extensively with the ground staff .When they were unable to find it Ahmed consoled the little girl and was even ready to buy a stuffed toy from Duty Free with his own money to cheer her up.There was no stuffed toy available ,so he got a collection of stuffed toys from the toy bag and presented it to her .He looked after her and tried his best to cheer her up.His care and personal attention really touched her parents who were so happy to see him take what seemed like a trivial matter so seriously and empathise with their daughter

Customer Lost a family member.During decent Mr.Noble informed me, that his mom had passed away in Dubai, and he needs to get back to Dubai as soon as possible.Customer was observed to be in tears.Customer asked if there is anyway that I can get in touch with the air port to get on the first flight back to Dubai.Information was passed to captain and captain passed info to DXB. Reply was sent back requesting the customer to meet the ground staff at the transit counters.Customer appreciated the effort, tanked me and the captain.When Mr.Noble came back on board on the return sector, he was so happy to be back and thanked us again.Customer disembarked thanking the crew.

Customer found a piece of foil in his meal choice.- During the light bite service, Mr. Mcginn brought to my attention that he have found  a piece of foil cover a diameter of 1x1cm, in the Lamb Pie, found in between the minced meat.- Asked crew member Lisa if she checked prior to delivered the meal, Cabin Crew Lisa stated that she checked and there was nothing on the Pie and Galley operator Ali stated that he made sure that there was no foreign object on the pie.- Customer stated that he found the piece of foil inside the pie in between the minced meat.- As I went to YC to grab the Foreign object form, the Lamb pie that was left in the galley to be stowed in the product and audit container was gone and being discharged by the galley operator Ali, despite informing everyone in the JC galley that there was a piece of foil inside and I need to report it, hence there will be no foreign object report in the product audit container.

Customer found a large stone in the Arabic sweets from loungeI was called to speak to Mr. Randev who was very upset as he has bitten a stone inside the Arabic sweet.He said that he is traumatised by the experience and showed me a stone which he said he found inside.When I asked if he had been hurt, he said that he is not, just mentally traumatised. He declined medical advice and help.Customer said that his PA will contact Emirates regarding the incident.He declined the cappuccino that we brought as per his request.

Customer feedback- customer moved to 49D but unable to update KIS as seat blocked in the system.- Ms Brown interfered when customer at 47A has insisted to use the toilet during landing.- she was trying to explain the same customer to sit down for safety matters and that the seat belt sign is on.- after landing customer wished to give feedback on the above safety matter and compliment the crew in dealing with the situation.- email: ladymonnett@yahoo.com, tel: +15012585804.

Customer feedback- customer complimented the professional service of crew member Eftihia 448169.- he informed me and the Purser, that he was well looked after during the flight.- Eftihia knew that on that seat is a HVC prior to boarding start, making a note of customers name and preferred drink.- as customer did not wish to eat, she was offering him his preferred drink.- after landing she made way to customer who wished to disembark fast, in order to be able to catch his connecting flight.- customer disembarked very happy.
CUSTOMER FEEDBACK- Customer claimed that the lamb satay we serve today is not up to the standard. She claimed that its horrible and requested to change to another meal.

Customer Feedback that the Roasted Salmon was too salty-During meal service , Miss Tan informed cabin crew Teresa that her choice of meal which was the roasted salmon was too salty for her liking.-Cabin supervisor Noreen saw that about 4 customers who choose the roasted salmon did not finish their salmon choice .

Customer feedback regarding the "Fideua" hot meal choice stated that: The "Fideua" was tasteless and was not prepared in a traditional way. The noodles were cooked separately from the proteins/ingredients, instead of together.

CUSTOMER FEEDBACK REGARDING SCRAMBLED EGG ­-During breakfast service, Mr. Arshad claimed that scrambled egg that we served was looking not presentable for J class meal, it was tasteless and it looked soggy.-Customer expected more presentable food in J class by Emirates next time.

Customer feedback received-Many customers gave feedback stating the Lamb Sausage option for lunch and the Lamb Kebab option for breakfast was not to their liking.-Feedback was received from customers directly and from crew.-Lamb options were the least popular on demand.-Customer profile was mainly westerners, including European and Australian customers.-There were shortage of the other meal choices and some customers were unhappy.

CUSTOMER FEEDBACK ON AVML              *Mr.Shah did not like his AVML.* He stated that it was not presentable as compared to the other J/C meal ,the veggies were cut in big chunks and the rice was in lumps.* Tastewise he said that the meal was blend.

CUSTOMER FEEDBACK DISSATISFACTION-Ms Al Shamsi had breakfast and tried two main meals Classic Omelette and Musabaha-The customer stated that quality of food was very poor and not up to her expectations -Asked the customer to give specific and she stated that eggs were smelly and Musabaha was not an Arabic dish and tasted off -Ms Al Shamsi also stated that she would like to see portions smaller in size -Only one more cust,er had breakfast which was a different option Batata wa bayd mfarakeh and did not complaint
Customer feedback about the sandwiches -Customers were complaining that it was really hard to open the plastic bag to take the roast turkey with cucumber and mustard mayonnaise sandwich out.

Customer feedback about the mealCustomer said that the brioche is not fresh and is hard.Customer said that he does not like the main course, scrambled eggs, as it does not look appealing.Customer did not have any other comments.

CUSTOMER FEEDBACK - AVML- Ms Metha had flown on the 9th BOM-DXB.- The AVML offered on that flight was very bland according to her feedback. - Ms Metha wanted me ensure that her feedback will be passed onto the catering department.

Customer feed back about meal option-Ash ghooreh-Ash gooreh is Persian style beef braised in sour grape broth with rice and lentis. -Mr Karim claimed that the Arabic description says that it is a soup. -Explained to the customer that the meal is cooked in broth but it is not a soup.

CUSTOMER FEDBACK ON AVML -Ms Rekha Srinath stated that the her special meal  AVML did not taste well and had a foul odour coming from the food .-Customer further added that the desert was not fresh and wanted me to document her feedback to the concerned department .-Customer was not upset about the same .

CUSTOMER EXTREMELY HAPPY WITH EMIRATES- Mr. Esteban is a mine engineer and due to his work he travels fairly often. The customer also commented on the  attentiveness of the crew and "how wonderful and smiley" we had been. He was totally thrilled by the experience.

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCEMs Shimozaki expressed her satisfaction with the service delivered by crew member Azusa Yuriguchi (451600). She said "I am extremely pleased with Azusa, she made us feel at home. Today we are very impressed, there was a post card from Dublin on our seats when be boarded the plane. This postcard means a lot to us as it is our favourite place, where our daughters are students. It was written in Japanese and she is wishing us a safe trip back to Osaka".

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCEMrs. Flannery provided feedback regarding the hospitality and care of Katarzyna Nozka (450251). She said "I am so anxious and afraid of flying, I have been praying since I got to the airport, but this young lady took me for a walk to the kitchen, she showed me how to watch movies and listen to music, and when I visited the other attendants in the back, she gave me her hat and took 2 pictures of me that I am gonna give to my grandchildren in Dubai, they will love this story. Thank you very much".

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCEMr. Shimozaki provided feedback about the service delivered by Chelsea Cozby (433443). She gave me 3 beers that I really like. Thank you".

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTwo customers travelling None of customers had on board meal - stated they eat in DXB airport loungeCustomers preferred to restTea was served before landing as requestedBoth customers disembarked generally satisfied for the flight experience

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTotal on board 8 ( majority connecting through DXB )All customers were familiar with FC suite facilities and DOD All customers had dinner ( most popular vegetarian options )None of customers have chosen amongst wine selectionMajority of customers requested for a hot drink before landingFew  suite defect did not allow customers to have a fully positive experience ( refer to individual voyage reports )Generally all customers disembarked satisfied

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTotal on board 8 , flight time 3:30 hrs4 customer had dinner ( rest declined as they've already eaten in HYD airport lounge )All customers were familiar with DOD and FC suite facilities Customer enjoyed a wide selection of Bollywood movies on the ICE ( newest releases )  and hot drinks before landingAll customer disembarked generally satisfied with the flight experience

CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE SUMMARYTotal on board 4All customers were briefed on DOD and FC services and facilities Most of customers were familiar with productsMajority of customers had lunch 5 hours into the flight and snacks before landing with selection of hot beverages Most popular products were caviar ( all four customers ) starter and DomPerignon champagne, served throughout the flight as highly requested All customer reserved shower and spa ( 1 hour before landing was most popular timing )None of the customers visited the JC lounge nor the social area even if informed about their presence Customers disembarked generally satisfied for the flight experience

CUSTOMER CARE IN ALL CABINI had a chance to work with Kazuhiko on DXB-CMN, We had many Japanese customers in every cabin.  he checked my KIS tablet , he went  to introduce himself and checked if they were comfortable and if they needed anything. He was very polite and attentive to all customer.

CSV Sofia Rodrigues Pereira  406560 displayed a dedicated approach towards her role as a cabin supervisor.She was actively seeking out for opportunities to meet/ exceed customer expectations in her cabins.During the first sector DXB-LIS, She was observed paying special attention to Mr. Rice on 3A ( 73yrs) when he approached crew regarding his medical condition and the implications of unable urinate due to enlarged prostate. It was worrisome as there was no treatment available onboard besides reassuring the customer. Sofia kept checking on the customer in an attempt to distract him from overthinking about his condition. Additionally there was also a family with a child who was crying during Lunch service. Sofia ensured that the parents were offered to eat individually in order to accommodate their crying daughter.On the current sector LIS-DXB, Sofia once again spotted another customer who was suspected to have suffered from  mild seizure but was responsive. Sofia prompt in taking his vital signs and communicating the same to the entire team .She was confident in handling the incident on her own despite the service was in progress.

CSA PERFORMANCEI had the pleasure to work with Ritchel on this flight. Ritchel displayed a very positive and professional body language towards her colleagues and customers at all times. She followed the I & U standards at all times.She liaised with me and kept me informed at all times, for example; In the beginning informing me that Shower SPAs are operational, informed me before going for her cabin rotations, effectively informing me of defects etc.She set-up the Shower SPAs according to the set standards and kept the Shower SPAs organised and tidy at all times. She was present outside the shower SPAs to welcome customers during boarding and later effectively liaised with the FGIs for Shower SPA reservations.She displayed punctuality to conduct her rotations on both sectors to ensure the Shower SPAs as well as JC and EY lavatories are replenished and kept tidy at all times.She was able to identify the cabin defects in all classes effectively and informed me.She extended help to her fellow crew members whenever needed.
CROISSANTS- Not enough croissants to offer every customer from bread basket round.- Completed 75% of cabin before running out.- Recommend loading one extra pack.
CROISSANTS SHORTAGEWe did run out of croissant during the services.
CROISSANTS SHORTAGE- There were 12 croissants catered for the bread basket, and passenger load was full (42).- Croissants were a popular choice and there was a shortage of approximately 6.
CROISSANTS NOT LOADED- Croissants were in the menu; however, not loaded.- Customers were asking for them.
CROISSANT SHORTAGE- Not enough croissant to offer for the all cabin- 5 customers asking for croissant but unable to offer.- Several customers asking for a second croissant.

CROISSANT NOT ENOUGHThis is to inform that for breakfast service only 8 croissants were loaded as part of bread basket service in j/c (4 on each side).Even though we had few DND the cabin was full (42 customers) and the croissant were already finished by the end of the first part of the cabin.Suggestion would be to load extra croissants for breakfast service

Crew voluntarily assisted with cabin service.- For sector DXB-FRA, after meal service in Y/C was done, Anglia voluntarily assist with J/C service until service was done.- Also on sector FRA-DXB, Anglia assisted with Y/C service as well.
CREW UNHAPPY WITH NO CREW MEAL- All crew was upset that there was only 1 chicken hot meal and 3 chicken basil calzone and 3 small salads for them to eat.
Crew ran out of fruit sticks in J class Lounge.There were no customers complaints received.
Crew positive behaviour.-Please note that due to the light load in F/C and the full J/C cabin , Crew Limin suggested to go and help in J/C and she did a great job.

Crew PerformanceThis is in regards to crew member Greg whose performance I would like to highlight.Greg was observed very organised from the time he boarded the aircraft. All kit bags, bags with pyjamas and slippers were neatly organised and put away in stowage. First class galley felt neat and clean immediately.Greg assisted in J class and Y class cabins for the main services when F class cabin was not busy.He also served customers in F class when he was left alone during my rotations.Greg is well versed in using the CMT which he did to send seat messages for Duty free, reset seats for IFE defects, etc. Greg used the Elite KIS tablet to get customer information and to update profiles.

Crew performanceMiguel really impressed me on both sectors dubai seychelles dubai.Out of Dubai, we had a small delay. Miguel took the opportunity to prepare everything n the galley on ground. He had prepare all the drawers for the breakfast carts and stowed them away for take off, he had prepared milk joggers, put linen on carts and put tea and cooffee sachets in the tea plts. He had already written the special meal stickers and had placed them on the trays since he had seen printer was not connecting.Out of Seychelles, he was the mid galley operator where he prepared two bar carts but had no meal carts. He double ended three meal carts and took one bar cart on his own. He is extremely helpful, hardworking and knowledgeable about products on board.He also asked me for my kiss tablet to enrol a skywards member.He is very situationally aware at all times of everything around him. During the service, seatbelt sign went on and off quite a few times both sectors. He took it on himself to make PA in economy . I wish him good luck in his future

Crew performanceI observed crew Victoria's performance as below:- She volunteered to help breakfast service in economy.- She used proper service phrase and displayed smile as well. - She delivered the service in professional manner.

Crew performanceI observed crew Matteo's performance as below:- He volunteer to operate M2 galley.(PAX load :175)- He checked and prepared all catering item in timely manner and prepared service accordingly.- He communicated with M4 galley operator and run the service smoothly. - He was not only in the galley but also he was in cabin to attend customers.- He demonstrated smile and professional posture to colleagues and customers.

Crew performanceI observed crew Daniela's performance as below:- She volunteered to help breakfast service in economy.- She help the service from beginning of service- She used proper service phrase and displayed smile to customers as well.

crew performanceCarley was observed being active in the cabin and checking on customers satisfaction, when Carley identify  2 customers that had been missing their connecting flight she ensured that they are enjoying their flight, listen to them carefully, reassure them  and monitored them through the flight ,she also raised a KIS report informing the company with regards to the customers experience Carley ensured all HVC are welcomed back and monitored through the flight Carley was observed helping her colleagues in the other cabins with the service showing a great support and team work among her colleagues Carley was operating in Y class and after she finished the service in economy class, she went to help her colleagues in J class, while doing that,  she checked the toilets for the cleanness and she observed one of the toilets very dirty having excrements on the floor , Carley didn't wait for any of the crew to take an action and she showed and exceptional role model by cleaning the toilet herself.-People like Carley are an asset for the company and was a pleasure flying with her .

Crew performance.Mr.Balasubramanian is a frequent traveller with Emirates and has been flying with us for many years.Customer said that he is so pleased to witness a set of cabin crew who are caring towards customers, team  led by CSV Pushan Rettiganti s401369, When stopped by the customer he further highlighted that crew on today's flight looked very happy and smiling and have attended to customers very regularly.Customer has observed Pushan with children assisting parents and sorting out issues in the cabin, customer from his words said Pushan is a true leader.

Crew performance. -I'd like to highlight the outstanding performance of crew member Corina Sterea. -She was galley operator on to days flight but was both efficiently organised and ready with her galley at all stages of the flight and in the cabin insuring customers were served and looked after in a timely manner.-I later found out she had not been feeling very well which was not at all evident as she smiled and assisted her colleagues and her customers.-I have very high respect for Corina as I feel she is a valuable asset as a team member and would make an outstanding team leader as supervisor due to her attention to detail and service awareness.

Crew performance It was observed that Marzia was  very proactive from the briefing.She came early to the briefing and was well organized with her documents.She wasted no time once on the plane by preparing pre departure items and preparing things that would insure the smooth flow of the service,Her galley skills were really good, she was very organized and always kept the galley tidy.She was also seen interacting with customers in a friendly and professional manner and always maintaining a smile.Her performance was the same on both sectors.She is A very hard working crew and pro active maintaining standards at all times .

Crew performance I would like to highlight crew member Petronella's performance for the flight.Crew member was observed to be enthusiastic about her job and enjoyed performing to the best of get ability.She assisted in J class and Y class on both sectors without being asked.Since nil customers on ADL DXB sector, Petronella was in J class during boarding helping with pre departure duties and after take of was in Y class for dinner and breakfast services.  Crew member also organised VGML from crew meals loaded in F class for customer seated in 31 C.

Crew member Zied Ben Salem volunteered to operate as cabin supervisor when pulled out crew member stated that he was not confident to operate as cabin supervisor.Zied was very supportive and motivated to operate as cabin supervisor.Zied showed excellent customers service, great leadership skills, played as a super role model, created great team spirit, and customers service atmosphere.Zied conducted several team talk during the flight, kept his team united and motivated, spent time in the cabin conducting conversation with customers, managed to fix several IFE problem, and made sure that all customers concerns and request are followed up by himself during the flight ( special meal request, IFE problem and medical case)Zied was very professional when dealing with medical cases such as vomiting. swollen leg, he passed details to myself and cockpit clearly and made sure that both customers are monitored and reassured while cabin supervisor and myself completing paper work and contacting medlink.I was very impressed with Zied s performance and behaviours during both sectors, he remained calm and positive at all times, very motivated and proud f his uniform and emirates brand.I received good comments about Zied's performance and hospitality from our customers ( high valued customers ) cockpit and crew members.

CREW COMPLIMENTS-Dear Loubna, I'm  writing to you as I had a pleasure of flying with one of crew members from your team.-Alice was working in my team on three sectors DXB-SYD-CHC-SYD-During this time I observed Alice go above and beyond to ensure customer comfort and welfare.-I captured some of examples of Alice's performance in her MFP for first sector, however she continued to amaze me through following days. -Alice brought sweets so she could give them out to children while taking pictures.-She took care of three UM's we had traveling with us to SYD, she ensured they knew how to use IFE and had food and drinks.. -On each sector, Alice ensured all her duties were completed meticulously.-I observed Alice when she was serving meals, she uses full menu terms for each row of customers and offers full selection of drinks, informing that bar was following with more choices.-On SYD-CHC-SYD, Alice took pictures of children on ground, during boarding and after completing pre departure duties, as she realized that there might not be sufficient time to do it after take off.-Alice took over the galley management when I was on break and when I was supplementing flight crew, while they needed to step out.-Alice offered to take over a cart from other crew member, who she knew done more carts then her.-I noticed Alice always has a tray with water prepared, during boarding and cruise, so she can attend to call bells swifter.

CREW COMPLIMENTS - Vivian is an extremely hard working crew member. As the IO was seated in his area, Vivian made sure that the seat was checked and fully operative, as well as ear plugs were placed in the seat as this was customers preference. He was observed chatting to our IO ensuring he was well settled in. After take off as Mr. Gross was asleep and had a DND sticker, Vivian was observed checking on the customer and the minute our customer was awake Vivian offered him food or a drink which the customer was happy to take.- We also had a customer seated in 7A who boarded on crutches and needed assistance. I assisted her to her seat, however later on I observed Vivian taking care of her and helping her reach her bag etc.- He has a very gentle yet very professional way when talking to customers and has a smile on throughout the flight.- Vivian was very hard working and delivered the meals with speed, making sure the service quality is not compromised- Very respectful towards his fellow colleagues and has a very friendly and genuine approach towards both customer and his colleagues

CREW COMPLIMENT FOR DISPLAYING SUCH WONDERFUL GESTURES NOT ONLY TO CREW BUT TO CUSTOMERS AS WELL.-Rizwaan was not only so positive on this flight but he showed his willingness to make a customer's day.- A lady travelling with her friends to the Maldives was celebrating her 50th birthday. Using all his personal supplies, Ridwaan had a happy birthday banner, battery operated candles, birthday cards and balloons. All which was used to surprise the celebrant in the galley.- Photos were taken, extra cakes from business class were given, and a glasses of champagnes were served. - Such a great touch for the ladies just before the mini holiday. I was surely impressed with Rizwaan.- Rizwaan was also quick to notice that the crew allowance was short by 9 pounds. (61 pounds were in the envelop but all crew signed for 70pounds.) He took initiative to inform the reception about the discrepancy and email all the crew with regards to the matter as most of the crew did not check their envelops . Before checking out from the hotel, 9 pounds was returned to each and every crew member. Big thanks to his attentiveness and concern for his colleagues. ­- Ridwaan also took the initiative of helping a wheelchair customer to her seat during boarding.  He arranged the on board wheelchair without being prompted, and ensure that the customer seated at 45J was moved from the on board wheelchair using all the SOP's and doing so with the utmost kindness and compassion towards the customer.

Cost cutting - ObservationIn the present day and time to reduce the cost lot of initiative/changes  from the catering with regards to loading of food quantity are taking placeI'm taking this opportunity to give you some relevant facts about my flight regarding same*****Case A***** Main meal choice were only catered one of each  , number of customers originally booked "3" , so in this case no two customer will be able to order same hot meal choice Arranging a alternative at times becomes not only challenging but impossible for the crewA premium cabin on-board customer experience majorly affectedYes Indeed we saved cost of it----Case B-----Why only reducing meal quantity is only seen as a best opportunity to reduce the cost...?On our flight units of fresh juice provided were as follow1. Orange juice 6-7 bottles2.Carrot juice 2 bottles3.Grapefruit juice 2 bottles4.Fresh detox mix juice 2 bottles5.Banana vanilla smoothie 2 bottlesGrape juice, detox juice are the least popular juice among customer in general on our flightsI request the respective department to initiate an on board survey with premium galley operators to collect data on the unused stock  of fresh juice  on every flight across the network to gain useful insight

Consumption of ChampagnePls also consider loading small champagne bottle to reduce the wastage.Observed at times when customer load is 1 or 2 pax and if customer request for a champagne we had no other option but to open the big bottle I believe a huge cost saving can be achieved by reducing the wastage of opened champagne bottle that otherwise goes into the galley sink on top of descend.

COMPLIMENT ON CREW AND SERVICE*After landing, i was having a conversation with Ms. Liepert, where she complimented the crew on this flight, and the service*Ms. Liepert stated that on her previous flight from Dubai to Sydney, the crew and service were not as good as this one*She was happy with the customer service on this trip, toilets being replenished and the happy vibe she felt from the crew, even though we waited a long time for customers' disembarkation from a remote stand in Sydney airport

Compliment made by customer and customer care performance1. Customer Care- Purser note was made regarding a customer that needed assistance as he had a vision problem observed by the previous purser/crew.- During boarding, Marijana assisted him ( 36A ) by opening up the hattrack,  placing his bag inside and making him literally feel the location of his seat. She introduced herself by name, informed the customer that she will remain on the side during the flight and he must not hesitate to call on her for any assistance ( IFE/Meal )- During the meal service, Marijana offered him his preferred meal/ choice and opened the tray table for him, placed his meal down in front of him and ensured he was aware what side his drink was.- Marijana constantly monitored the customer throughout the flight and again assisted him on arrival with disembarkation.Customer Compliment2. A customer seated 38H was standing at the aft galley having his coffee. During the conversation, he asked Marijana if she watched the Australian open  or seen those girls in the Emirates uniform.- She said yes, but he then turned around and told her that with the looks she has, and how well groomed she is, she should have been there representing the EK brand.- Marijana was very grateful for the compliment and the customer said he felt he needed to tell her the truth.- As a Purser I felt proud with that comment like that.

Complemented by Mr. Mohamed Chibani seated at 8A and Mr.Mohamed Amine Megherbi seated at 8B.They stated that they had a unique service through Marwa's extra personal touch and that she was generous and smiley throughout the flight and attended their requests as fast and efficient as possible.Effective and professional during service steps.Added extra effort to reach customer's ultimate satisfaction.

Complaint re: quality of the First Class meal.- The customer complained that the standard of Emirates food had declined.- He said that the lemon chicken main course was dry, tasteless and rubbery. He said that 'it was like hospital food'.- The customer said that his meal on his previous flight to LHR had been awful too. - The customer asked me to write about the standard of the meals. He said this is not what he expects to receive in First Class.
Complained that the chicken was not good and that we should have more then one choice. He was also asking if he could have food from business or first class.

Cherry displayed strong leadership and organisation of her team. She set very clear expectations in her team talk and communicated effectively regarding time management, e.g. pre landing timeline to ensure the cabin was prepared and secured on time.Cherry used recent on board updates and ensured the standards were implemented by the cabin crew, e.g. after take off allocation of duties. Cherry displayed a strong willingness to complete tasks, e.g. collection of foundation envelopes.Cherry was practice to learn the functions and role of Purser. She took on extra responsibilities, e.g. cabin lighting, English P.A's. Etc.It was an absolute pleasure to fly with Cherry. Her strong leadership, knowledge and willingness to complete tasks was admired.

Cami displayed strong leadership of a medical case in YC. She confidently attended to the customer and contacted ground medical services.Cami confidently administered medication from the EMK.All paperwork was completed accurately.Cami attended to a crew accident in YC just prior to landing. ASMA 455889 injured her head. Cami displayed strong support for Asma. Cami confidently liaised with medical services in MUC. Cami offered to go to the hospital with Asma. Asma did not require further medical treatment.Overall Cami displayed strong knowledge and leadership of both her team and both medical cases.

CALM AND COMPOSED DURING DELAYS* Marwan showed great composure during delays on ground arriving and departing JFK.* He arrived at the briefing smiling and politely talking to his colleagues.*Upon hearing about the second delay after landing he tended immediately to customers requests and diplomatically explained to them that they would be updated shortly.* He was positive throughout these lengthy events but kept his spirits up.* Assisted his seniors by initiating drinks service on ground.

CAKEAfter receiving PIL and noticed customer had following under his name (on his profile):-- SPML-EMD 1768209664919 USD30 CONGRATULATIONS TO THE NEWLY WED COUPLE FROM SPEEDWING FAMILY.- Asked JC galley operator if she had received anything for the customer. She told me catering had mentioned nothing during checks and she had been unable to locate anything special in the galley.- Sent query to ground via VCC. My assumption was that it was paid for champagne but I wanted clarification.- Ground replied it was for a cake but it had not been loaded, but gave me the go ahead to offer champagne instead.- However when we attempted this customer told us both himself and his wife did not drink alcohol.

Cake not provided.-On the PIL it is showing ,SPMl cake,-In Dxd , on ground the catering Supervisor, Called in front of the J class Supervisor, the catering office to check for the cake.-The answer was: "Special meal, cake not provided as waiting list.."-On the KiS tablet, it shows under the Customer 'S profile :WL .-Customer informed.-J class Supervisor, apologized to Mr Mohamed .-J Class Supervisor, showed the KIS tablet ,to Mr Mohamed and explained.-Alternative of desserts offered from lounge or from the menu offered to Mr Mohamed.-Mr Mohamed , declined .-Mr Mohamed , understood, thankful, satisfied by crew efforts.
CAKE NOT PROVIDED-According to the KiS tablet a special meal cake was ordered however it was not provided

CABIN SUPERVISOR WORKING OUT OF GRADE - GRADE 2-This is to document Elisa's performance and effective contribution to a team and customer focussed work environment-Elisa volunteered to work as a GR2 for this month and she took the GR2 role all heartedly and responsively-She was humble in her approach with other GR2's and even showed genuine care and consideration towards them-After the service, she was seen taking coffee orders for them and went to F. class galley to prepare it for them (she did the same on both sectors)-More importantly, Elisa stepped in when mostly needed, bringing her experience as a CSV in medical cases and service recovery-In that aspect, she went above and beyond by taking a heavy workload off off the operating CSV, who said "it was a blessing to have Elisa on this flight"-She indeed took the initiative to get involved on two medical cases (one on each sector) and helped with translation, support to the operating CSV-White interacting with customers, she showed she really cared for their wellbeing and reassured them with kind words and her calm and poised attitude-Elisa also volunteered to take over an issue where customers' IFE did not work for the entire flight-She provided them with alternatives, which they kindly refused as they wanted to stay together and felt the service she had already extended to them, was enough to make them happy they were well taken care of-Elisa used effective listening skills and was engaged with the issue

CABIN CREW WAS COMPLIMENTED FROM CUSTOMERS AND COLLEAGUES-Mitchell contributed a lot on galley management, his arrangement in the galley helped us smoothen the service flow and it was appreciated by his colleagues, especially me as his supervisor.-Mitchell loaded meals for return sector without being asked, he prepared all the galley task related and he took carts during the service , he was extremely quick, yet did not miss the service touch when doing the carts.-Mitchell noticed a gold member gave up his upgrade to J class to other customer, hence Mitchell took a good care of him and his friend, hence I  observed Mitchell was complimented by gold member and his friend when they disembarking the aircraft, Gold member stated "thank your for amazing service, your truly asset for your company"-Mitchell is a problem solver, always with positive attitude and contributor to a successful flight.

Cabin crew volunteered to help in J class after Y class service was finished.- After the first service, cabin crew Khurman offered himself to help J class as light load in Y class allowed to finish the service in a brief time.

Cabin crew Vjekoslav's hard work.- Vjekoslav was an example for the cabin crew with his behaviour, hard work and professionalism. - The flight was short of a CSV and also got delayed aprox. 2 hours out of Birmingham.- He was present n the cabin reassuring customers who were asking about their connecting flights, he took time to explain also to some of our elderly customers how the I F E system is working.- I did not had to prompt or remind him about his duties; I can actually say that there were situations during the service when he was a step in front of me, preparing what I needed him to do.- Also during the service, he kept his calm and professionalism when customers were impatient with their meals or drinks.

Cabin crew ran out of:Soup options.Salmon option.Beef option.And the chicken option.Several customers were denied one or more choices due to the poor loading structure. Only 43 meals were loaded for 42 customers, giving little or no room for manoeuvre. Several customers were very unhappy.

Cabin crew Nassib Madi volunteered to work in J/C due to lack of grade 1 crew.-He took the initiative to operate the galley.-He was very organized and managed the galley excellently.-Before each sector, he would borrow the KIS tablet and checked on the Quick Reference Guide which helped him improve his performance.-He was very pro-active and cooperative.

Cabin crew member GR1 Rahmalisa Asril 420665 was observed to have displayed warmth and genuine care towards the customers on both sectors. She built rapport with the customers during boarding by initiating brief conversations with them.During the service, I have also observed that she addressed each and every customer with their names asked them questions to establish their expectations and overall experience.

Cabin crew member GR1 Oindrila Goswami maximized the use of her language skill (Bengali) to regularly monitor Mrs. Saida Begum, seated at 18F, who started to feel unwell at approximately two hours before landing. I have observed her genuine concern, great empathy and compassion in dealing with the elderly customer. When she came to know that the customer was suffering from gastritis, GR1 Oindrila made sure that the customer had something to eat and drink. She also stayed with the customer for some time to offer comfort and reassurance.As she was working in business class, she readily informed the economy class team about the sick customer and made herself readily available whenever there was a concern raised.Upon disembarkation, she offered assistance to the elderly customer and informed the special handling staff about her condition.According to GR1 Oindrila, the customer felt better prior to landing.
Cabin crew member found a hair inside the Arabic dessert , the ward al sham pastry .It was not a customer related case as a crew member Eden found the hair , the dessert was not offered a customer .

Cabin crew Malden Segan (s441947) informed me during the beginning of the first service that there were five people seating by the row 59HJK, whereas there are only four masks available on the PSU in case of an emergency.

Cabin crew Katarzyna was observed going the extra miles on both sector from Dubai to Gatwick and back.Katerzyna was leading the team when I was not available in the galley for some medical situation.Katerzyna showed a great professionalism and attention to details toward customers the entire journey.Katerzyna was observed helping her crew with the meal carts and bars.Katerzyna was one step ahead the whole flight setting up carts and bars before the actual service.

Cabin Crew Foon worked out of grade to assist Y class with the service in the two sectors.- Foong volunteered to assist during the two sectors coming back from SIN to DXB.- Took meal carts and assisted me with the galley preparations.

ATTN. CCM Janet- GR1 Edward 420214 was very proactive and helpful throughout the whole flight. - Crew was constantly providing assistance to his colleagues and I. - After service, straight away offering drinks to our customers and was observed to be in the cabin at all time. - On our flight there was medical cases, crew came to assist me to look after the customer without hesitation.- There was smoke alarm during cruising, crew took action immediately, however it was an false alarm.

ATTN: CCM Anita Grillo- Mr Gilbertson was very impressed with Louise in the first class cabin.- It was his 70th birthday coming up and Louise went out of her way to make sure he enjoyed his flight.- He sampled many wines and Louise made him a plate with Happy 70th written on it and took his photo.- Her service knowledge is outstanding and she carries all her on-board updates with her so she always has the correct service procedure.- Mr Gilbertson stated she is a credit to the company and he hopes they appreciate having her.

ATTN CCM: Annie Marie MoulinRE: FG1 Marian Saade s 380819- FG1 Mariane Saad to be commended for working very hard and showing a lot of professionalism during the flight.- Since Mariane was the only crew trained on the new B777(The Game Changer) and FG1 Jose and myself flying for the first tie on this aircraft she explained to us everything in detail.- There were a few VIP's on-board i.e. UAE ministers, Mariane handled them very professionally.- Mariane always exceeded customers expectations with going an extra mile.

ATTN CCM:  Karen EarlsRE: CSV Silvia Fernandez Calderon s 419599- CSV Silvia Calderon to be commended for working very hard through out the two sectors and showing a lot of professionalism.- Silvia ensured that pictures were taken for all the kids on-board.- Silvia enrolled five customers to Skywards program.- Observed Silvia going tin the cabin with drinks and doing the clearance.- Silvia handled the customer at 56H very professionally who didn't get his meal choice. She also dealt with a customer at 41J in a very calm manner as the customer insisted to upgrade using his father's miles who was not even on the flight.- Silvia leads from the front and by example.

Attentiveness to an elderly customerWhile leaving the airport, the daughter of one of our customers Mrs. Safiya Mahmoud(8E) asked to speak to the senior in Business class. She was seated in YC and her mother was sat alone in JC. Mrs. Mahmoud's daughter wanted to appreciate Crew member Abdallah for taking such great care of her mother who is an elderly lady on wheelchair and does not talk much. She had asked to be allowed to sleep but when Abdullah saw her awake after the service was completed,  Abdullah went to the customer and patiently explained the whole menu served her and after she was done he assisted her to the lavatory.Abdallah constantly engaged in conversation with this customer as she spoke Arabic and she was very happy to have someone to talk to.Abdallah is very patient and friendly with the customers and I noticed the customers appeared quiet happy with his interaction with them.Mrs. Mahmoud's daughter was quiet appreciative as she claimed that on her mothers previous flight, she had been neglected and no one even offered her a glass of water the whole flight.

Attentive crew members- Mr Singh stated he had found crew members hardworking and attentive on todays sector in economy class upon our interactions towards descent.- He stated specially crew members working at the forwards galley: Merel 434887, Angelina 439864, Lauren 444980 and CSV Mervyn 302010 were very attentive with smiles, they offered hot drinks pro actively and initiated conversations during cruise.- He stated crew members made his trip lovely.

Attention CCM Sina A Taheri- I would like to bring to your attention how amazing Vincent Quabezi401488 performance and behaviour are.- He is so dedicated to the work as he perform every singe details of the FG1 job and even with a unique personality style that have an excellent impact on our customers.- He is so individually personal with customers and colleague and made sure every single customer in FC knows his suit fully.- He talks with high behaviour to customers and colleague and even the crew bus driver.- He is an example for a true successful Emirates crew.- He has a high quality of service and customer interaction whether the load is only 03 or when it is full in FC.

Attention CCM ANita Grillo- I would like to inform you about how a great example Jaime Filho380133 set to any crew on board.- He helps in all cabin.- Image he is an excellent image for Emirates and role model for male crew.- He is so attentive to customers and makes sure they don't ask for any thing as he is always in top of his game.- He has a very high quality of service, behaviour and personality in the cabin and even with his crew.- He worked in YC the whole service when all the customers in FC were sleeping with out being asked to do so.
At the end of flight customer passed compliments about crew professionalism and behaviour towards their customers.Customer liked to thanks emirates and staff for all help and assistance.

Assisting a customer in having a surprise for her husband: - Mrs Alaleeli approached me during the flight asking if there is a way to have a cake with a written message in the flight to surprise her husband in 8E. - She wanted to write " I love you".

Assisted Business class with the service through the Lunch service- Raul assisted in the Business class Lunch service just after they have finished in the Economy class, we were still giving out main courses.- He did clearance of trays, offering wines , drinks, clearing starters .

ASSISITING COLLEAGUES: TEAMWORK-This is to document Christine's positive contribution to this flight where she showed good teamwork skills and great enthusiasm-Christine is a self motivated crew member and is very dynamic and enthusiastic-She has shown that first by the way she communicates: very bubbly personality, interacts with everyone, makes time to speak to customers during the service "where are you flying, is this your first time, etc"-This really stood out on a fatigue prone flight like today ( take off 21h00, landing back in Dubai 06h20)-Christine adopted this behaviour on both sectors of this flight and was also seen interacting with colleagues in J. class-After the service in a full Y. class cabin, she volunteered to go help her colleagues finish the service in J. class - which proved relevant as the service was delayed there-What stood out is also her ability to engage in small conversations with customers during the service and almost consistently with everyone without delaying her meal delivery (she was doing a cart)-She was also seen assisting the cabin supervisor in the galley, setting up carts, special meal, etc-All in all, a very enthusiastic crew member, never shies off to work hard and is of great support to her colleagues

As catering was from DXB, a few meals were frozen. Although the were heated for about 35 mins a few meals were still cold inside, specially the cheese omelette and were returned by passengers.These meals  replaced on the spot and we apologised to the concerned customers. No complains were received about the meals.

Aryel is professional and polite. She is extremely conscientious in the cabin towards customers and nothing is too much trouble. She never complains about anything and always has a friendly smile.I have flown with Aryel before and her attitude is consistent, she is positive and mature and helps to create a pleasant working environment.She goes out of her way to help others and I would like to thank Aryel for contributing to this flight and making such a big impact on many people. We need more crew like her.

ARTICHOKE RAVIOLI- Mr O'Mahony informed me that the main meal 'Artichoke Ravioli' was rather dry and salty.
