ARABIC BREAD NOT AVAILABLE-While still on ground, the galley operator in J/C Gabriela 420589 informed me that there was no Arabic bread provided on J/C catering today.-Caterer was approached early and Arabic bread was requested however it was not brought until the time we had to close doors for departure.
Approx. Six customers asked for additional chocolates after the meal service however none were available.

APPRECIATION-I would like to extend my appreciation to Eglanta for her efforts on this trip.-She is rostered to operate as a GR2 crew for this month and did so with much energy, positivity and team spirit.-She worked well with her GR2 colleagues and ensured she carried her share of the workload within service and out of service times. She was observed actively answering call bells, conducting refreshment rounds and taking pictures of young travellers.-She was also observed assisting in the main deck Y/Class cabin after the upper deck service had been completed, and also assisted in the J/Class cabin. She showed great team spirit and team work.-She did so without being prompted or asked to.

APPRECIATION- the customer through the Arabic translation provided by Cabin Crew Hazem Ramadan 435720, stated that he was very pleased of the service.- he stated that if he could only stay longer in the flight as the amount of attentive service from the crew was exceptional.- he appreciated the cabin crew respecting their utmost privacy (traveled with an Egyptian famous singer at 6E)

Appreciation for Outstanding Performance- Positive feedback about Emilie's performance was received by several customer who had frequented the lounge throughout the flight. They commented on how welcome and well looked after they felt by Emilie who actively engaged with them in a genuine and warm way.- My personal observation matches customer feedback throughout the entire journey.- She was seen offering assistance and looking for ways she could assist her colleagues and seniors with their workload on what was a very busy flight for all the moment she found herself free.- Lounge was kept neat, tidy and always replenished. Was fully aware of latest product changes and did not need to refer to any OBU for visual reference.- Dismantled, closed and sealed the lounge by herself and still offered assistance to her colleagues who were to busy to assist her with her duties without ever complaining.- Purser's observation of Emilie's performance matched mine and it was agreed that it should not go undocumented.

Appreciation for GR1 Courtney-GR1 Courtney was observed to have a very pleasant, kind and genuine nature.-She was very approachable to customers and one can see that she is sincere in her ways-Feedback from customer states that she is also very kind and genuine

Appreciation for excellent performanceLiesbet has operated very well on both the sectors.She has very good attitude towards her job. She is positive, helpful, kind and personnel towards her colleagues and customers.She operated the galley very neatly and safely that at no point I had to prompt her regarding standards not having met.Despite operating the galley, she is constantly in the cabin assisting and attending to customers' needs.During boarding, she assisted most of the wheel chair customers and I observed she was very kind to them.Service flow in the galley was maintained excellently by preparing everything on time, meals were well heated.She prioritized her time very well; service done within time frame even during busy flight, bars closed on time and galley was secured on time.An excellent team player who delivers detailed service with style.I have received good feedbacks regarding her performance from busyness class team.

Appreciation for CSV Maira-CSV Maira showed how she can manage customer issues when there was a customer complaint regarding a crew by responding to customer immediately to listen to the complaint.-She also managed crew well by giving timely feedback with the same crew member to make the crew realize why the customer complained -She showed teamwork when it was observed that she helped her JC team in clearing starters.-She took time in observing crew who had MFP and gave a lot of examples-She is always willing to help where it was need

Appreciation for CSV Hosam-Customer Service: Hosam was observed to be very  approachable and sincere. He is always smiling to his customers and talks to them in a friendly way that he creates a very happy environment.-Knowledge and Image: Image and Uniform is excellent-Leading My Team: Hosam managed very well his galley when he informed me that he took the first row of trays to be able to put spml stickers on the second row.. To make it easy for his team, he also brought all the pizzas and cart from the mid galley himself.-Teamwork: It is very evident that his team really liked working with him and he goes along with the whole team very well

Appreciation for crew member Jeffrey Frizzon ObandoJeffrey is an extremely hard working crew member who goes that extra mile to help his colleagues He was observed taking care of the galley when the CSV was busy doing reports He took the initiative of preparing the carts and ensured that the galley was kept impeccable at all times In brevity, he represents the brand with a sense of pride and diligence Without a doubt , he is quite considerate towards his customers as well He ensures that all their requests are met and service was conducted up to standards It was a pleasure flying with him . I wish him all the very best in his career with Emirates and all his endeavours

Appreciation for cabin crew Nurul Amalina Sanif Nurul is an extremely hardworking crew member who goes that extra mile to help her colleagues .I (Anjali Kakar ) was pulled out for Maa flight . She was quite considerate to offer me the galley position . Nurul  took the initiative of helping her colleagues not only in the cabin but also in the galleyWithout a doubt she represents the brand  with a sense of pride and diligence I would like to wish her all the very best in all her endeavors with Emirates

Appreciation Ahmed s396809Ahmed provided great assistance to a wheelchair passenger who could only stand with difficultyHe assisted him in and out the wheelchair lifting him and Ahmed did so every time without being ask (boarding, disembarking, going to the  toilet)I noticed as well that Ahmed was talking to the customer (even so he didn t speak the language) encouraging him.During the flight, Ahmed helped the customer twice to the toilet even assisting him to go inside and assisting him with his clothesOn second sector as they finished the service earlier in Jc, even so it was a full cabin Ahmed took his initiative and went to help his colleagues in Yc. I saw him doing clearance carts.

APPRECIATION -A wheelchair customer had soiled his trousers while he was seated on the wheelchair at the airport.-The customers seated beside him were uncomfortable because of the stench.-Ground staff were asked if they could arrange for something to change into but they were not able to.-There were no FC pyjama sets on board.-Mohd approached me and readily offered to give the man his pyjama bottoms as he had two sets with him.-The customer was so happy and he accepted the pants which he changed into immediately.
Appetizer-Menu stated cold smoked ocean trout , however salmon carpaccio was loaded.

APPETISER ROASTED BEEF SALAD LOOKS REDDISH*It was observed that the Roast beef on the appetiser for dinner looks reddish.*When the meat removed from the top, a trace of blood stain left on the  strozzapreti pasta.* Tasted fresh meat, most of the comments from the cabin crew.*Most of the clearance trays, roast beef salad was not consumed by customer.

Apart from doing her tasks as R5 and making sure customers were looked after in her area, cabin was secured for take off and landing and collecting used and unused items from her area before getting off the aircraft, she was also observed stepping up to do the following: - Adele took initiative to help her colleague, Yess, in doing her security search in the galley by moving carts and lifting containers for her.- Adele displayed an excellent job on today's flight in helping with service preparations.- On ground, she prepared pre-departure items for customers.  She was also steps ahead in terms of having all drinks drawers prepared, items for hot beverages by hand, juices for the carts and special meal stickers placed on the trays.- After take off, she helped me in heating and loading meals into the carts.- She was also very involved in setting up carts and dismantling them during service times.- After the service, she helped in counting and closing bars, tidying up of the galley and counting juices.

Antonio was assigned , delegated Galley in charge at L5 , as CSV Anna was attending to several economy queries and complaints in the cabin .Antonio organised the entire galley for the Lunch service and ensured a smooth efficient economy service flow .He took initiative to visit the flight deck crew after completing his we care cycle .He assisted the duty free operator 's   both female crew to  carry the Duty free container's to another galley .

Angelos Ventras 455442, was an extraordinary crew member, he was observed taking initiative for the following:- when I was busy checking on the flight crew, he started setting up for the service he  loaded the carts, and guided the team to start the service. - Angelos was checking on the flight crew when I was busy in the cabin.- He had an excellent galley organisation.- he was always smiling in the cabin ; and using polite phrases to our customers , enjoy your meal. -During the whole flight Angelos was talking to the customers, taking care of the skyward member in his area.- On the first  service he noted down customers who they did not have meal choice, and he offered them  preferred meal choices.

Andrew is a highly competent and responsible CSV. He displays a mature attitude and carried out the briefing in NCL. He leads by example and deals with all situations calmly and rationally. He dealt with a suspicious passenger with decorum and also handled a medical situation with empathy.It was a pleasure to fly with Andy and he helped to create a relaxed and pleasant working environment.

Andrea was in general very Customer focused while doing her service, both yesterday in JC and today in YC.There was one occasion in particular, when she got to know, while talking to parents, that one of our young customers is celebrating the birthday today.So Andrea was looking for the way to make this little girl`s (17) experience, and the memory of this flight special.After the lunch service, she arranged (along with her team) the desert from JC, which was beautifully presented with FC flowers, and served it to young lady.On top of that, she went a step ahead, and bought DF item (using her money), and gave it as the gift.The kid was trilled.

Andrea was in general very Customer focused while doing her service, both yesterday in JC and today in YC.There was one occasion in particular, when she got to know, while talking to parents, that one of our young customers is celebrating the birthday today.So Andrea was looking for the way to make this little girl`s (seated at 17B) experience, and the memory of this flight special.

An ordered KSML was not provided for our customer.-According to the catering staff, he had not ordered one; at a later stage I was informed that it would be impossible to provide him with a KSML; at an even later stage I was told that there had been a mistake made with the ordering.

AMOUNT OF JUICES NOT SUFICIENT FOR THE FLIGHT.- A total of 3 juice containers were loaded at the AFT galley and 2 containers in the MID galley by the catering in DXB, resulting in a total of 50 juices packages. - On the first sector (DXB-KHI) only 15 juices packages were used. The amount of juices left for the sector KHI-DXB (35 in total) were not sufficient to comply with the customers requests.- Juices were loaded in each cart as per standard.

Ambreen is definitely one of the most inspiring Pursers I have flown with, she has great leadership flair that shines through everything she does.Laid back but focused on getting the job done right and efficiently, she did not put any unnecessary pressure on myself or the crew, giving us all the platform to work towards achieving the same goal as her: a safe, on time and pleasant flight.Ambreen supported me in many ways, such as writing KIS reports relevant to my cabin, calling Ground Medical support on the first sector of our trip which was extremely short and busy, giving me time to fully focus on running my cabin, and also backed me up for every decision I took.She has very rich knowledge and is keen on maintaining it, and also developing the one of others.She also encouraged crew to seek support in the right manner when they want to achieve any changes relevant to their areas of challenge.

AMAZING TEAMWORK - This is to acknowledge the great teamwork of all the economy class crew members - There was always positivity and real desire to provide the best inflight service - There was one crew down from Dubai till the return rector as there was a shortage of crew - All the crew members in economy class cabin worked together as a team and provided assistance whenever required

Amazing crewAttention CCMs: Amelita Bennett, Annie Moulin, Fawzia Al Hashimi, Richard Topalian, Aisha Almusharrekh, Maitha Abdulla, Zeina Haddad, Adenike Oyenuga, Hala Mansour, Hiran Jayawadene, Ram Murthy, Judy Rebelo, Muhsina Abdulla.- I would like to thank my crew:CSVs Andressa Franzoni400427, Filipe Antunes411579.FG1s: Pamela Shingadia394161, Carmen Lee Liang400368.GR1s: Charlene De Jesus387401, Regina Ungco390024, Terry Todd392900GR2s: Heather Lynch431554, Bilane Mousse441307, Naisa Eleoterio443001, Karim Gaffar443129, J Dean Van Der Westhuizen443410, Amy Burger454143, and Julie Hwang454591 for being so dedicated to the company and the reputation of the company and of course their image.- The aircraft landed late in both destination Dubai and Johannesburg, and we were given in both sectors only 25 minutes for boarding.- In the way to JNB they managed to finish boarding in 15 minutes causing the flight to depart early one minute after being delayed originally 25 minutes from the auto boarding time.- In the way back to Dubai we were delayed from the original auto boarding time by 30 minutes but they finished boarding 439 customers in 17 minutes causing the flight to be ready to depart 3 minutes early.- In both sectors most customers complemented their performance to them and to me.- They managed to win three customers back after having previous bad experience because of crew behaviour and performance.

Amazing Crew Performance Please note that due to the three hours and twenty eight minutes delay in LHE with customers on-board  crew in all cabins showed an amazing performance.Looked after customers especially mother with infants , children and elderly customers.kept drinks and  snacks rotating in the cabin , call bells were answered .managed to calm  customers , kept their smile even on that long day .it was heard from most customers that my crew were amazing and they should be recognised.from my side I observed all of the above and I couldn't be more proud of such crew.please also note we had another Pur. pilled out as CSV his name was Tamer Ghany staff nb 240155 and he played an important role in calming customers, assisting the crew in both cabins

AMAZING CISTOMER SERVICE-Customer Mr. Njoro seated at 9E came to me personally to convey his appreciation and thanks to crew Miriam for her excellent service.-Customer told me that he alerted crew to check on his BLML when he boarded the aircraft.-Crew checked and mentioned that his meal was not loaded.-Customer mentioned he was upset at first but been convinced by Miriam that she will try her level best to accommodate to his request. He claimed Miriam asked him thoroughly regarding the meals that he can take since the BLML that he ordered was more to medical meal that advices by doctor in order to have fats, salt and spices free.-Crew prepared his meal which was salmon and ravioli and present it to him.-Customer was pleased with the presentation and the effort made by the crew.-Customer complimented Miriam for taking his request seriously and helped him to go out of her way to accommodate his request.-Customer complimented that Emirates should have more crew like Miriam so customers will feel appreciated and happy on board.
AMARULA OUT OF DATE;-it was observed that the Amarula in all bars were out of date.-Expiry date typed 11/0102017.

Allergens feedback Mrs. Solomons stated that she has allergy go mushrooms and she cannot eat the main course options as she doesn't know the ingredients Customer stated that her feedback is to put meal ingredients information in the menu or on ICE info section.

All the F/C customer's were personally greeted by the Purser at the door and escorted most of them to their suites.Established their request's for in flight as most of them wanted to sleep throughout.All the customer request's were met to delight them.
All pax happy with the service. All served as per the standards and dine-on demand manner.

All lunch crew meals loaded were ravioli 13 meal one only one salmon hot meal.Majority of the crew didn't want to eat the meals as its not a healthy option and not up to their liking.Kindly consider that if the pasta meal has any problem and all the crew ate the same meal it will become a safety issue.

All FC customers stated that the flight was enjoyable and they were happy with the crew. Mr. Loft 2A  found the veal a bit fatty but he did say he enjoyed it.Mr. Lakshman 2K mentioned Dom Perignon was not chilled enough- Champagne placed on ice.

All FC customers received the appropriate level of service.Mr Szczesny and Mrs Luczenkoszesna slept the entire flight and did not take the menus.the Woolley family were also accommodated and were happy at the end of the flight.
All F/C pax had very nice flight. Seven people had shower. They really love it. They believe that it the best part of the flight. It makes a such big difference.
All F/C pax had very nice flight. One of the SPA water temperature knob is not working. However we managed to let whoever request shower enjoyed the SPA. All pax were happy for the meal and service.
All F/C pax had a very nice flight. Four people had shower. They really love it.  Everyone ate on board. They liked F/C meal.

All F/C pax had a very enjoyable flight. No one had shower. Only 2A didn't like the Risotto,  she think it is dry and no taste. She also think the duty-free selection is poor. All  other pax like the meal. Crew provide excellent service.
All F/C pax had a nice flight. Crew provide high standard service.  Even some pax want to eat later. We served them after other pax ate.
All F/C pax ate on the flight. They all like the meal. Four people had shower. They love it. They all had a enjoyable flight.
All F/C pax ate on the flight. Six people had shower. They really enjoy that. All pax love the comfort for the suit. Everyone had a nice flight.
All F/C customers were happy with the service they had received on to days flight.

All Customers Complained about Food Option Provided During breakfast service some customers ordered the congee option. All customer asked to change their meal option stating that they did not know what congee was and that it was very bad.

All crew meals loaded in YC were Pumpkin Ravioli.There were only 2 soups loaded, both lentil.In FC there was one Pumpkin Ravioli and one Chicken hot meal.The meals loaded for the Flight Deck was hot breakfast, despite the flight timings.

All cabin crew except three pulled out crew were rostered for Aukland flight departing at 10:05On our way to EGHQ , we all had a change of duty to JFK departing at 12:30 as revised STD due to disruptions at JFK airport.Crew who already were at the briefing have checked in as the E-gate was open already and then the briefing counter had to offload the crew due FDP legalities . All crew arrived at EGHQ as per the check in time of Aukland flight and were fully dressed in uniform and awake.Crew were awake from 6 am and we landed in JFK at 3 am and we had a delay at the terminal for another 3 hours due to water leak at the terminal and disembarkation at a remote stand in JFK.Then Crew had to wait for the bus to arrive at terminal to pick up crew at departure level for another 45 minutes .To sum up , most crew were awake since 6 am and we reached the hotel in JFK at 8 am the next day DXB time with a minimum rest of 2:40 hrsCrew though tired , very apologetic to customer and inspirational with their smile and positive attitude .During disembarkation , they were also observed leaving soft drinks , juices and water at the galley counter at MLR2 door area to keep customers hydrated as customers were left stranded at a remote stand for 3 hours.

Aleksandar showed great motivation toward the skywards programme by volunteering to enrol customers.His actions inspired customer loyalty & raised awareness for the programmeHe displayed a high level of motivation during the flight. He was positive and professional which created a nice atmosphere for both his colleagues and customers. His overall attitude was positive and could be seen in the way he interacted with everyone around him.He always projected the highest image of the brand keeping excellence at the forefront of everything he did.
Alcohol expired.-Customer complained the Amarula tasted "bad".-Upon investigation discovered the product was expired in 2017.

ALA CARTE VEGETABLES-standard loading of one set of side vegetables for full first class -the one set has one of each vegetables so if two servings of vegetables desired crew unable to satisfy the request-Mr Aljabri our IO customer on 1K wished to have two servings of sweet potatoes mash as the main course and we were unable to meet his request which he found very disappointing

Afternoon tea shortage of hot snacks-Catering was 14-PAX load 14-Catered;3 Beef burger3 Selection of Savouries 3 Barley risotto.-1 customer was declined his 1st and 2nd Choice.-1 customer was declined his 1st choice.
After the service,Mr. Kibria was very happy with the service. He mentioned that crews were attentive and always delivered his request with smiles.

After take off Mr.guiga ordered the light bight, a salad and a beef pie.-cabin crew tsvetina delivered the food to his seat.- After delivering the food Mr. guiga called tsvetina again and asked her what kind of meal is that , and on his ticket it showing MEAL and he was unhappy.-the crew explained that after take off we are serving only light bites and the main  meal is the breakfast before we land.- Mr. Guiga said that for him the breakfast is not even a meal, and again he pointed to his ticket print out that is showing MEAL.- Mr guiga asked for bread, the crew informed him that we canot provide him hot bread at that moment and he needs to wait few minutes till we heat the bread.- Customer was upset and started aggressive and start hitting the table with his hand , he was shouting so  that the customers around him were telling him to stop yelling.customer came to me and apologised about his behaviour and thanked me for being a good listener and proffessional.customer had the breakfast meal.

After carefully observing Maurice Azar (384845) on EK 308/9 DXB-PEK-DXB, I must say compliments are due. I was truly impressed by his performance and leadership. Level of professionalism that was witnessed was at a highest level. Maurice's briefings are very interesting and of informative nature, and if I may say very personal, which proves his uniqueness. His interaction with crew is sincere and friendly. He leads by example, and is highly aware and responsible. He gives the impression that he can cope with any situation at any point in time and have full control over it. Hard working, friendly, reliable, resourceful, kind; only words of praise.Maurice is one of a kind. He inspired me and motivated me to strive and soar. Please make sure he is properly thanked for the amazing leadership on board the aircraft and professional conduct. I wish I fly with him again.

Adele was a great team player. Staring from briefing from Copenhagen as there was a disruption   In Copenhagen and only galley operators were allowed to get on the aircraft and Adele offered to help load the meals as it would be faster. She was also seen being very organized in the galley preparing for a smooth service. Preparing the items before hand for the bars being organised. She was given to operate the forward galley and she ensured the service was carried out smooth in the forward galley. Pilots were checked every half an hour as I was in the cabin delivering meals which gave me more time to interact with my customers. After the service she was seen preparing the we care and going in the cabin. She is extremely hard working organised and approachable with a very friendly attitude. She's very caring towards her colleagues and customers. She took initiative in writing the we care schedule.

Adam on both sectors was eager to assist the business class team after he had completed his own duties in economyAdam  assisted clearing service items and delivering DCFHe was attentive and polite to the customers and displayed a professional image

Adam Offered help in Economy during the refreshment service as it requires 8 crew in total to give me sometime to write my KIS reports. That displayed Adam's contribution in teamwork and going out of his way to help out his colleagues in different cabin. It was very much appreciated.

Acknowledgement of exceptional performance- Abigail Hartley (s411038) played a key role in turning the Hitchen's family negative experience into much more positive one.- Faced with flight cancellations, last minute holiday changes and wrong cabin seating assignment, the family was welcomed by Abigail with a friendly and honest smile. Abigail did not spare efforts in turning this family's experience, and built a strong and healthy rapport with them.

Acknowledgement of excellent performance- Crew Lee Lian Lau's (Vanessa) excellent performance was brought to my attention in two different situations on both sectors of this pairing. Her excellent skills and attentive care was mentioned by Mr. Mullany and Mr. Cook, both traveling in seats 01E/01F, traveling from AKL to DXB. According to them, this was their best flight ever with Emirates, mostly due to the care displayed by the entire team, specially Vanessa.- On the return sector, myself, J/C team and F/C team were challenged by a difficult situation involving a family of eight members who had their travel plans disrupted by flight cancellations and eventual downgrade to a lower cabin of travel. Vanessa and her team put the best effort in order to turn a very frustrating experience into a positive one. All family members were impressed by crew's effort and extra care, which made this trip a special one to them.

Acknowledgement for exceptional performance- Janet Khourie (s412664) was the most enthusiastic crew on this pairing, dedicating time, energy and positivity to every single element of this trip. - Janet did not measure efforts to assist me in taking care of the Flight Deck's needs, the team in business class in numerous tasks and her colleagues in First Class.- First class customers on both sectors were visibly delighted by the attention and care Janet dedicated to every single one of them. Mr. Cook and Mr. Mullany, travelling from AKL to MAN, could not spare words of appreciation for the personal and attentive way Janet treated them throughout the flight.- The Hitchen family, specially Mrs. Carly Hitchen who was traveling with little Archie, was enthusiastic to comment on Janet's performance, who did not measure efforts in order to make their journey a special one.

According to the menu Lamb shank was supposed to be served with mash potatoes.Instead of mash potatoes casserole had roasted potatoes with herbsMs Kambasha questioned the crew that why mash potatoes was missing from the plate.

According to the catering there was 60% Railway road curry and 40% Paneer handi lazeez, but when ovens were opened after take off it only had 10%Railway road curry and 90% Paneer option.Couple of customers did not get the Lamb option.
A thank you to Merle Kock 450502 as a language speaker helped us so much assisting the costumers that didnt speak english. Great with costumers the entire sectors

A HAIR FOUND FROM THE SCRAMBLED EGGS- During the meal service, customer found a hair from the scrambled eggs and complained to crew ANA 447351, and returned her meal.- Crew ANA witnessed it on the spot, and said that it was a black hair(around 4 cm size), located upper part of the casserole.- ANA claimed that she kept this returned meal in her cart, since she had to continue the meal delivery on that moment, however, we were not able to find the hair from it later.- Therefore, I was not able to fill out the foreign object form and to keep the meal inside the audit container.

A great display of Team Work and Spirit displayed by all crew.They assisted supervisors with galley functioning, attending to the call bells within 2-3minutes.Cabin and toilets also monitored by them too.Always had a Smile ON.Very polite and good in customer care too.

A FUTURE LEADER-I had the pleasure of working with Alanna both sectors.- She reflected a great performance from Dxb to Ncl operating the mid galley. Alana managed the galley , keeping it organized and tidy. She was two steps ahead for upcoming tasks.-Where Alana truly shined is her leadership skills. She managed the service flow, ensuring the team in the front of the cabin were following the rolling service. She ensured customers did not need to wait long for their hot beverage or clearance.- Alana was exemplary with the we care. She enticed the team members to follow the right sequence. The cabin and lavatories were tidy for our customers. She was also checking up on customers and tiding up the seats.- Alana passed the checks on time as she was multitasking when performing top of descent duties.- As I was boarding from L5 at NCL, I observed Alana warmly welcoming our customers and assisting them to their seats.-  Alana was professional the entire trip and clearly reflected importance and care for our customers.

The breakfast tray bread was different on every cart.    The bread was croissants or bagels.2) Breakfast main course Pepper Frittata 70% and Scramble eggs with herbs 30%.     Have to increase the scramble eggs 70% and pepper frittata 30%. Scramble eggs was the popular choice. 3) Tobasco and worchstershire not loaded in all Y/C bars.

Pls kindly note that the Braised Beef with horseradish was by far the most popular hot meal choice on the flight.2.On the other hand the Chicken with creamy mushroom sauce was highly unpopular.3.The ration catered for the flight was 70% Beef vs 30% chicken however the actual demand indicated more like 80% Beef and very few customers opted for chicken option.4.Few customers commented that they do not mind another choice when we run out of beef,however not the chicken with creamy mushroom sauce.

Pls kindly note that Achari Chicken (as written on the casserole foil) was loaded for the flight instead of Roasted Lemon Chicken with chimichurri and barley risotto with tomato and olives.2.The Achari Chicken was curry style and featured Basmati Rice instead of risotto.3.We were catered a total of 12 Achari Chicken casseroles and the rest of the catering was Nargisi Kofta (mutton) and Braised Lamb shanks.4.The Achari chicken was by far the most popular choice and the majority of the customers enjoyed it.5.There were 02 J/C premium cabin customers who preferred to have Roast Lemon Chicken (3A&3B).Those customers were offered alternative meals.

Original sector Mxp-Jfk.2.flight diverted to Yyz with a 25 hr stopover.3.We took the same aircraft and passengers the next day i.e. yyz-Jfk.4.NIL catering for this sector in any cabin.ie Yyz-Jfk5.Catering was however loaded for the following sector Jfk-Dxb from Yyz, as the same aircraft would stop in Jfk and carry on to Dxb.

I wanted to highlight Bhargav's performance on this flight, where he was seen being an exemplary crew member.Attention to Detail1.Observed him fold customer's blankets when they went to the toilet.2.Whilst pouring water/wine, an arm behind his back.3.Detailed description of menu items and wine was given to customers.4.Going with full duty free display asap after finishing the service without having been asked.5.Ensuring kids on his side of the cabin received toys in J/C6.Knowing all the names of his customers.Teamwork1.Helped the galley operator at various stages of the service as it was her first time doing it.Gave her suggestions, told her the correct service steps/flows/plating techniques.2.Offered to take left over meals on both sectors for Y/C crew.3.Doing final clearance on both sides of the cabin in J/C.Customer Service1.Spending time explaining customer at 3J how to operate the ICE.Taking out time to find them Bengali movies.2.Assisting me in transporting a paraplegic child to and from his seat to the aircraft door.

customers on 19A and 21C were emotional when thanking Eunji near the baggage carousel witnessed by me.She later described the whole journey experience which I felt was worth documenting.* While she was doing clearance, she overheard the conversation between these 02 customers.* She brought them 02 ginger ale as they were talking about stomach issues for which they were stunned.* Then she checked on their overall trip and found that it was their first time on EK, hence she offered to take a picture for which they were thrilled.* She then offered her iconic EK hat, which was emotionally received by 19A as she had applied for EK crew 4 yrs ago and failed. It was like her dream come true for which she couldn't thank her enough.* They invited her to their famous Coffee shop as a privileged guest in S.Korea.* At the carousel they wanted her phone no. to call and inform EK about her outstanding service.* She gave them her email address and also encouraged them to write on Emirates.com/feedback.

CUSTOMER COMPLIMENT LETTER I will type up the letter given to me by Mr.Atalla"I would like to write a complement to your service.I am 80 years old and I travel at least two times a year, that means I have been travelling with many companies.With your company at least 6 or 7 times.this time I was unlucky and spilled a red wine on my clothes.the hostess was so kind, they have tries there best and they gave me a sport Bartalon ( pants) so that I can wash mine.this good service was not expecting.this really the best service I have ever seen.this is sure not the last time I fly with Emirates.many thanks for yours stewardessescustomer signed the letter he wrote PS: excuse me for the writing mistakes, as I speak well English but I make mistakes by writing."quote end

PERSONAL AND CUSTOMIZED BIRTHDAY CELEBRATION - During boarding, cabin crew Jonathan overheard the passenger seated at 29D stating to the passengers seated next to her that it was her birthday.- Jonathan approached me after take off and offered to organize a little surprise for the customer to feel special for her birthday day.- Jonathan stated that the customer stated that she was " over the moon"  , that she was genuinely surprised and had a big smile on her face.- As I have flown several times with Jonathan, I wanted to bring to your attention the fact that he is a very thorough and dedicated cabin crew member towards his colleagues and customers.- Jonathan seems to always do his best to answer and anticipate customer's needs and requests erg. situations with special meals where Jonathan made sure he communicated the information with me and did his best for answering the customer's request.- Jonathan 's image and inform is impeccable at all time.

On this flight there was a major shortage of qualified crewshort of two grade 1 Two crew of economy was asked to operate as GR1This kind of mixed crew compliment posed a great challenge to the CRM, customer experience,  team work in the challenging time constraints environment with strong India customer profile to face above allIn my opinion the entire team displayed a great example of team work with good coordinationNo doubt there was a compromised customer experience due to this huge miss match of skill, experience but the team pulled it out very well, They all stayed calm hence this lead to better focus on the service deliver.

HVC compliments/Gold member/ 9 J , Mr. Mohammadvahid Moradimotlagh/IKA-Mr. Moradimotlagh boarded aircraft with two lady with a child. Offered Emirates toy selection and introduce myself using those toys to child. Child and Mr. Moradimotlagh both laughed.-Right after take off, his child started crying. I went to check if there is anything I can help.  Mr. Moradimotlagh explained that his child is crying because she is hungry.-Straight away served her meal first. -Her mother fall a sleep so without disturbing her sleep, I helped her child eating. Mr. Moradimotlagh's seat was separated by his sleeping wife so was not easy to access this child's table as well. -I helped this child to eat on the side through out.  and then after the meal, I played with her sometimes for a while as Mr. Moradimotlagh is having his meal. He said thank you many time.-On top of decent, he asked to call Purser to give his appreciation towards me.

Excellent Performance-Crew Mohamed Khillo had shown an excellent performance on flight EK 414 DXB-SYD. It was a pleasure having such a dedicated crew which was willing to work out of his comfort zone to support the team and his colleagues in order to achieve a successful flight. -Following are some of my observations:-Mohamed was the lounge operator & he took initiative to help with tray clearance in order for a smooth flow of service. -He ensured lounge was always clean, neat & tidy with food displays always replenished.He was always friendly & interacted with customers who visited lounge,created a nice experience with them by offering to take pictures of them as many of them were 1st time in A380 lounge. -He also communicated important customer information in order for me to follow up as at times, he couldn't leave the lounge. An example would be our gold member (7A:Mr. Lang) had accidentally stepped on some glass debris near the toilet galley area.He brought it to my attention & he was concerned. This allowed me to take proper follow up & service recovery action to check on Mr. Lang to make sure he is not injured. -The business class team had quite a challenge with the Lunch service before landing with a full cabin as we had to stood down one crew due to an injury. I had to reassign Mohamed to take over the buddy position on LHS.He was very professional,showed a great team work and worked efficiently to support this colleagues in that challenging situation.

Great performance._Csaba was great in business class galley management, knowledge and team work criteria_ Businesses class galley was neat and clean all time, Csaba prepared for the service steps ahead, soup and bread was warmed perfectly , clearance carts and service carts were prepared for his colleagues._ During the briefing, Csaba shared with his team all necessary information about Vienna destination and what needed to be done such as separation of glasses and cans and the fine that could be implemented if crew didn't follow the procedure, also shared the doors that can be open upon arrival._ Csaba made sure his colleagues were separating cans and glasses and reminded the lounge operator to do the same, he prepared two trash bags for this purpose._ After service finished in Business Class, Csaba made sure there were warm mugs and espresso cups for crew to use if customers wishes to drink hot beverages._ Galley paper work was ready on top of decent and was handed to me on time._ He then informed me that he will be in Economy Class to assist in service as service was finished in Business Class before Economy Class, his help was very much appreciated by his colleagues in Economy and also inspired his team in Business class to help other cabins when needed._ Csaba made sure galley was secured for landing on time and went to his jumps seat in Main Deck which helped passing the checks on time.

A very good team member -Thi played an important role to the success of today`s flight.-She kept an eye on the flight for the little things that made the difference to our customers and her colleagues. -On ground before customers boarded she was observing starting preparing for the pre departure duties without being asked while other colleagues were looking for the crew cart to have sandwiches.-After take I found out that the mixed minerals were already prepared in the bar by her.-Assisted me during the loading of the meals into the meal carts.-We care was done without prompting her.-Very polite when talking to our customers and colleagues. -Her team work and work load helped me a lot to satisfy the customers.

*Teamwork, Resilience and Professionalism*-Due to the shortage of 1 crew member, the workload of all the crew members was increased, especially on the CPT-DXB sector-Moreover, this caused a reduced rest on the CPT-DXB sector due to a full cabin and suspended service for about 15 minutes due to moderate turbulence-Despite all these factors, all the crew remained positive, worked very hard, and delivered the best inflight experience to our customers

*TEAMWORK AND CUSTOMER SERVICE*-This is the last sector of this multisector trip and I feel compelled to raise this KIS report to highlight Andreia's excellent performance -I am writing this on behalf of myself and the Y/class team-Once she her duties in F/class were completed Andreia volunteered to assist in Y/class on all four sectors of this trip, she double ended meal carts during meal delivery and clearance-But what really stood out was the way she assisted-Her colleagues stated that it was apparent that she was helping because she wanted to help, she was very humble about it and did not expect any praise in return-In F/class, Andreia was very observant of customers needs and preferences and thanks to this we were able to update several customer's preferences on their profile-On one of the sectors we had only one customer Mrs Galloway travelling in F/class for the first time, Andreia made sure that Mrs Galloway had an unforgettable experience by encouraging her to try everything we had to offer-Mrs Galloway was extremely happy-Andreia is very hard working, positive and professional-She was a great example to the rest of the team

*Team work*Due to light load in J class Lixian volunteered to help in economy during the breakfast service.  She also helped me tidy up the galley during the service. She made a positive impact on the economy class crew.
*Tarek assisted with Y/C service.Once finished his duties in J/C he volunteered to help in Y/C.He was observed double ending bars and assisting where needed.

*Supportive leadership and provide guidance-Koh Chin helped me to revise my medical incident report and gave feedback on the report writing, as he clearly pointed out the missing information and suggested a better way of documentation.-For leading team, he provided me with his experiences regards to how to address the feedback to crew members and how to follow up with HV customers with better approach.-Whenever I had concerns or questions, he made me feel comfortable to seek clarification from him.-He encouraged me in a positive way to improve my supervisor role and I felt very supportive from his leadership.-From MEL-SIN, Koh Chin worked as Purser as he lead the team in a professional way and continued to provide his support to me and another CSV.-I would like to highlight his exceptional leadership and positive influence towards the entire team.

*Suggestion of loading more smoked duck appetiser-During dinner service, 13 smoked duck appetisers were ordered and consumed.-Total load of customers were 38 with 3 CHML and 1 LCML.-11 Mediterranean seafood salad ordered.-10 Potato and onion soup ordered. (total loading for soup were 3 flasks)

*Stefan was observed to be a very professional crew member. He was always smiling and very positive in his approach towards his role as a cabin crew. Stefan is an excellent galley operator. Well organized and anticipates all preps for a smooth service. He was observed talking with his customers and his colleagues building a rapport with them every given opportunity. Stefan works well with his team and always offered help to others. A very considerate crew member who genuinely takes interest in his customers and colleagues and ensures to put a smile on their face. It was a pleasure to fly with Stefan and he was an asset to the team for the first flight of 2018. Thank you Stefan and good luck in your career progression and hope to see you as an onboard leader when the time and opportunity is right. Until then keep doing what you do best*

*RETURN TO STAND DUE TO GALLEY POWER OFF IN AFT GALLEY OF YC, DRY ICE LOADED*- Before take off it was reported to the engineer that the galley power in aft of YC was inoperative.- Before closing the last door, engineer liaised with the Captain that galley power should switch on when the aircraft's engines start.- During taxi, Captain liaised with Cabin Supervisor Atikilt (409292) if galley power was on (oven, brewer, air chiller, trash compactor) however it remained without power.- With the aft galley power off, oven won't work and we won't be able to heat meals for both sectors in the aft galley of YC.- Due to air chiller being inoperative, we can not ensure freshness of return sector meals and keep it chilled for the duration of the flight and time on ground in Amman.- Captain was advised that no meals can be requested or ordered from outstation with such short notice.

*PROMOTING TEAMWORK*- During briefing, I informed Benjamin and the other Cabin Supervisor that we were two crew short since the flight was going three class operating two class.- I had to assign two GR2s to L1 and R1 positions.- Business class cabin was also operating YC and they were booked with 39 customers.- I observed Benjamin showing consideration to the other Cabin Supervisor by offering to help her do the galley checks in the aft galley since there was no L5A position.- Before heading to the bus in HQ, there was a last minute swap of CSV as we needed an Arabic speaker.- As the new CSV joining us did not have much information about our briefing, Benjamin shared with him flight specifics and offered to assist him in any possible way.- During the flight, Benjamin was seen in YC cabin helping out with the service after completion of service in JC, delegating one GR1 to take over for clearance and we care schedule.- It was a pleasure flying with Benjamin who showed initiative and promoted teamwork during the flight reflected by his actions mentioned above.

*Professional behaviour.- Manuel displayed a great professional behaviour on this trip (DXB - MXP - DXB).- Despite the fact that one of his colleagues was showing him a bad attitude regarding the workload, Manuel kept professional and calm. - On the return sector, Manuel volunteered to work in Y/C to assist his colleagues as well.

*Great performance*-I would like to share the great performance of Mitchell on my flight going to DXB back from MAN, He is one of the most hard and most importantly efficient worker I have seen, here are some of the things he has done all of which I didn't tell him or prompt him to do:-Prior to boarding he gave the cockpit crew their meal and took their drink order.-Prepared the galley containers and wrote labels on them so we know what is behind each ones, and not wasting time looking for service items when needed.-During boarding, greeted almost all customers by name and helping them settling in.-After take off, prepared all service items and have it organized and ready for his colleagues for commencing meal service.-During service time, he was finishing his cart and then helping his colleagues doubling ending their cart with them and helping me in the galley loading the meals.-During the service customers were so happy and thanks him for his amazing service and great attention to them.-In both sectors he brought treats and food for his colleagues, bringing smile on his colleagues face.-All his colleagues in economy, me, the purser and other CSV has the same observation and were complimenting him.

*GREAT ON BOARD PERFORMANCE*- Tanita performed to all our expectations and standards as far as service excellence is concerned.- She took a lot of initiative throughout the flight e.g loading meal on the ground, assisting colleagues whenever she could, preparing for the service and We Care cycles on a timely manner.- Tanita really shines in the cabin when she strives to offer superb service to our customers. She made sure to get back to all customer who were not offered their meal choices with sandwiches and cut fruits while they waited for a meal to be heated.
*Great Flight Experience *All customers stated that their flight experience was excellent and crew were very attentive to them.

*Great feedback about the flight*-Customer told us that this was first flight with us and that he was very impressed.-Mr Neckerman stated that the crew were very attentive and professional and that the service was personal and great.-He complimented the aircraft features and the lounge.

*Great customer service*Gaby did a great job on this sector with a lady who was extremely anxious due to being seperated from her family member and recently having cancer. The lady was visibly upset, Gaby was on hand to show compassion and friendliness to ensure the customer was comfortable. I requested that Gaby try her best to sit the customers together and gave her several options. She tried her level best to talk customers into switching around but unfortunately the customers were not prepared to move for one reason or another. Gaby communicated with me at every step of the way and explained what she had tried to do. She explained to the customer that she had tried her best and the customer appreciated her efforts. Gaby is an extremely hard working crew member who follows instruction well. Every task given was smashed in a swift manner; she has a bubbly personality and works well as a team.I really appreciated her efforts in trying to accommodate the customers request during which was a very hectic boarding experience.

*Good performance crew *-Renata stff:444381 on our flight she was the language speaker, and I noticed her being very helpful with her customers and assisting them through the flight-She demonstrated that she is a very hard work crew member, and great team-player-First sector business was almost full and economy half empty, Renata offered her help for the second service in business class-As the service was demanding, we gladly accepted her help and she demonstrated very good j class Service skills, also she demonstrated fast learning skills -We had in j class traveling 3 gentlemen going for a bachelor party, Renata made sure to make their flight memorable and made them pictures, offered them cocktails and gave them tips what to visit and what to do in Budapest, her home country

Exemplary customer service*-I had the pleasure of working with Younis on this flight from Dxb to Jfk.-He displayed exemplary behaviour throughout the flight.-He was very caring towards his customers; I noticed that he likes to bring balloons on the flight for the children. Exceptional support and experience Cabin supervisor KIRANDEEP S377841*-Five hours into the flight Kirandeep who was working in JC was quick to arrive to the customer whose wife had fainted in YC-She handled the medical incident exceptionally well by using Tempus, co-ordination with the on-board doctor, crew and Medical services on ground.-Kirandeep also took me through steps of how to handle a medical incident which involved communication with the doctors, usage of tempus and medical kits which increased my confidence.-She also volunteered to do the paperwork and documentation explaining the whole process to me and kept me involved throughout the process since I am new to the cabin supervisor role.-Over all she is a very friendly, approachable, pro-active and hardworking leader.

Exceptional performance*-Youmna volunteered to work in business class on the return sector as Business class was full and economy wasn't.-She had an amazing attitude and took directions very well.-She assisted on both sides of the cabin, preparing the trays for delivery as well as drink orders and also delivering trays to customers. -Even though she has not been trained to work in Business class, Youmna was very attentive to details and made sure that service standards were followed. -She was also observed interacting with the customers in a very professional manner. -All her colleagues in Business class and myself were very impressed with her attitude and also great work etiquette.

Exceptional Performance*-Raouand showed positivity and genuine friendliness throughout the flight. She ensured that all the duties were cared out such as we care without being prompt.-Raouand engaed with customers on both sectors to go beyond expectations. She was seen to strike conversations with customers to get to know about them, such as finding out that there was honeymoon couple and provided information of what to do in KUL. exceptional performance-Mathias took initiative to manage aft galley during the lunch service, as he completed his meal cart and took over the aft galley management for the rest of service.-he prepared the meal cart into clearance cart up to standard and had tea/coffee ready for the team to conduct the service.-workload was equally distributed and galley was maintained tidy and organised.-

Exceptional  performance**I would like to praise cabin crew Rodrigue for his hard working and professionalism towards his work.*I had the pleasure to work  with Rodrigue on EK 448 DXB-AKL. 07/01/2018.*We had an unexpected flight due to operational raison.*In the briefing room I observed Rodrigue taking informations regarding the flight from my KIS tablet and share with the entire Y/C crew member.*Once on board Rodrigue prepared all pre-departures for the crew that helped a lot in finishing on time ground duties.*During Meals services everything was ready I did not have to set any carts nor prepare coffee tea ,that allowed me to go in the cabin and talk to my customers.*Customers were impressed with his knowledge about the products offered on board and how   proactive he was in responding to their needs.- I would like to thank again Rodrigue for showing enthusiasm in his work and spreading good atmosphere among customers and crew.

EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE*-I would like to commend Marie for her performance during this flight.-She volunteered to assist her colleagues in other cabins on both sectors without being prompted once.-Mr Sallier on the outbound sector, informed me that he had felt spoilt by the service he had received on flight to Melbourne and thanked the crew for the service.-As we had 5 children on this sector, during the first half of the flight, she assisted the parents with their children's meal by cutting the food into small portions and buttering their bread so that the children were able to eat by themselves and this was appreciated by them, .-Despite having a full load in First Class, she volunteered to assist in Business with their service after the customers in First Class was attended which was great help to them.-Her service in all cabins was very attentive to detail.

*Crew to crew compliments*-I would like to acknowledge the hard work, excellent communication, teamwork, and professional behaviour of the team.-Great communication to the customer who was offloaded because of alcohol intoxication.-Great teamwork during the flight by helping and assisting each other to make our customers happy.-Great good customer service, most of the customer was attended and  happy. No complaints was raised.- The team maintain the cleanliness of the cabin and especially the toilet.-The team was positive, approachable and happy to work with, which effect the environment during the flight.-Thank you for the Purser and Flight for the support during the flight.

*crew performance*Crew member Youssef Dakka staff number 430119 showed a high level of professional skills and excellent performance during both sectorsI had the pleasure of working with crew member Youssef for both sectors where he showed the following competences:- Youssef volunteered to be in charge of the galley tasks both ways which was given to him, service and delivery were done as per standards.-Youssef was dealing with any issue in the cabin, resolving it and communicating the result to me ,he was committed to his role respecting his senior and enthusiastic about his job-Youssef was seen smiling at all time toward his colleagues and customers, taking photos with customer and mocking with them in a professional way- Youssef is a crew member which you can depend on him at any time as much he showed trust and support to all his colleagues not just his senior-Youssef was happy to be given the chance to operate the galley at the back while his senior took his role in the cabin, he came and was very thankful for this chance and stated that he learned a lot  which will help him to develop his career in Emirates-Youssef is approachable and friendly crew, will always ask who need help. Take feedback positively and work on.-Youssef had all documents and papers ready on top of decent ( juice form, bars form, we care)  even Youssef ensured to help to complete a medical incident report

*Crew performance appreciation **The following were observed on crew member Louay 's performance.*Came into the briefing room with a positive warm approachable attitude, which he maintained throughout the entire trip.*Was knowledgeable, and up to date on the latest service and lounge changes. *Was observed engaging in conversation with customers while manning the lounge.*Was observed in the cabin during boarding, without being prompted, assisting customers.*Attempted to to assist his colleagues in the cabin whenever the lounge was empty of customers.*maintained immaculate image and uniform standards at all times.*Displayed the all of the above at all times throughout the entire trip, which contributed to a positive work environment.

*Crew member is pro active since the briefing breaking the ice with her colleges and sharing her experiences in the flight about our customers.*Crew member once we boarded she was preparing for the services by preparing tea and coffee pots, meal carts and the drawers of the prince.*In addition was helping our elder customers during boarding by introducing them our IFE and explain later the menu for them.*Gordana  is a role model to her colleges by always explaining to them the new express service steps and how to set up the carts, in addition helping in both galley by organizing  them and heparin the SPML with the CSV.*Gordana is always smiling even if she works under pressure and caring about her customers needs.
*Crew meals*-There were only three meals for five crew n Y/C-Two of them were Congee, one of the most unpopular among the crew-Crew didn't have much choice to eat

*Crew meals not enough*-On tonight flight we had in the crew cart in YC 3 hot meals for the crew and we are  8 working crew.-We had to leave home a bit after midnight and we are going to arrive after noon. That makes it around 12 hours and the only thing that we can eat on both sectors are breakfast meals and bread.-Suggest on this night flights to start loading lunch/dinner meals for the crew.

*CREW MEAL SHORTAGE*-insufficient amount of crew meals loaded (4 hot dishes, 8 sandwiches, fruit and yogurt for 8 crew members on a 10h 35min duty)-all crew required two hot meals while on this duty-sandwiches and fruit are not suitable to substitute lunch and/or dinner, especially on two very busy, full load sectors

*CREW MAKES CUSTOMER'S FLIGHT*-Customer pleasantly surprised after crew presents him with champagne and  a birthday cake put together from Business Class desserts.-Crew Sanja Imric 446367 had talked to the couple and found out that from the wife that it was her husband's birthday.

*Crew Ingrid S443995 excellent performance*-Ingrid is an outstanding performance with regards to taking initiative, communicated effectively at all the time.-Ingrid was seen using silver tray at all the time while passing through the cabin.-She also volunteered to take over the galley operation during cruise and kept the galley clean at all times ensuring the galley is secured and also prepared we care timely reminding the team members about the steps involved in we care.-She also wrote down defects in a piece of paper from all the crew and handed it to me.-Ingrid also pro-actively took over any task her colleagues were performing including call bells, preparation for service etc.-Upon speaking to the CSV Ahmad that worked with Crew Ingrid and shared some feedback on her performance from the first sector.The following is feedback from CSV Ahmad S404004.- On the first sector she always had initiative to attend any task or call bell and was service oriented (such as preparing drawers for the service, checking toilets, preparing for We care cycles... etc).- Although we divided the work load in a fair way she still stood out between her colleagues.- When one of the crew noticed that a French speaker customer is drinking from his own bottle of alcohol as a language speaker she spoke to him on my behalf with confidence and assertiveness and her body language and voice level clearly were professional, assertive, and polite.

*Crew compliments*- Mr Jagtap commented at top of descent that he would like to forward on his compliments to the crew for an "outstanding" flight.- Stated that he works in customer service himself and is highly appreciative of the small things the crew did on this flight that really improved his experience as opposed to his previous sector. - Upon enquiring what it was exactly that made this flight much more enjoyable for him he stated the crew was "extremely courteous and particular in ensuring I was comfortable and my needs were met" as well as "warm and friendly".- Stated he has a nut allergy and when he informed the crew on his prior sector he was informed that 'Emirates cannot guarantee nut free meals' and that this is stated on the website, and he should bring his own food if he has a nut allergy. Said "frankly it is unacceptable to tell a customer to bring their own food"- In comparison, upon telling the crewmember on this flight, the crew member was "understanding and accommodating" informing him again Emirates cannot guarantee any meals to be nut free, but made a recommendation off the menu for a meal choice and offered him alternatives such as fruit. - Crewmember who was primarily serving Mr Jagtap and was complimented for his "extremely courteous manner" is Keiran Ewald 436646

*Crew compliment*-It was observed that Tomas was very dedicated in his job. Despite being a long day at work, Tomas had a very positive approach and energy.-Was observed being very organised in the aft galley, preparing all pre departure service items well in advance for a smooth flow of the service.-Was very helpful to colleagues and tackled challenging situations.-Was observed helping ground staff(catering) in NBO for a quick organisation in the galley.-Was polite with customers and very pro active.-Also helped in j/C on the NBO-DXB sector.

*Crew compliment Viktor Zumsteg 421153* Customer Service*-Mr Kealy had boarded the aircraft and was complaining about the seat stowage and cleanliness of his seat area.-Viktor noticed his frustration and used his initiative to address Mr Kealy's complaints.-He arranged for another seat 6A and built a strong rapport with him.-He listened to Mr Kealy and ensured he felt acknowledged and well looked after.-Viktor was professional and he was impressed with Viktor's knowledge of aircraft specifics not only with Emirates aircrafts but also the other airlines Mr Kealy travels.-When I spoke to follow up with Mr Kealy, he gave great compliments regarding Viktor's attentiveness and customer service style. -Viktor had turned his bad flight experience into a very good flight experience.

*1. Amazing performance of EK980 IKA from the 27th of Jan.We were prepared for a standard turnaround flight of less than 2 hours and it ended up being very different.When arrived into IKA a snowstorm surprised us and in less than 15 minutes weather conditions became very adverse. At this time we were informed that we would board our customers, de-ice the aircraft and depart.Communication was always open and fluent between every cabin and team members were very proactive during boarding.Once we closed the doors for departure we stood by parked waiting for further instructions but the snowstorm was becoming heavier.After speaking with our customers and offer selections of drinks on every cabin, Cabin Supervisor Carolina Silva(s.40115), Purser Houssam Khoury(s.226446) and myself got the info from the our team that customers were hungry and distressed because of the situation. Since meals were prepared on ground and we were expecting a longer delay or even customers to be brought back to the airport decision was made of doing the service on ground.Our customers were showing us the weather forecast stating that the storm would last 24 hours so we tried to keep them busy with the service while waiting for more info.It was not possible to depart so they disembarked while we stayed for 3 hours trusting the situation would improve but we all ended up in the Novotel Airport Hotel, our customers and us.We stayed there 48 hours.

**Wrong loading of meals**. The loading of the meals for the Lunch/Dinner service was wrongly loaded.. The Grilled lamb sausages option was suppose to be loaded for 60% but was 70% instead.. The Chicken In black bean sauce option was suppose to be loaded for 40% but was only 30%. Around 20 customers requesting for Chicken in black bean sauce and didn't receive due to the lack of meal option.

**TING CHENG S437160 - excellent performance**Ting Cheng (Mandy) was praised for her excellent performance according to below observations :*Customer Service- Mandy is very present in the cabin during boarding and throughout the flight, she assisted several customers with IFE, mothers with children and any needed translation.- She was very attentive, as one customer was pale and was feeling dizzy. **SERVICE DEVIATION DUE TO CATERING CONFUSION***Catering staff initially claimed the AVML's loaded on the DXB/SEA sector were only for customers who had pre ordered AVML's.*According to the information received from catering, there were 88 AVML's requested, and 65 other SPML's all loaded in L5 GALLEY.*However, later catering staff himself was surprised to find out that, the mid galley ovens also had AVML's loaded, with grey covers and AVML stickers on them.*At this point the crew were informed that these AVML's were EXTRA by the same staff, which was contrasting with what we were informed before, (regarding AVML's all being laded at L5.)*Each oven in Mid galley had 10 AVML's, which left only a few regular meals in total.*The AVML'S that were supposed to be EXTRA, was not part of the menu choice, and their covers had the appearance of SPML's (GREY COVERS)*There was a delay in the Breakfast service, and a service deviation for lunch service to avoid further delay, due to the catering confusion and loading.*There was a shortage of regular meals in Y class.**Please kindly explain the method of loading AVML's on US flights for future reference, as this method of loading was never before experienced.

**personalized service**-Risa before teamtalk when arriving to the gate in the airport asked cabin supervisor for the details of high valued customers, special need customers, and children.-She has written all the details and shared with the team.-There was honeymoon cake catered for a couple seated in 30BC. She has created card with drawings and stickers that she carries on every flight. She has gathered the team to congratulate their wedding.-Customers were extremely pleased and thanked the team.

**Performance**-10 minutes before the main lunch service was about to start I had to deal with a medical case -The medical case was complex -Agustin took over the galley as soon as he saw me attending to the medical case -He took over without being asked -He took ownership and demonstrated great leadership skills -He did an incredible job -Service ran smoothly -No complaints -Galley was organized and tidy -The containers were sealed,  juice uplift forms and bar paperwork was done before top of descent without being reminded to do so

**Pastries and bread were stale**- During breakfast service, Mr Mahoney asked for an espresso with some pastries and a cold croissant.- He approached me, during the wine basket, telling me that the bread is stale.- Customer stated " that the bread tastes like its 3 days old"

**Overall performance**-Hyunji prepared the galley for the service since she boarded the aircraft and had time on her hands.-She was observed being always  ahead of the next step , preparing and assisting me and her colleagues.-She was observed using her Korean language skills to facilitate the journey to a group of Korean customers in yc.-She was observed briefing the customers in Korean without being prompted to prepare for the landing  phase and use the toilets if they need to before the time we needed to pas the checks.

**Outstanding Performance**-Outstanding performance cabin crew May Meade (380050) It is my pleasure to write to you and highlight the outstanding performance of one of your team members, May Meade (380050). -I appreciated the enthusiasm and the skills May displayed throughout the flight. I was most impressed with her pro-active nature in ensuring a successful and smooth flight with her colleagues and customers. - As it is 3 customers in first class for sector DXB-SIN, May worked with very little supervision act as CSV in Y class under CSV Jung Eun (380019) supervision.-May dealt with 1 medical incidents -Chest Pain in Y/C (DXB-SIN) which was handled very well and May took initiative to learn to document all paperwork efficiently with the supervision of CSV Jung Eun (380019).-May took the initiative to ask me the roles and responsibilities of the cabin supervisor. Under my supervision I went through with May the cabin supervisor duties and VR writing for the flight.-May is very customer focused and ensured that all the customers received the best in-flight experience with us. She was seen interacting with all the customers and knowing more about them to make their experience personal-May displayed good leadership qualities that is much needed in the progress of her career.

**Outstanding performance-Emily was observed working very hard on this sector.-Every time I turn around either she is doing extra round of checking cabin and lav or helping other crew.-She had to be stopped from doing anything to have a break, and to make sure rest of the team members have something to do as well.-It was obvious to see that she enjoys her work, and passionate about customer care. She did everything with such a positive attitude.

**Outstanding Performance CSV – Seo Hyun -397185 Flight EK 432/3 on 18 Jan 2018**-I appreciated the enthusiasm and the skills Seohyu-397185 displayed throughout the flight. I was most impressed with her pro-active nature in ensuring a successful and smooth flight with her colleagues and customers.-Seohyun is a very thorough Cabin Supervisor constantly communicating with her team and setting expectations, and monitoring performances. Her knowledge of the current standards with regards to service were impressive and she shared her knowledge with her colleagues. She is customer focused and ensured all customers received the best in-flight experience with us.-Seohyun displayed a great level of leadership and motivated her team consistently.  Seo used her briefing in order not only to highlight some of the expectations for the flight, but also to motivate the team to go beyond and look for opportunities to exceed customers' expectations. -Seohyun effective briefing had an impact on the crew who delivered an outstanding service. Team talks were done planned accordingly at different stages of the flight. Seo received positive comments from customers in Y class from sectors (DXB-SIN-BNE) and document accordingly.-Seohyun  was always in the cabin observing crew member performances and document accordingly. VR raised for outstanding performances- -Seohy dealt with 2 medical incidents in Y/C (DXB-SIN-BNE) which was handled very well and documented all paperwork efficiently.

**Outstanding performance by crew Cole Bertasso**-Cole was one of the key team players for success during a challenging flight.-We had three medical cases, in which Cole was observed: attending to a sick customer by providing oxygen right away, cleaning up after a customer felt sick, monitoring customer for progress afterwards.-During this time, Cole was also observed: checking for the rest of the customers comfort, making sure not only call bells were attended and 'we care' cycles were done, but also, spraying the cabin with air freshener, moving customers to other seats so they would be more comfortable, among other actions.-All of these duties were carried out with a positive attitude and a smile on his face the entire time.

**Great Team Player**-Antony Mansour 436652, was pulled out on reserve to operate as a GR2 on this flight-In JED the boarding was extremely challenging as customers were not comprehending English nor Arabic and everyone wanted to seat next to their family members-Customers started to sit anywhere which started to caused conflict when these seats were assigned to others customers-Antony was L2 and was observed to be very proactive in the cabin bringing customers to their seats, assisting with heavy luggage, calming customers down-Antony was literally observed to be assisting everywhere in the cabin making sure that everyone had a seat before closing the last door-Thanks to his hard work and efficiency we managed to finally assist most families-Wishing Antony all the best for his career progression

**Great Performance**-During the flight, Adriana received numerous compliments from her F/C customers in her section stating that it was the best flight of their lives-Platinum customer Mr Abdelsalam seated in 03E stopped me to ask me for a feedback card as he will be sending a compliment letter to Emirates Airlines-He mentioned that during his 20 years flying with us, he never experienced such an amazing service and care from a crew member-Adriana's warm personality and attention to detail was a great asset to this successful flight-Adriana was very attentive to her customer's needs as most of them were flying for the first time in F/C, she spent time with all of them to make sure they were comfortable and enjoying their Inflight experience-Thanked to her teamwork skills and her professionalism, we managed to go above and beyond Mr Murad's expectations who was seated in 01A-Mr Murad shared with me particular instructions about the way he wanted to be served during the flight including timing as well as specific meal and drinks orders. Wishing her the very best for her career progression
